They have been collaborating for a year with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso to satisfy the needs of their customers. They are on their second solidarity loan (group loan). The preceding loan was correctly repaid. They plan to use this loan to buy two dozen pieces of clothing for children, about twenty cases of soft drinks, and one 100-liter barrel of gasoline. They get their supplies locally in Sikasso from wholesalers. The goods are sold retail for cash in the marketplaces of Sikasso and in the district to customers composed of women and men.

They each hope to realize a monthly profit of 11,000 francs CFA. A portion of this will be used to pay the loan interest, to provide for the family, and to invest the rest in their businesses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy children's clothing, beverages, and gasoline

loans.name: Lafia (Le Soulagement) Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Lafia (composé de 4 femmes  mariées) ont une moyenne d’âge de 26 ans avec en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles resident dans le quartier  Hamdallaye de la ville de Sikasso(troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles exercent des activités commerciales différentes tels que : l’achat vente d’habits pour enfants, du savon de fabrication locale, du bois de chauffe et du sel de cuisine.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis 1 an et sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe).Le prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé. 
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 2 sacs de 100 morceaux de savon traditionnel (farakourouni), une douzaine d’habits pour enfants, des slips, un  chargement de camionnette en bois de chauffe et 5 sacs de 25 kg sel de cuisine Elles s’approvisionnent soit à Bamako (capitale du Mali),  ou sur place à Sikasso ville  et les villages environnants.
Les produits sont vendus en détail et  au comptant dans les marchés de la ville de Sikasso et dans les quartiers à une clientèle composée de femmes en majorité. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 10 000 FCFA par mois qu’elles utiliseront  pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the group Lafia (composed of four married women) average 26 years of age and two children. They reside in the Hamdallaye district of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They do different commerce-related work, such as: buying and selling children’s clothing, locally-made soap, firewood, and kitchen salt. They have been collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso for a year and are on their second solidarity loan (group loan). The preceding loan has been correctly repaid.

They intend to use this loan to buy two 100-piece sacks of traditional soap (farakourouni), a dozen childrens’ outfits, some underwear, a truck-load of firewood, and five 25-kg sacks of salt. They get their supplies either in Bamako (capital of Mali) or locally in Sikasso and surrounding villages.

The goods are sold retail, for cash, in the marketplaces of Sikasso and the districts to customers composed mostly of women. They each hope to realize a monthly profit of 10,000 francs CFA that they will use to provide for their families and to invest in their work.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy childrens' clothing, soap, firewood, and salt

loans.name: Elida

texts.en:
Elida is active member of a Bank of Hope outside of San Pedro de Macoris. She works as a street vendor selling various products. Her business provides for her three children, who attend the local elementary school.  All three of them are wonderful kids, full of energy and life.  

She would use this loan to add a supporting wall dividing her house into two rooms and to finish pouring her cement floor.  Presently, the house has only one room, and only part of the floor is cement.  Elida believes the cement floor and wall will greatly enhance her family's daily life and give her children privacy.  She plans to bring up her family in this house and wants her children to benefit from a stable shelter that promotes health and dignity.

Please support Elida with a loan.  Thank you!

loans.use: A supporting wall and part of a cement floor

loans.name: Danaya (La Confiance) Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Danaya (composé de 3 femmes  mariées et d’une célibataire) ont une moyenne d’âge de 25 ans avec en moyenne 1 enfant. Elles vivent dans des foyres polygames dans le quartier  Médine de la ville de Sikasso.(troisième région administrative da la république du Mali)
Elles  font essentiellement est la vente de pagnes wax (tissus très prisés en Afrique de l’Ouest) et real. En plus  de cette activité principale, elles font également la vente de condiments alimentaires et de la pâte d’arachide.
L’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso est en relation avec ce groupe depuis seulement  1 an. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe).Le premier prêt fut correctement rmboursé. 
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 6 pièces de pagnes wax et real, d’un baignoire de pâte d’arachide et 4 emballages de condiments alimentaires. Elles s’approvisionnent sur place à Sikasso auprès des commerçants grossistes et font leurs ventes en détail et la plupart au comptant dans les marchés de la ville de Sikasso, dans les quartiers et dans les foires des villages environnants à une clientèle composée de femmes.
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 16.500 FCFA par mois dont elles prétendent  utiliser pour payer les intérêts du prêt, aider leur mari pour certaines dépenses familiales et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Danaya group, made up of three married and one single woman) average 25 years old and one child. They live in polygamous households in the Médine neighbourhood of the city of Sikasso in Mali. These women sell mainly Wax and Real (brand name) "pagnes", which are highly prized in West Africa. In addition to this main business, they also sell food condiments and peanut paste. The microfinancial institution Soro Yiriwaso has been working with this group for only one year. This is their second group loan. The first loan was fully repaid. They will use this loan to buy six lengths of Wax and Real "pagnes", a tub of peanut paste and four packages of condiments. They purchase their products locally in Sikasso from bulk resellers and then retail mainly to women at the markets of Sikasso, in the neighbourhoods, and in the markets of neighbouring villages. They hope to each make a monthly profit of 16,500 FCFA which they will use to repay the loan interest, to help their husbands with some of the household expenses and invest the rest in their businesses.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy Wax and Real "pagnes" as well as foodstuffs such as condiments and peanut paste.

loans.name: Ana Luisa

texts.es:
La señora Ana Luisa M. G. es casada, tiene 2 hijos, ellos tienen 24 años de vivir en su hogar, ella tiene un negocio de venta de alimentos llamado “Taqueria Petra” que lleva 6 años operándolo y le proporciona buenos ingresos.
La señora Ana Luisa está solicitando un préstamo para terminar de construir el baño y los acabados interiores de su casa ya que es necesario terminarlos de construir, este préstamo lo usará para comprar materiales y contratar mano de obra, para que de esta manera ella le pueda ofrecer a su familia un hogar optimo para vivir adecuadamente.
texts.en:
Ana Luisa M. G. is married, has two children, and has lived in her house for 24 years. She has a business selling prepared foods called “Taqueria Petra” which she has been running for six years; it provides a good income. Ana Luisa is requesting this loan to complete the building of the bathroom and doing some finish work for the inside of her house, as it it necessary to finish construction. This loan would be used to buy materials and to hire laborers to do the work and, in this manner, she can offer her family an optimum home and an adequate place to to live.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To complete building of a bathroom and some interior finish work for her house.

loans.name: Finesse Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Finesse (composé de 5 femmes toutes mariées)ont une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans avec en moyenne 1 enfant. Elles resident dans le quartier  Médine de la ville de sikasso(troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles exercent différentes activités commerciales mais la plus dominante est la vente du bois de chauffe puis la vente de  savon de fabrication locale et de l’huile alimentaire. 
Afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle de plus en plus croissante les femmes de ce groupe collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a 1 an. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). Le prêt précédent a été correctement  remboursé.
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 1 chargement de camionnette en bois de chauffe, 4 bidons de 20 litres d’huile alimentaire et 3 sacs de 100 morceaux de savons traditionnels. Elles s’approvisionnent soit à Bamako (capitale du Mali),  ou sur place à Sikasso auprès de grossistes. Les produits sont vendus en détail et  au comptant dans les marchés de la ville de Sikasso, dans le quartier et à domicile à une clientèle composée de femmes et de quelques hommes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 19 000 FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt,subvenir aux besoins de la famille et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the "Finesse" group (made up of five married women and one single woman) are 30 years old and have one child each on average. They live in the Médine neighbourhood of Sikasso in Mali. They have different businesses, but mainly sell firewood and locally-made soap and cooking oil. To satisfy the ever-increasing demand of their customers, the women of the group have worked with the microfinancial institution Soro Yiriwaso for a year. This is their second group loan; their previous loan was repaid in full. They will use the loan to buy a truckload of firewood, four 20-litre vats of cooking oil and 3 100-piece bags of traditional soap. They purchase their goods either in Bamako, the capital of Mali, or locally in Sikasso from distributors. They retail their products in the markets of Sikasso, in their neighbourhoods and at home, mainly to women and to a few men. They hope to each make a monthly profit of 19,000 FCFA which they will use to pay the interest on the loan, take care of their families' needs and invest the remainder in their businesses.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood, soap and oil for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy vegetables and fruit for resale

loans.name: Sindiya (Fraternité) Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Sindiya (composé de 4 femmes  mariées et une celibataire) ont une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans avec en moyenne 1 enfant. Elles resident  dans le quartier  Ouayerma II dans la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mal).
Elles  exercent des activités commerciales différentes mais les plus dominantes sont la vente du bois de chauffe, la vente d’habits  auxquelles s’ajoute la vente d’oranges et divers petits articles.
Afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle de plus en plus croissante les membres de ce groupe ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle, ils sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe).Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 5 chargements de charrettes  en oranges, 2 chargements de camionnette en bois de chauffe, 2 douzaines de vêtement  pour enfants, 2 balles de friperie et 3 paquets d’articles divers. Elles s’approvisionnent soit à Bamako (capitale du Mali),  ou sur place à Sikasso et dans les villages environnants auprès des paysans producteurs.
Les produits sont vendus en détail et  au comptant dans les marchés de la ville de Sikasso  et à domicile  à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 15 000 FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
The members of the Sindiya group, made up of five married women and one single woman, are on average 32 years old and have a child. They live in the Ouayerma II neighbourhood of the city of Sikasso in Mali. They have a variety of businesses, but their main income comes from selling firewood, clothing, oranges and a variety of small articles. To satisfy their customers' increasing demand, the member of this group decided to join the microfinancial institution Soro Yiriwaso with which they are now at their fifth group loan. All previous loans have been fully repaid. They will use this loan to buy five cartloads of oranges, two truckloads of firewood, two dozen of children's clothing, two bales of used clothing and three packages of various articles. They will buy their goods either in Bamako (the nation's capital) or locally in Sikasso and from neighbouring villages, from the farmers themselves. They sell their products retail and for cash in the markets of Sikasso and from home, mainly to women and men. They expect to each make a monthly average profit of 15,000 FCFA which they will use to pay the interest on the loan and to support their families.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood, children's clothing, used clothing, fruit and various articles for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy goats for slaughter

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
El señor Arturo P. O. es casado, tiene 5 hijos, ellos tienen 2 años viviendo en su hogar.
El señor Arturo ya tiene 11 años trabajando en una empresa industrial el cual le deja muy buenos ingresos los cuales son necesarios para mantener a su familia.
El señor Arturo P. está solicitando un préstamo para construir acabados interiores y terminar un baño, (En la fotografía no aparece el señor Arturo P., sino aparecen su esposa y 3 de sus hijas), este préstamo se utilizará para comprar materiales y contratar mano de obra, para que de esa manera el señor Arturo y su familia puedan vivir adecuadamente en su hogar.
texts.en:
Arturo P. O. is married, has five children, and has lived in his house for two years. He has worked for an industrial enterprise for 11 years which provides the necessary income for him to support his family. Arturo P. is requesting this loan to do some interior finish work to his house, as well as to complete a bathroom (Arturo does not appear in the photograph; instead his wife is shown with three of his children). The loan would be used to purchase materials and to hire laborers to do the work, and this would help Arturo and his family to live more adequately in the home.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To complete some interior finish work and a bathroom for his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy spare parts for resale

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
El señor Daniel R. C. es soltero y tiene un negocio de venta de abarrotes y carnes llamado “Mini Super Hermanos R.” el cual lleva 26 años de operación, este negocio lo obtuvo como herencia de su papa y es manejado por él y sus hermanos.
El señor Daniel R. está solicitando un préstamo para comprar mercancías para surtir el negocio debido a que tienen muchos clientes.
texts.en:
Mr. Daniel R. C. is single and has his own meat and groceries business. His business name is "Mini Super Hermanos R." and its been in business for 26 years. He inherited this business thru his father and its managed by his brother and him.

Mr. Daniel R. is requesting a loan in order to purchase merchandise for his business, since he has a lot of clients.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for his business

loans.name: Colaboradores Group

texts.en:
Maely C. is the group coordinator for the Colaboradores Bank of Hope in San Pedro de Macoris. The loan amount will be shared among the nine members of the group, who run various businesses.  

Maely has six children.  She runs a catering business and needs to replenish her supplies to keep serving meals.  She hopes to keep running her own business and to provide for her family.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for catering business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To rent a store and supply it with merchandise

loans.name: Primary School In Makeni Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of a Primary School in Makeni. It was founded in 1974. Today, it has a total of 750 pupils with a staff of twenty-three teachers. Since its inception in 1974, the school has produced many of the professionals in town and the country at large.

This Primary School continues to prove itself in both the academic arena and in sport. Ninety-eight percent of the pupils they sent last academic year for the National Primary School Exams (NPSE) had clear passes. This academic year, they expect to have a 100% passes at the NPSE.

This is the first loan the school is seeking from SMT.  With this loan, they will be able to invest in some petty-trading in order to supplement their monthly salaries. Some however will use theirs to either buy pieces of furniture or in constructing houses. This loan will definitely improve the economic status of these teachers. 

John B. C. (left) is the head teacher of this school. Mr. C. was born in Kamalo village, about forty-seven miles from Makeni. He is fifty-five years of age, married with six children between the ages of two and thirty-four. John is currently building a second home for himself.  He will use his loan to buy building materials to continue with the building process. This house will consist of three bedrooms, a parlor, a store and a toilet. Once he is finished building it, it will be an estimated value of Le 10,000,000 – Le 11,000,000 (approx. US$ 3000 – US$ 3600).

loans.use: Buy building materials

loans.name: Esperanza Y Progreso V Group

texts.en:
Maria B. is the group coordinator for the Esperanza y Progreso V Bank of Hope in San Pedro de Macoris. The requested loan will be distributed among the nine members of this group, who run various businesses. 

Maria has seven children. Her business is selling fried foods. She would use her portion of the loan to purchase supplies. Her dream is to open her own restaurant where she would server her fried chicken and other dishes and in this way become self-sufficient.  Thank you for supporting this group!

loans.use: To buy supplies for a catering business

loans.name: Njala Agriculture Research Group

texts.en:
These are staff of NARC – Njala Agricultural Research Center. There are eleven in their unit, and they are field workers. NARC was established by the government over twenty years ago. Then, it was called Institute of Agriculture Research. As the name suggests, NARC’s primary job is to carryout research for the improvement of planting materials. They teach farmers (the majority of whom are illiterate) new farming techniques and the use of new technologies and farming systems. They also teach people how to process food crops for consumption. In addition to these, they also plant and provide planting materials to farmers throughout the country. The major challenge they face in their work is the lack of willingness on the part of the farmers to come for training. Some of the farmers prefer doing their work in the old and primitive way.

This is the first time NARC (this Unit) is getting a loan from SMT. Others from NARC already got a loan from SMT months ago and successes stories of those loans have inspired this unit to also come for a loan. Fatmata B. T. (left) is the leader of this group. Fatmata is twenty-eight years of age. She is single with two children. One is in class one and the other is not of school age. She was born in Yoni, Tonkolili district, northern Sierra Leone. With her Le 1,000,000 loan, she will invest in business. She has been in the gara lapper (locally dyed cloth) business for the past two years now. (In front of them are a number of yams.)

loans.use: Invest in business

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
La señora Guillermina S. Z. esta separada de su esposo, tiene una hija pequeña, ella tiene un negocio de venta de artículos eléctricos llamado “venta de televisores usados” el cual es atendido por ella y le proporciona ingresos los cuales son necesarios para mantener a su hija, además recibe otros ingresos por concepto de pensión alimenticia por parte de su ex-esposo.
La señora Guillermina S. está solicitando un préstamo para comprar un lote de televisores para la venta o para vender las partes de estas mismas a los talleres eléctricos como refacciones usadas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Guillermina S. Z. is separated from her husband, has a small daughter and has her own electronics business which helps her support herself and her daughter. She sells used televisions as a way of living and also gets alimony from her ex-husband.

Mrs. Guillermina S. Z. is requesting a loan in order to purchase more used televisions. She will use these to sell their parts.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of televisions for parts

loans.name: José Guadalupe

texts.es:
El señor José Guadalupe M. es casado, vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos, el señor José M. tiene un negocio de reparación de lavadoras y de aires acondicionados llamado “Refrigeración M.” el cual lleva en operación 18 años y es atendido por él.
El señor José M. está solicitando un préstamo para comprar lavadoras usadas para repararlas y posteriormente venderlas, ya que este negocio es la principal fuente de ingresos del señor José M. con los cuales él mantiene a su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. José Guadalupe M. is married, lives with his wife and 4 children. He has his own washing machine and air conditioners repair business called “Refrigeración M.", he's been in business for 18 years and he runs it himself.

Mr. José M. is requesting a loan to purchase used washing machines. He will then repair them and then re-sell them. This is his main source of income which he uses in order to support his family.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of used washing machines in order to repair them and re-sell them

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Juan Manuel G. H. es casado, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos, ellos tienen 5 años de vivir en su hogar, el señor Juan Manuel G. trabaja actualmente como en cargado de planta en el cual trabaja desde hace 6 meses.
El señor Juan Manuel está solicitando un préstamo para comprar vitropiso e instalarlo en su casa, (En la fotografía no aparece el señor Juan Manuel, sino aparecen su esposa y sus 2 hijos). Estas mejoras a su hogar permitirán que el señor Juan Manuel y su familia tengan un hogar óptimo para vivir.
texts.en:
Juan Manuel G. H. is married; he lives with his wife and two children. They have been living in this house for the past five years. Juan Manuel G. is currently working as a plant supervisor, a job he has held for six months. Juan Manuel is asking for a loan to buy and install floor tiles in his home. Juan Manuel was unavailable at the time the picture was taken, so his wife and two children were photographed instead. These home improvements will ensure that Juan Manuel and his family have an optimal home in which to live.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy floor tiles.

loans.name: Creciendo Hacia El Futuro Group

texts.en:
Colacina S. is the group coordinator for the Creciendo Hacia el Futuro Bank of Hope. The loan will be divided among the nine people in the group, who run various businesses.

Colacina has three children. She operates a grocery store. She plans to use her portion of the loan to restock her grocery. She wants to expand her business and increase her daily profits. Thank you for your interest in this group!

loans.use: To restock a grocery store

loans.name: Milka

texts.es: Milka tiene 37 años, hace 23 años que viene conviviendo con su pareja, y fruto de ese amor tiene 4 hijos, esta familia vive en su casa propia. Tiene un negocio de cabinas públicas de Internet y servicio de fotocopias, el que realiza en un local de su padre, por ser un lugar céntrico y atractivo. Cuan empezó no tenia mucha competencia y ganaba muy bien, pero últimamente han aumentado sus competidores, debido a ello ha bajado su nivel de ingresos, pero está contenta porque algunos de sus clientes que se habían ido a la competencia han regresado. Es por ello que en este negocio se mantiene más de 15 años, todo este tiempo logró superara las dificultades cuando se malograban sus fotocopiadora y no tenía cómo repararlas, entonces fue ahí que su esposo se vio forzado en tratar de solucionar las maquinas. Forzado a tratar de arreglar las máquinas, su esposo comenzó a ver sus fallas y ahora ya es técnico de fotocopiadoras y experto en realizar las limpiezas de sus computadoras. Desde entonces es el encargado del servicio técnico y a veces también, le traen sus vecinos sus computadoras para que les cargue algunos programas, y este servicio les sirve como ingreso adicional. Milka está muy contenta porque a pesar que es tiempo de vacaciones escolares, cuando baja su clientela, su negocio le es rentable, a la semana logran sacar líquido 300 soles, mientras que en épocas de clases llega hasta 500 o 580 soles por semana. Milka es una socia muy comprometida con su banco comunal en el que viene desempeñando el cargo de tesorera, y ya tiene dos préstamos consecutivos que viene recibiendo de MFP, y todo este tiempo ha pagado sus cuotas en las fechas fijadas. El dinero que ha solicitado es para la compra de papel, de repuestos para sus fotocopiadoras y computadoras y el toner para las fotostáticas.
texts.en:
Milka is 37 years old and has been living with her partner for 23 years. They have four children and live in their own place. Milka has her own public internet and xerox machine business. She runs her business from her father's place, mainly because its located in a good spot and its appealing to the eyes.

She didn't have much competition before but this has changed as of some years ago. Her earnings have gone down but she's happy because some of her former clients have returned.

They have kept this business for over 15 years and her husband has been forced to learn all about repairs for these machines. He has become a technician and is an expert at keeping these machines clean. Since then he's the service technician and even uploads programs for his neighbors! This brings him an additional allowance.

Milka is very happy although students are on vacation and her number of customers goes down. Her business is rentable and she's able to get 300 soles a week. Sometimes during the school year she is able to make somewhere from 500to 580 soles a week. Milka is a commited partner to her bank, which she has been serving as a treasurer. She has been receiving two loans from MFP and has been making the payments on time. The loan she is requesting is to be used to purchase paper and toner for the copier machine.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of paper and toner for her copier machine

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos, D. 45 años D. edad es casada hace 30 años, tiene 9 hijos, D. los cuales 3 (los menores) viven con ella en su casa propia. Hace 30 años que llegaron a la selva en busca D. trabajo, jamás pensaron quedarse en ese lugar y mucho menos adquirir un terreno donD. hizo su casa y el resto D. las extensiones las han convertido en un lugar apropiado para cortar y trozar árboles convirtiéndolos en madera para obras, y finalmente con calaminas hizo un cerco destinado para almacenar las maderas. El trabajo D. Santos y su esposo consiste en trozar la madera en pulgadas D. 2, 3 y 4, D. ancho y D. largo D. 3 metros con 40 centímetros, una vez que tiene acumulada la madera Santos la ofrecer a las carpinterías, generalmente, en la mayoría D. las veces trabajan a pedido. Santos es la que administra la contabilidad del negocio y su esposo es el encargado D. traer los árboles y convertirlos en madera, D. ese modo vienen trabajando más D. 12 años, actividad que le es rentable que les permite sostener a su familia. Además, en horas D. la tarD. Santos prepara chicharrones (cerdo) D. 35 a 40 porciones que venD. a 1.50 y 2 soles, con esto lleva cerca D. 6 años, y también le es muy rentable, mientras que se dedica a la venta D. chicharrones va acumulando las maderas para hacerlas secar, y D. ese modo cotizar a un precio mayor que las húmedas; ya que los carpinteros buscan las secas para que cuando fabriquen sus muebles no se doblen. Este es su 5to préstamo consecutivo que viene recibiendo Santos D. MFP, ha pagado sin dificultades sus cuotas, y asimismo se compromete a seguir trabajando con su banco comunal como lo hay venido haciendo hasta ahora. El dinero solicitado es para la compra D. árboles para empezar a trozarlos, y D. ese modo tener capital en madera e ir vendiéndola D. acuerdo a los requerimientos.
texts.en:
Santos, age 45, has been married for 30 years. She has nine children; the three youngest live with her in the home she owns. Thirty years ago, they went to the rainforest looking for work, never thinking of staying there, much less of buying land where they would make their home and convert the rest of the buildings into an area where trees could be cut and split, to convert them into lumber for woodworking. She also maD. a zinc fence in order to store the lumber. Santos and her husband work splitting the wood into 2, 3, and 4-inch width timbers which are 3.40 metres long. Once they have a good stock of lumber, Santos offers it to carpenters although they usually work to order. Santos is the bookkeeper for the business and her husband is in charge of bringing the trees and turning them into lumber; they have been doing this work for more than 12 years as it is a profitable business allowing them to support their family. In addition, Santos prepares between 35 to 40 portions of pork cracklings in the afternoons, which she sells for 1.50 to 2 soles. She has been doing so for roughly six years; this too is very profitable, as while she is selling the cracklings, she gathers the wood to dry it so that they can ask for a higher price than if the wood were still humid: carpenters always look for dry lumber when they make furniture as it will not warp. This is Santos' fifth consecutive loan from MFP: she has always maD. her payments without difficulty and is committed to continue working with her community bank as she has done until now. The loan will be used to buy trees for splitting, so that she will have equity in the lumber and have it ready for sale when her clients need it.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy trees for splitting and resale.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: Teodora tiene 47 años de edad, es casada hace 27 años, y madre de 8 hijos, actualmente vive con 3 de sus hijos menores, y con dos de sus nietas, en su casa propia. Desde muchos años atrás viene trabajando como ama de llaves, en la casa de la alcaldesa de la municipalidad de su localidad, de lunes  a viernes de 7am hasta las 5pm. Teodora trata de realizar con mucha eficacia y rapidez su trabajo, para darse unas horas libres para preparar los alimentos en su casa para su familia. Los sábados y domingos trabajar en la carpintería junto a su esposo, quien es un carpintero reconocido y próspero que en ciertas oportunidades recibe contratos grandes, entonces le falta mano de obra para el acabado correspondiente, y se ve obligada a trabajar Teodora y a buscar ayuda de una amiga suya, quienes son las encargadas de realizar el lijado y el laqueado hasta darle el brillo a cada bártulo que fabrican. Teodora y su esposo en todo este tiempo de convivencia han tratado de trabajar en armonía  en la fabricación de los muebles, con la finalidad de llegar a convertirse en una mueblería muy reconocida en su zona, y que sea una actividad muy rentable para que cuando crezcan sus hijos se dediquen a ella. La carpintería por el momento les es muy rentable y más cuando reciben contratas de varias instituciones. Actualmente Teodora es la presidenta de su banco comunal, donde viene recibiendo su 5to préstamo de MFP, y todo este tiempo no ha tenido problemas en realizar los pagos correspondientes. El dinero que solicita es para invertir en los insumos para su carpintería como son; lacas, tiner, lijas, y madera; con la finalidad hacer crecer su capital y no tener necesidad de insumos cuando tenga que realizar el acabado de los muebles.
texts.en:
Teodora is 47 years old. She has been married for 27 years, and is the mother of 8 children. Currently she lives with the three youngest of her children, and with two of her nieces, in her own home. For many years she has worked as a housewife in the house of the mayor’s wife. She works from Monday to Friday from 7am until 5pm. Teodora tries to do her work efficiently and quickly, so she will have free time to prepare the food in her own home, for her family. On Saturdays and Sundays she works in the carpentry shop alongside her husband, who is a well-known carpenter, and has prospered through certain opportunities when he received large contracts. Then he lost a worker and correspondingly stopped. He was obligated to have Teodora work and to look for help from a friend of hers, whose job it is to do the sanding and polishing until each piece they make shines. Teodora and her husband in all their time of living together have tried to work in harmony making furniture, with the end of being able to make it into a well known furniture shop in the area, and so have a profitable activity so that when their children grow up they will work there too. Carpentry at the moment is very profitable and they have received contracts from several organisations. Currently Teodora is the president of a community bank, where she has received 5 loans from MFP, and in all this time she has not had problems making the corresponding payments. The money that she is asking for is to invest in the materials for her carpentry shop, such as lacquer, thinner, sandpaper, and wood, with the goal of growing her capital and not to not be in need of materials when she has to finish the furniture.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials for her business

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 34 años, convive con su pareja más de 10 años, de los cuales tienen 3 hijos, ahora viven con un de ellos mientras que los otros 2 sus hijos estudian en otra ciudad, por el momento viven en la casa de su madre, no cuentan con una casa propia. Desde hace 10 años ha trabajado en la venta de golosinas, todo este tiempo esta actividad le ha sido rentable, lo que le ha permitido educar a sus hijos y cubrir los gastos de su hogar. Por el momento el negocio está a cargo de su hija mayor Nayeli, su esposo trabaja en el transporte de pasajeros con su motocarro y Carmen hace dos años se ha decidido salir al parque de la ciudad con la venta de chupetes de hielo y helados, vende desde las 10.00am hasta 6 a 7:00pm dependiendo si hace calor se queda hasta más tarde, adicionalmente ofrece bolsitas de popcorn. Desde muy niña se ha dedicado al comercio, sus padres eran negociantes ambulantes, desde entonces para ella el trabajo en la calle es lo más gratificante. Las ganancias que obtiene, aparte de sustentar su hogar son para pagar los estudios de su hijo en un instituto en otra ciudad, la habitación que alquila y su alimentación diaria. Por el momento Carmen esta muy acongojada por la enfermedad de su padre, ella trata de dar todas las medicinas que necesita para que se recupere, y su felicidad se completa. En el ciclo pasado era secretaria en su banco comunal, este es su segundo crédito con MFP y sigue con el mismo compromiso de pagar sus cuotas en las fechas fijadas. La suma que solicita es para la compra de golosinas, 500 soles le ha prestado a su esposo para que pueda comprar llantas nuevas para el motocarro, y finalmente con el resto del dinero comprará yogurt para la preparación de sus chupetes y los helados.
texts.en:
Carmen is 34 years old. She has lived with her partner for more than 10 years. They have 3 children, now they live with only one of them while the other two children study in another city. For the moment, they live in the house of her mother, they don’t have a house of their own. For the past 10 years she has worked selling sweets. All this time this activity has been profitable, and has permitted her to educate her children and cover the expenses of the household. At this time the business is for her eldest daughter Nayeli. Her husband works transporting passengers in his motorcar, and it has been two years since Carmen decided to go to the park in the city to sell popsicles and ice-cream. She sells from 10am until 6 or 7 at night, if it is hot she will remain later, and also offer bags of popcorn. Since she was very young she has worked as a businesswoman. Her parents sold in an open air market, and since then, for her the work in the streets has been the most gratifying. The income that she gets, apart from sustaining the household, has paid for the studies of her son in an institution in another city, the housing he rents, and his daily sustenance. At the moment Carmen is very aggrieved by the illness of her father. She tries to give him all the medicine he needs so he can recover, and her happiness would be complete. In the past Circle she was the secretary of her community bank. This is her second loan with MFP and she continues with the same amount to repay her instalments on fixed dates. The sum that she is asking for is to buy sweets, 500 soles that she will loan to her husband so he will be able to buy new wheels for his motorcar, and finally with the rest of the money she will buy yogurt to make her popsicles and ice-cream.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.es: Benedicta tiene 50 años de edad, ella es madre de 4 hijos, el mayor está en estudios técnicos y los menores están de vacaciones. Hace 10 años vendía caldo de gallina por las noches en la esquina de un parque cercano a su casa, negocio que dejó porque habían bajado las ventas y ya no le era tan rentable. Entonces se vio obligado a cambiar de rubro con la venta de bebidas preparadas a base de maca, quinua y soya acompañadas con panes con queso, con pollo, con huevo, o hamburguesas, en el parque de la ciudad de Santa Ana. Por el momento este negocio le es muy rentable, al día vende aproximadamente 50 soles solo en los panes, también vende diversas golosinas con lo que obtiene otros ingresos. Su esposo vende fruta, rodajas de sandía a 50 centavos de sol, sus únicas herramientas de trabajo son su triciclo y un cuchillo para pelar y tajar las frutas. En horas de la mañana Benedicta se dedica en freír los huevos, cortar los quesos, sancochar el pollo etc., asimismo preparar las cremas para complementar los sándwich, y a partir de la 1pm empieza la venta hasta cuando termine todo, llega  a su casa eso de las 11 de la noche o 12. La dificultad es que a veces que no termina de vender, entonces para el día siguiente ya no sirve lo preparado, pero a pesar de eso está contenta con este negocio porque siempre le deja mayores ganancias a comparación de los caldos que antes vendía. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de golosinas y los insumos e ingredientes de sus bebidas y sándwich.
texts.en:
Benedicta is 50 years old. She is the mother of 4 children, the eldest is studying in technical school and the youngest are on vacation. For the past 10 years she has sold chicken soup in the evenings on the corner of a park near her home, a business that she began because she had been in sales and it wasn’t very profitable. Therefore she felt obligated to change the area of her sales to drinks made from maca and quinoa (grains) and soy, accompanied by bread and cheese, with chicken, with eggs, or with hamburgers, in the park in the city of Santa Ana. For the moment this business is very profitable, in a day she sells about 50 soles just in the breads, and also she sells various sweets that she makes more income with. Her husband sells fruit, slices of watermelon at 50 centavos, their only tools of the trade are a tricycle and a cart to peel and cover the fruit. In the morning hours, Benedicta works frying the eggs, cutting the cheese, parboiling the chicken, etc. She also prepares the creams to finish the sandwiches, and from 1pm she begins selling until everything is finished. The hard part is that sometimes she doesn’t sell everything, then the next day she won’t do more preparation, despite this she is happy because she always gets better earnings compared to the soup that she used to sell. The money that she is asking for is to buy the sweets and the ingredients for her drinks and sandwiches.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

loans.name: Naciones Unidas Group

texts.es: El banco Comunal "Naciones Unidas" esta conformado por 15 socios los mismos que se encuentran en su cuarto ciclo demostrando responsabilidad y cumplimiento en sus pagos, los socios se encuentran representados por la señora Eva. La mayoría D. los socios se dedican a actividades como atención D. tienda D. abarrotes y pulpería, venta y elaboración D. prendas deportivas, orfebrería y artesanía D. joyas, atención D. kiosco D. dulces y refrescos,  venta D. ropa para niños, venta D. embutidos, atención D. bazar librería, bordados computarizados. todas residen en la misma zona, todas las socias se conocen hace mucho tiempo y tienen la confianza D. trabajar en este tipo D. agrupaciones. El crédito esta destinado al incremento D. capital, compra D. equipos y herramientas para su diferentes rubros, y a la compra D. materia prima e insumos para la producción.
texts.en:
The "United Nations" communal bank is maD. up of 15 members who are in their fourth loan, having demonstrated responsibility and fulfilled their payments. The members are represented by Eva. Most of the members have activities such as taking care of grocery or convenience stores, sale and manufacture of sports clothing, jewelry making, candy or soft drink stands, sale of children´s clothing, sale of cold cuts, stationery store, or machine embroidery. All of them live in the same area, have known each other for a long time and trust working in this type of group. The loan will be used to increase their working capital, buy equipment and tools for their different lines of work, or buy raw materials or supplies for production.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Bolivia Unida Group

texts.es: La asociación "Bolivia Unida" esta en su primer ciclo y la presidenta es la señora Maria Roxana  la misma que se dedica a la venta D. libros, algunos D. los socios ya trabajaron anteriormente con grupos solidarios por lo que poseen la experiencia necesaria para el cumplimiento D. los pagos. Dentro D. este grupo existe la presencia D. dos varones  además los socios se dedican a las siguientes actividades: venta D. cosméticos, a la tramitación D. papeles judiciales independientes, comercio D. la coca legal, venta D. ropa, venta D. partes para computadoras, atención D. taller D. metal mecánica venta D. ropa para niños, venta D. calzados en las ferias D. la ciudad D. El Alto. El crédito esta destinado a la compra D. materia prima e insumos para la producción, también para la compra o reparación D. sus herramientas D. trabajo.
texts.en:
The "United Bolivia" group is in its first loan cycle and its president is Maria Roxana, who sells books. Some of the members worked together previously in other solidarity groups and have the experience needed to meet their repayments. Within the group are two men. The members are involved in the following activities: cosmetic sales, processing of legal paperwork, legal sale of coca leaves, sale of clothing, sale of computer parts, metal mechanic workshop, sale of children´s clothing, sale of footwear in the markets in El Alto. This loan will be used to buy materials and supplies for production as well as to buy or repair work tools.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Bolivia Group

texts.es: EL GRUPO "BOLIVIA" ESTA REPRESENTADO POR LA SEÑORA EUSEBIA ESTA CONFORMADA POR 17 SOCIOS (AS) LAS CUALES SON MUY TRABAJADORAS, ELLOS ( AS) SE DEDICAN AL COMERCIO D. KEROSENE, GASOLINA Y DIESEL, VENTA D. OLLAS, D. POLLERAS, VENTA D. COMIDA, VENTA D. JOYAS, COSTURA D. CHAMARRAS, VENTA D. CAMAS Y PILAS AL POR MAYOR . EN EL CASO D. DON LINO QUE ES EL ÚNICO VARÓN DEL GRUPO SE DEDICA A LA CONSTRUCCIÓN D. VIVIENDAS Y TAMBIÉN VEND. EN LA FERIA D. LA 16 D. JULIO REPUESTOS D. AUTOS. EN EL MERCADO DOND. TRABAJAN LAS SOCIAS EXISTE BASTANTE COMPETENCIA; A PESAR D. ELLO LAS SOCIAS SE VALEN D. LA RAPIDEZ QUE TIENEN PARA CAMBIAR Y SURTIR SU MERCADERÍA D. ACUERDO A LAS ÉPOCAS. EL DESTINO DEL CRÉDITO ES PRINCIPALMENTE EL INCREMENTO D. SU CAPITAL D. TRABAJO Y PARA LA COMPRA D. INSUMOS Y MATERIALES PARA DESEMPEÑAR SUS ACTIVIDADES. LA MAYORÍA D. LOS SOCIOS TIENEN EXPERIENCIA CREDITICIA PUESTO QUE NO ES SU PRIMER CICLO CON LA FUNDACIÓN AGROCAPITAL EN LA CUAL DEMOSTRARON RESPONSABILIDAD Y COMPROMISO CON LA INSTITUCIÓN.
texts.en:
The “Bolivia” Group is represented by Eusebia. It is comprised of 17 members, who are very hard workers. They sell kerosene, gasoline, and diesel fuel, the sale of pots, skirts, food, jewelry, making jackets, and selling beds and batteries. In the case of Don Lino, who is the only man in the group, he builds housing and also sells auto parts in the Fair of July 16th. In the market where the members work, there is a good deal of competition. In spite of that, the members value the speed that they have to change and supply their merchandise in accordance with the demands of a given time period. This credit is destined principally for the increase of working capital, for buying foods, and for buying materials to expand their activities. The majority of the members have experience with loans, given that this is not their first time working with Fundación Agrocapital in which they demonstrated responsibility and got along with the institution.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for business operation.

loans.name: San Nicolas Group

texts.es: El grupo "SAN NICOLAS" esta representado por la señora Jenny y conformado por doce socias que en su mayoría radican en la Zona D. San Nicolas, por lo que surge el nombre del grupo. La mayorias D. las socias se dedica a actividades como la costurería D. prendas D. vestir y a la elavoracion D. tejidos y prendas D. lana tejidas a mano, algunas se dedican a la venta D. abarrotes, venta D. comidasy verduras frescas en un mercado altamente competitivo, pero las socias saben que su trabajo es D. buena calidad y a bajo precio por lo que la competencia pasa desapercivida. El crédito esta destinado a la compa D. materiales en insumos para un producto terminado mas fino y D. mayor calidad para competir en el mercado comercial. Las socias cuentan con experiencia en creditos solidarios pero cursan juntos su primer ciclo con la Fundacion Agrocapital.
texts.en:
The Group “San Nicolas” is represented by señora Jenny and is comprised of twelve members who, by majority live in the area of San Nicolas, hence the name of their group. The majority of the group members make clothing, producing hand-woven garments like ones of wool. Some sell groceries, food, and vegetables in a market that is very competitive, but the members of the group know that their work is of high quality and low price, and so they hardly notice the competition. This loan is to be used to buy materials like consumables so that they may offer refinished product of the highest quality to compete in the commercial market. The members of “San Nicolas” have some experience with supportive loans but this is their first time working with Fundacion Agrocapital.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for business operations.

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.es: El señor Joaquín T. tiene una barbería en la capital de Guatemala ya tiene 8 años en este trabajo, mucha gente ya lo conoce en su colonia y conocen el trabajo que el desempeña, el es soltero y asiste a una iglesia cristiana donde ya lleva 10 años de asistir. El sueña con comprar una silla giratoria y tener un trabajador en su local para poder crecer como empresario y estar mejor económicamente  ya que el primer préstamo le ayudo bastante el espera en Dios que este préstamo también yo ayude mucho en su negocio.
texts.en:
Joaquin T. owns a barbershop in the capital of Guatemala and has been working as a barber for the past 8 years. Many people in his neighborhood already know him and the work that he carries out. He is single and attends a Christian church that he has attended for the past 10 years. He dreams of purchasing a revolving chair and having an employee in his shop so that he may be able to grow as a businessman; he also dreams of being in a better economic situation. Given that his first loan helped him greatly, he hopes to God that this loan will also help him a great deal in his business.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase furnishings and equipment for his barbershop.

loans.name: Santiago Group

texts.es: El grupo "Santiago" esta conformado por 15 siocios D. los cuales tres son verones los mismos que ha  trabajado en anteriores ciclos, la señora Ruth Mirnara es la representante del grupo, ella al igual que sus demas compañeros (as) se dedica al comercio D. diferentes productos como la ropa, venta D. repuestops para autos, costura, confeccion D. polleras, fabricación D. ataudes para funeraria, venta D. comida, venta D. rellenos, venta y fabricación D. sombreros, venta D. llantas, venta D. cosmeticos, y elavoración D. joyas atesanales, venta D. lacteos y sus deribados, servicio publico D. trasporte, artesanias, tiendas D. barrios y otros. Las socias llevan cursando su cuarto ciclo juntas en los cuales demostraron responsabilidad y cumplimiento en sus pagos así como solidaridad para con los miembros D. su grupo. El crédito obtenido es para el aumento D. su capital D. trabajo D. la cuál dependen sus familias.
texts.en:
The "Santiago" Group is maD. up of 15 members, of which 3 are male. They have all worked together in previous loan cycles. Mrs. Ruth Mirnara is the group representative, and she along with her business associates make their living in various ways such as: clothing sales, auto parts, sewing, dressmaking, coffin making, food sales, hat making, tire sales, cosmetics sales, jewelry making, dairy products, public transportation services, handicrafts, neighborhood shops, etc. The members are entering their fourth loan cycle together. They have demonstrated responsibility and have maD. their payments, and have been a unified group. The loan is for working capital which their families depend on.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Familia Unida Group

texts.es: El banco Comunal " FAMILIA UNIDA" esta representada por la señora Maritsabel y  conformado por 12 socios de los cuales un socio es varón el mismo que se dedica a la elaboración de jingles y spot publicitarios, además de que este banco comunal esta en su segundo ciclo cumplido con responsabilidad y cumpliendo con los pagos a tiempo. El grupo es muy unido ya que están trabajando por mucho tiempo juntos. Ellos se dedican a diferentes actividades como a la venta y comercialización de cerveza, venta de ropa intima, venta de telas, venta de ropa, venta de refrescos, venta de flores, venta de salchipapas venta de coca reglamentada. El destino del crédito es para el incremento de materiales e insumos para mejorar la calidad de sus productos así como para la reparación de sus herramientas de trabajo. las socias por lo que se menciono anteriormente tienen experiencia trabajando con grupos solidarios.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Familia Unida" ("United Family") is represented by Maritzabel and consists of 12 partners, of whom one is male. He works writing jingles and advertising spots. This communal bank is in its second loan cycle, completing it with responsibility and timely payments. The group is very united, as they spend much of their time working together. They work in various sectors, selling and marketing beer; selling intimate apparel, fabrics, clothing, soft drinks, flowers, salchipapas (hot dogs with french fries), and regulated coca. This loan will allow them to buy more materials and inputs to increase the quality of their products as well as repair their working tools. The partners mentioned above have experience working in solidarity groups.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational capital

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza C Group

texts.es: El grupo "NUEVA ESPERANZA C"  esta representada por la señora Maria Luz y conformado por doce socias que en su mayoría radican en la Zona D. ciudad satélite. Las socias componentes del grupo son en su mayoría costureras y tejedoras D. mantas, también se dedican a la atención en tiendas D. abarrotes, a la venta D. comidas y verduras, ellas saben que el mercado en la que ellas se mueven es muy competitivo por lo que requieren mayor calidad D. mercadería. El crédito esta destinado a la compra D. insumos y materiales D. primera calidad para ofrecer un producto terminado mas competitivo. Este grupo esta emprendiendo su segundo ciclo por lo que tienen experiencia en grupos solidarios y van cumpliéndolo con responsabilidad y mucho esmero en cumplir a tiempo con su plan D. pagos con la Fundación agrocapital.
texts.en:
The Group “Nueva Esperanza C” is represented by señora Maria Luz, and comprised of 12 members of which the majority live in the area of a satellite city. The members of the group are for the most part seamstresses and knitters of blankets. Some also work with grocery stores in the sale of foods and vegetables. They know that the market in which they work is very competitive and so they need the highest quality of merchandise. The loan is to be used to buy edibles and high quality materials so that the women of the group may offer a finished product that can compete in the market. This group is engaged in their second loan, and so they have experience with support groups. They regard their payment plans with la Fundación Agrocapital with a great deal of responsibility and care.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for business operations.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 56 años, tras el abandono del padre de su hijo se quedó con sus dos hijos y una niña que crió, sin ser su hija de sangre, pero que la considera como suya, actualmente están viviendo en su casa propia en el pueblo cerca a su chacra. Durante toda su vida se ha dedicado a cultivar y labrar la tierra, heredó los terrenos de sus padres donde siembra sus propios productos y también alquila, con la condición de que la persona da la semilla, abonos e insecticidas y Juana y sus hijos cultivan y cuidan de la producción, y en el momento de la cosecha la dividen en partes iguales, de este modo viene trabajando por muchos años.  En esta temporada de invierno en la sierra, siembra primero las arvejas para cosechar en el mes de abril, con estas ganancias cubre los gastos escolares de sus hijos, posteriormente siembra papa. 
Si siendo invierno, siembra la papa es atacada por plagas, por lo que tienen que comprar los medicamentos adecuados para que no se pierda la cosecha, en cambio si se siembra en los meses de abril o septiembre no invertirá en la cura y fumigado. Juana si es una socia muy activa en su banco comunal, siempre está dispuesta para cualquier comunicado o reunión que se tenga, y en los pagos siempre hace lo posible de pagar puntualmente. El dinero solicitado se invertirá en la compra de semilla de arvejas por kilos, abono y demás remedios e insecticidas para el fumigado.
texts.en:
After her son's father deserted them, she was left with two sons, and a daughter whom she has raised. She thinks of her daughter as her own, even though she is not hers by birth. Currently Juana lives with her family in her own home in the village near her farm. She inherited the land from her parents and has spent her life working and cultivating the fields, planting her own crops. She also rents some of the land out to people, who provide the seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides, while Juana and her children cultivate and tend the crop. At harvest time they split the yield evenly. Juana has been working this way for many years. Now that it's wintertime in the Highlands, she will plant primarily peas, for harvest in April. Proceeds from that will cover school costs for the children. Later she will plant potatoes. Potatoes sown in the winter are prone to pests, so she has to buy pesticides to prevent losing the harvest. If she plants them during April or September, however, she doesn't have to invest in treatments and sprays. Juana is a very active member of her village bank. She is open to any kind of communication or meeting, and she always does everything in her power to make her payments on time. She will invest her loan in buying pea seeds by the kilo, and the rest in pest treatments and insecticides for fumigation.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis acaba de cumplir 38 años, viene conviviendo con su pareja cerca de 11 años, justo la edad que ahora tiene su hijo mayor, y hace 5 meses que nació su segundo hijo de nombre Samuel, cuando se unieron vivían en la casa de su suegra, pero hace como 2 años ya vive en su casa propia. Desde muy joven se ha dedicado al labrado de la tierra, heredó la perseverancia en el trabajo de sus padres, y en esta oportunidad va a sembrar arvejas, y maíz que en esta época su precio está bien cotizado, Luis vende por fanegas que son sacos que llevan más de 60 kilos, donde llegan acumular exactamente 200 mazorcas, y cada saco se vende un precio aproximado de 80 soles, la dificultad es que el mismo precio no se mantiene en el mercado. En lo que respecta a la papa, nunca ha dejado de sembrar, en esta temporada va a sembrar de la semilla única que se desarrolla solamente en tres meses, a diferencia de las otras semillas, ésta es muy resistente a la temporada de lluvia y aun más a las plagas, por lo que no invierten mucho en los remedios. Luis tiene compradores en las ciudades de la costa por lo que su cosecha ya tiene venta segura. Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP y acaba de juramentar como presidente de su banco comunal, en el cual se compromete a cumplir con su cargo, y hacer que todos los socios paguen con la misma responsabilidad. El dinero solicitado es para la compra de insecticidas para fumigar su chacra de maíz y para atacar al gusano que llaman “shiuri” que es un insecto es de color blanco, de 2 centímetros de largo y ataca directo al fruto. El resto del dinero es para la compra de arvejas de la semilla llamada Utrillo.
texts.en:
Luis just turned 38 years old and has lived with his partner for nearly 11 years, which is also the age of his oldest son. Five months ago his second son, named Samuel, was born. When he and his partner married they lived in his mother-in-law’s house, however two years ago they moved to their own home. From a young age, he has dedicated himself to working the land, having inherited a perserverance for this type of work from his parents. Currently, he plants peas and corn which bring good prices during this season. Luis sells by the bushel, in other words, sacks weighing more than 60 kilos in which he can fit exactly 200 ears of corn. Each sack sells for approximately 80.00 Peruvian soles. Market prices fluctuate, however, which can be difficult. He has also never ceased planting potatoes and, this season, will be sowing from a seed that develops in only three months. Unlike other seeds, it is very resistant to the rainy season and to plagues, which is why he doesn’t need to invest much into remedies for these types of problems. Luis has buyers in the coastal cities, which means his crops have an assured sale. This is his fourth loan with MFP. He was recently sworn in as the president of his cooperative bank, and he promises to fulfill the job well and work to ensure that all members pay their loan installments responsibly. The funds he requests are for the purchase of insecticides to fumigate his corn crop against a worm they call “shiuri”, which is white and 2 cm. long. The remaining funds will be used to buy peas from seeds called “Utrillo”.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase insecticides.

loans.name: Sixto

texts.es: Sixto tiene 46 años, es casado hace 14 años y tiene su casa en un pueblo de nombre Cumutay, lugar apropiado y cercano a sus terrenos de cultivo; tiene 6 hijos, de los cuales viven con ellos solo dos de ellos ayudándoles en los trabajos de la chacra. Sus actividades agrícolas se inician a las 5.00am cuando empieza a sacar la yerba y a realizar los surcos para que pueda sembrar, después a eso de las 8.00am regresa a su casa para desayunar y luego regresa nuevamente a la chacra para culminar la faena. Mientras que su esposa va detrás de él con sus vacas y demás animales llevando el almuerzo, con esta labor pudo educar a sus hijos que ahora viven en diferentes ciudades y se siente muy orgulloso de ellos. En esta temporada está sembrando arvejas de una bolsa y media de semilla llamada “súper mejorada” que es resistente a la humedad, el próximo mes sembrará otra cantidad similar, pero otro tipo de semilla. Este método lo utiliza con la finalidad de que constantemente tenga para cosechar y no le falta dinero, así siempre esté cosechando. Cuando no hay mucho trabajo en el campo, Sixto realiza trabajos de albañilería; como por ejemplo construir casas de adobe, este trabajo generalmente se presentan a partir de junio hasta setiembre, por en esta temporada la lluvia no le permite avanzar en la construcción. Es su tercer préstamo con MFP, con el cargo de presidente de su banco comunal ha trabajado con mucha responsabilidad haciendo que todos los socios paguen en las fechas designadas, producto de ello el grupo no ha caído en morosidad. Con el dinero solicitado comprará semillas de arvejas, cada bolsa cuesta 600 soles, y con lo que resta comprará insecticidas para el fumigado.
texts.en:
Sixto is 46 years old, has been married for 14 years, and lives in a town name Cumutay which is close to his farmlands. He has 6 children, two of whom still live with him and help with the crops. His work begins at 5 am, at which time he removes the grass and starts his planting areas. After this work is complete, he returns to his house at 8 am to eat breakfast, then returns to the farm again to complete his tasks. His wife follows with his cows and other animals, bringing him lunch. Through these labors, he was able to educate his children who now live in other cities; he is very proud of them. During the current season, he is planting 1 ½ bags of pea seeds called “Super Improved” which are resistant to humidity. He will plant about the same quantity next month, but from a different type of seed. He uses this staggered technique so he will continually have a harvest and, as a result, a more consistent level of income. When there is not much farm work to be done, Sixto works in construction. He builds adobe homes, for example, from the months of June through September. This is his third loan with MFP and, under the directive of the president of his cooperative bank, he works very responsibly to make sure all members make their payments on the designated date. As a result of these efforts, the group has not fallen into delinquency. With the funds he is requesting he will purchase pea seeds that cost 600.00 Peruvian soles per bag, and he will use the remaining funds to buy insecticides to fumigate his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase seeds and insecticides.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 25 años, viene conviviendo más de 4 años con su pareja, es madre de 3 hijos, por el momento está viviendo en la casa de su madre. Desde muy niña apoyaba en los trabajos de agricultura a sus padres, ahora levanta a las 5.00am para preparar el desayuno, en seguida lava los pañales de su bebe, y a toda prisa prepara el almuerzo para llevar a la chacra donde ya se encuentra laborando su esposo. Ella y su esposo todos estos años han estado sembrando papa, pero en esta oportunidad va incrementar su producción sembrando arvejas. También sembrará flores para que las pueda vender en el próximo mes de mayo por el día de las madres donde le será muy rentable. Carmen ya tiene preparada su chacra para la siembra de arveja, donde anteriormente sembró papá. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y se ha comprometido en cumplir con los pagos en las fechas señaladas. Con el dinero solicitado comprará semilla de arveja, a un costo aproximado de 400 soles, y con el resto comprará abono.
texts.en:
Carmen is 25 years old and has been living with her partner for more than 4 years. She is the mother of 3 children and for the moment she is living in her mother’s house. Since she was a very young girl she has helped her parents with agricultural work. She gets up at 5:00 in the morning to make breakfast, and then she washes her baby’s diapers and quickly prepares lunch for her husband who is already working on their farm.

For several years she and her husband have been planting potatoes, but this opportunity is going to increase their production by planting peas. Carmen will also plant flowers so that she can sell them next May for Mother’s Day, which will be very profitable. Carmen has already prepared her farmland for the planting of peas where she previously grew potatoes.

This is her first loan with MFP and she is committed to making the payments on the scheduled dates. With the solicited money she will buy pea seeds at a cost of approximately 400 soles and with the rest she will buy fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Margot

texts.es: Margot está a punto de cumplir 29 años, hace 10 años viene conviviendo con su pareja, fruto de esta unión tienen 2 hijos que estudian en el escuela, viven felices en su propia casa. Desde que era soltera hace uso de un conjunto de técnicas a utilizar en el cultivo, desde niña aprendió y considera importante tener conocimiento de cómo se avecina el tiempo, ya que esto determinará la siembra y una cosecha favorable; Por ello desde las 4.00am empieza en preparar el desayuno y en seguida el almuerzo, sale hacia la chacra a eso de las 7.00am para caminar con tranquilidad durante una hora, cuenta con unos peones que cuando está ella presente trabajan mucho mejor. En esta oportunidad va a sembrar gladiolos, semilla que tiene lista para cargar al burro, mientras que su esposo y sus peones están abriendo surcos para diseminar la semilla. Margot comenta que procesar la semilla de la flor en muy complicado, luego de la cosecha se le hace secar, después se tiene que pelar una por una para que no se pierda la flor al germinar, lo hace ella misma porque comprar la semilla lista le resulta muy costoso que varia dependiendo de la temporadas, por ejemplo en esta fecha el saco de semilla cuesta 150 soles y en otras temporadas llega a más. Adicionalmente siembra arvejas y posteriormente sembrará papa, por ello que está muy contenta porque ya tiene a dónde acudir cuando necesita hacer mayores inversiones. Anteriormente Margot se prestaba de la cuenta interna de otro banco comunal; pero ahora ya obtuvo su primer crédito de MFP y empezará ahorrar en su propio grupo, donde espera ganarse la confianza con su trabajo responsable. El dinero solicitado es destinado para la compra de abono, el cual ha bajado de precio, de 215 a 95 soles, este precio le va permitir adquirir 10 sacos de nitrato y potasio para asegurarse la buena cosecha de las flores, que espera vender en el mes de mayo.
texts.en:
Margot is about to turn 29. For the past 10 years she has lived with her partner; together they have 2 school-aged children, and they live happily in their own house. Since she was single she has applied a variety of techniques to her farming. As a child she learned how to deal with weather conditions, which she considers important, as this is the determining factor in cultivating crops and a having successful harvest. Margot's day begins at 4:00AM, when she prepares breakfast and, right after that, lunch. At 7:00AM she goes out to the farm where she spends an hour strolling through the fields, talking with the laborers, who work much better when she is around. She is about to plant gladioli. She'll load the seeds up on the burro, while her husband and the laborers plow the rows where the seeds will be scattered. Margo says that processing flower seeds is a very complicated process. Once they are harvested they have to be dried. Then they have to be peeled so the flowers will germinate. She does this herself because fully-processed seeds are very expensive, and prices vary with the season. Right now, for example, a sack of seeds costs 150 soles, but could go for more at other times of the year. She also plants peas, and later she'll plant potatoes. Margot is glad to have MFP, because they give her a place to turn when she needs to invest more in her business. In the past, she received loans through the internal account of another village bank (Translator's note: members' savings may be channeled to a village bank’s internal account, where they are used to make supplemental loans to village bank members). She has already received her first loan from MFP, and she will start saving within her own group, where she hopes her work ethic will earn her confidence. She plans to use this loan to buy fertilizer, which has dropped in price from 215 to 95 soles. Now she can buy 10 bags of nitrate and potassium to ensure a good flower harvest, which she hopes to sell during the month of May.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her crops

loans.name: Wilfredo Antonio

texts.es:
El Señor Wilfredo Antonio O. S. tiene la edad de 46 años, su estado civil es casado, Don Wilfredo tiene 2 hijos  a su cargo sus edades son las siguientes el hijo mayor de 22 años y cursa el 3 año de su carrera y su hijo menor de 20 años cursa el 1 año de su carrera, su compañera de vida trabaja de domestica y su salario es muy bajo, sus propósitos son de aumentar su clientela para expandirse en su negocio y darse a conocer en otros lugares por su magnifica forma de laborar y su cumplimiento con cada compromiso de trabajo sus deseos es que sus hijos terminen la carrera para que sean profesionales reconocidos en la ciudad y en todo el país los sueños de Don Wilfredo es llegar a poseer un taller que este acondicionado con las herramientas necesaria para realizar mas actividades que se pueden trabajar en el enderezado y pintura, pero que el por falta de ciertas herramientas no se compromete en efectuar ciertos trabajos.

La actividad económica de Don Wilfredo es el servicio de enderezado y pintura, la ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio de 8 años, Don Wilfredo inicia este negocio por que su hermano fue quien le dio la oportunidad de que trabajara con el en este tipo de negocio y mas tarde decide establecer el su propio negocio y es así como decide establecer su negocio  de forma ambulante por que no tenia los medios completos para realizar todos los procedimientos en su casa de habitación ya que es muy pequeña y con la ayuda de su hermano quien le facilitaba los medios para realizar los trabajos pero mas tarde decide comprar sus herramientas y al paso del tiempo se fue dando a conocer por la calidad de su trabajo ya que tenia muchas amistades que requerían de sus servicios y fue así que logro obtener su propia clientela y su propio negocio por lo que ahora necesita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo ya que necesita realizar la compra de pinturas, varillas para soldar repuestos de sus herramientas y la compra de herramientas nuevas y todo esto lo realiza en Managua ya que el conoce ciertos lugares donde le resulta mas favorable.
texts.en:
Mr. Wilfredo Antonio O. S. is 46 years old, married, and has two children in his care. His eldest son is 22 years old and is in the 3rd year of his studies, while his youngest son is 20 years old and is in the 1st year of his studies. His life partner works as a housekeeper and earns a very low salary. Her goals are to increase the number of her clients so that she may expand her business, and to be known in other places for her superb work and fulfillment of every work commitment. Her hope is that her sons finish their studies so that they become professionals recognized in their city and in the whole country. Wilfredo’s dream is to be able to own an air conditioned shop with the necessary tools to be able to complete more work in the body shop trade, however, because of a lack of the certain tools he does not commit himself to carry out certain jobs. Wilfredo’s economic undertaking is a body shop service. His business is located on the road, and he has owned his business for the past 8 years. Wilfredo got started in this business because his brother gave him the opportunity to work with him and later he decided to establish his own business. He began his business in a on the road fashion because he did not have the means to carry out all his work in the house in which he lives because it is too small. His brother aided him and facilitated the means by which he could complete his jobs. Later Wilfredo decided to purchase his own tools and as time passed he was recognized for the quality of his work given that he has many friends that require his services. In this way he was able to acquire his own clients and his own business for which he now needs a loan for work capital given that he needs to purchase paints, bars to weld tools repairs, and new tools. He will carry out all these tasks in Managua since he knows certain places that will give him the best results.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital to purchase paints, tool repairs, and new tools.

loans.name: Yamm

texts.en: Mrs. Yamm K. is 29 years old and now lives in Svay Prey village in Kampong Cham province. She is a pig breeder. Since her pigs have grown larger and larger, she does not have enough money to feed them. In order to solve this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase pig food to support her business. Her husband, Mr. Bouy Nhor, is a farmer who owns a piece of land on which he cultivates rice. Mrs. Yamm K. is the mother of two children who are too young to work or study. Her husband and children are pictured with her.

loans.use: To purchase pig food

loans.name: Naren

texts.en: Mrs. Naren E. is a villager in Pour village in Kampong Cham province. She is a fish breeder. In her business, she has a problem because she does not have enough money to buy fish food to support them. Thus, she has decided to request a loan to purchase fish food for her breeding fishes business. She hopes to increase her income to provide a better living for her family. Her husband, Mr. Pech Malin, is a farmer. Mrs. Naren E. is 40 years old and the mother of two children who are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To purchase fish food

loans.name: Nem

texts.en: Mrs. Nem H. is a 60-year-old widow and lives in Pour village in Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which she cultivates rice. She now wants to start a pig-breeding business, but she does not have enough money to deal with this purpose. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy ten piglets and pig food for breeding. She hopes to increase income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Mrs. Nem H. is the mother of three children, two of whom are employed at different positions in the company while the other is a tailor.

loans.use: To buy ten piglets and pig food for breeding

loans.name: Thee

texts.en: Mrs. Thee E. is a villager in Tuol Kandaul Thboung village in Kampong Cham province. She is a Khmer noodle seller, while her husband, Mr. Phem Ken, is a construction worker. Since his work place is far from the house, he usually pays a great deal of money for a motorbike taxi to get to work. Thus, Mrs. Thee E. decided to seek a loan to buy a motorbike for her husband and reduce their overall transportation expenses. She is 37 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for transportation to work

loans.name: Thab

texts.en: Mrs. Thab S. is a villager in Pour village in Kampong Cham province. She is a pig breeder whose business is doing well, so she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase more piglets and pig food. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions through this loan. Her husband, Mr. Choek Sruon, is a farmer who owns a one-hectare field of land to cultivate rice. Aside from the plantation, he uses rice to make wine to sell. Mrs. Thab S. is a 34-year-old mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the other is too young to work or study. Her husband is presented on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets and pig food

loans.name: Doem

texts.en: Mrs. Doem N. is a villager in Chreaek village in Kampong Cham province. She and her husband, Mr. Yin Him, are farmers who own a 1.5-hectare plot of land on which they cultivate rice. However, they are facing a problem because their field is infertile. Thus, Mrs. Doem N. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field to make her crop more productive. She hopes to increase her income and improve the family's living conditions. She is 39 years old and the mother of four children, three of whom are enrolled in the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support the field

loans.name: Preoung

texts.en: Preoung C. is 20 years old and single. She has been orphaned, as her parents passed away a long time ago. She currently lives with two siblings; all of them are single (brother and oldest sister). Her oldest sister is employed as a garment worker at Will Best Factory in Phnom Penh City.
