She now makes a living working as a garment worker for a factory with her oldest sister. She currently gets a salary of $90 per month. Recently, Ms. Preoung C. hopes her brother has a suitable business to invest in; thus, she would like to ask for a loan to buy a motorcycle. The motorcycle belongs to her brother to use as a taxi. (She and her brother are pictured.)

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en: Mrs. Chanthy S. was born in 1986 and now lives in Pring Chhrum village in Kampong Cham province. She owns a grocery store. Her husband, Mr. Chub Sok Uy, is a motorbike repairman. In his business, he faces a problem because he does not have enough money to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Chanthy S. decided to request a loan to buy more equipment for her husband business. She is the mother of a two-year-old child. Her husband is presented in the picture.

loans.use: To buy equipment for husband's business

loans.name: Mrs. Roeun Saing Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fourteen people living in Chreaek village in Kampong Cham province make up this village bank loan group, and they will use the loan for various purpose. Mrs. Roeun S., the 38- year-old village bank president, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, she is a fisherman. In her business, she faces a problem because she does not have enough money to buy nets for fishing. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Mrs. Roeun S. is a widow with six children, two of whom are employed in garment factory while the others are attending the local school.

Thirteen members in this group have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy nets for fishing

loans.name: Mrs. Kheun Port Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Ten people in Sram Angkam village in Kampong Cham province have formed a village bank loan group, and Mrs. KheU. P. is the village bank president. She and her husband, Mr. Kan Tuoy, are farmers who own a small piece of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. On this plantation, they face an obstacle because their field is far from existing irrigation systems. Thus, Mrs. KheU. P. has decided to ask for a loan to buy an irrigation pump to water the field. She is 61 years old and the mother of five children, two of whom are laborers while the others are attending the local school.

Nine members in this group carry are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy an irrigation pump to water the fields

loans.name: Kear

texts.en: Mrs. Kear Y. is a villager in Phum Thmey village in Kampong Cham province. She is a fruitseller. Her husband, Mr. Tub Sengny, helps his wife at her business. He now wants to be a motorbike taxi driver; unfortunately, he does not have enough money to purchase the motorbike. Thus, Mrs. Kear Y. decided to ask for a loan to help pay for it. She hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan. She is 23 years old and the mother of two children who are too young to work or study. Her husband is presented on the right in this photo.

loans.use: To help purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Rours

texts.en: Mrs. Rours Y. is a villager in Pour village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a duck breeder. Since her duck breeding business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more ducks and duck food for her breeding. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Uch Ey, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Rours Y. is a 54-year-old mother of a child who is a tailor in the house.

loans.use: To purchase more ducks and duck food for her breeding business.

loans.name: Neang

texts.en: Mrs. Neang T. is a villager in Damnak Lor Eth village in Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, she faces a problem because her field is infertile. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and fuel in order to water and support the field to make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Pech Uor, is a cow breeder. Mrs. Neang T. is a 57-year-old mother of four children, two of whom are employed in garment factory while another is a driver and the other is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and fuel for her rice plot.

loans.name: You's Group

texts.en:
There are three borrowers in this small group, all residents in Choam Chao Commune of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. Mrs. S. was selected to be the leader. She has been selling a variety of vegetables since early 2008 in the area of Choam Chao Market. She currently earns an income of approximately $5 per day. She is married and has three children; all of them are single. One of her sons is employed as a gas transporter, whilst her husband's name is Svay Rem, 45, and he is a civil servant. He is working for a warehouse and currently gets a salary of $70 per month. Mrs. S. is applying for a loan to purchase a second-hand motorcycle. The motorcycle will be used to fulfill her family's needs. The other two borrowers are:
P., aged 28, sells groceries. She needs a loan to buy more grocery inventory for sale.
S., 56 years old, sells traditional khmer cakes, and she requests a loan buy a motorcycle for her son ride to work.

loans.use: to purchase a second-hand motorcycle

loans.name: Khom

texts.en: Mrs. Khom V. is a 52-year-old widow, and she lives in Doun Tau village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a farmer. She now wants to start a duck breeding business. Thus, she is requesting a loan to buy some ducklings for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and improV. her family's living. She has four children, two of whom are employed in  a garment factory while another is a construction worker and the other is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy some ducklings for breeding.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Kong S. is 46 years old and lives with her husband in Kampong Chhnang province. She sells sugar cane and makes about US $2 of profit each day. Her husband is a policeman and security guard at CREDIT MFI, Kampong Chhnang branch. On average, he earns an approximately US $4.50 a day. This couple has two children. Two of their children operate a hairdressing shop and act as wedding decorators. Together, they make US $2.50 a day. 

Mrs. Kong would like to use this loan to purchase a motorbike for her husband for commute to work. With the rest of the money, she will expand her children's shop.

loans.use: To purchase motorbike and expand a hairdressing shop.

loans.name: Surng

texts.en: Mr. Surng C. is a 30-year-old widower and he lives in Trapaing Sla village in Kampong Cham Province. He is a construction worker. Aside from this career, he is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. He now wants to expand his rice revenue; thus, he decided to ask for a loan to purchase a 1-hectare field to cultivate rice. He hopes to increase his income and improve his living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To purchase a 1-hectare field to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Lim

texts.en:
Lim T., 58, lives in Kampong Chhnang with her husband and her children. Since 1999, she has been selling rice to earn a living and is able to make about $5 (USD) of profit each day. Her husband, Sim Son, is a cow dealer and earns around $8 USD in revenue each day. Two of their daughters are employed in a garment factory. 

Mrs. Lim will purchase rice, take off the husk, and resell the rice to earn a profit. She is confident that this will be a good business venture and sees it as a tool to increase her income and raise her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase rice to sell

loans.name: Da

texts.en: Mrs. Da P. is a villager in Pour village in Kampong Cham Province. She and her husband, Mr. Houy Im, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, they do not earn enough income to provide a good living. Thus, Mrs. Da P. decided to ask for a loan to purchase a 1-hectare field to cultivate rice. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living condition with this loan. She is 36 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is employed in a company while the other is attending the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband and her child are shown on the picture with her.

loans.use: To purchase a 1-hectare field to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Meas S. is 50 years old and sells fruit in Kampong Chhnang province. Her business has been around for about three years and she makes US $3.50 every day. Selling fruit has been a difficult business, because there is high inflation and the weather has not been conducive to a good growing season. 

She is asking for a loan of US $400 to invest in her own fruit business, increasing her stock of fruits to sell. She sees these investments as opportunities that will be able to increase her daily income.

loans.use: To invest on her own fruit business

loans.name: Mrs. Kim Sreang Thorng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Thirteen people in Srae Spey village in Kampong Cham province have taken a village bank loan and Mrs. Kim Sreang T. is the village bank president. She sells vegetables in the local market. She buys them from the other villagers to resell. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it; thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more vegetables to re-sell. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Ek Sokhea, is a construction worker. Mrs. Kim Sreang T. is a 26-year-old mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the other is too young to work or study.

One member in this group has an end-of-term loan and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more vegetables to re-sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Pao's Group

texts.en:
The group of borrowers consists of three people. Its leader, Pao Y., is 59 years old. She earns a living selling traditional khmer cakes. She normally sells the ingredients from the market, like rice, pork, sugar, etc, mixing and boiling them and selling her cakes to villagers. She is married with three children; two of them are married and the other one is single. Two of her children are employed as garment workers, while her husband is a local carpenter. To reduce the cost of transportation for the family, Y. has applied for a loan to purchase a used motorcycle for her family's transportation needs. There are another two borrowers below:
M., 44, is a local tailor and she needs a loan to buy a motorcycle for her husband to ride to work.
M., age 50, sells khmer cakes. She is applying for a loan to buy a cow-cart. The borrowers live in Choam Chao Commune in Phnom Penh City of Cambodia.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy vegetable seed for growing on the field.

loans.name: Mrs. Vien Nuon Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank, which consists of eleven members, is located in Srae Spey village in Kampong Cham Province. The members plan to use the loan which they obtained for different purposes. Mrs. Vien N. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a pig breeder. Since her pig breeding business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase three more piglets for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Pheng Srorn, is employed in a government department. Mrs. Vien N. is 59 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is employed in garment factory while another is a motorbike repairer and the other is attending the local school.  

Seven members in this group have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase three more piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her field.

loans.name: Mrs. That Soem Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan team, which consists of twenty-eight people, is located in Phum Bei Dab village in Kampong Cham Province. All the members will use the loan in different purposes. Mrs. That S. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn for living. In this plantation, she now faces a small problem because her field is infertile soil so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fertilizers to support the field to make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Saom Thea, is a laborer who can make a little income to support the family. Mrs. That S. is 42 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are laborers while another one is attending the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is on the age of two years old.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Kea

texts.en: Mrs. Kea P. was born in 1958 and she now lives in Sotep village in Kampong Cham province. She is a rice middleman who buys rice to keep in stock then re-sell later at a better price. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice for her current business. Her husband, Mr. Y. Oeurn, owns a small rice mill with which he can make an income. Mrs. Kea P. has five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other two are construction workers and the youngest one is attending the local school. Her husband is presented on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy more rice for her current business.

loans.name: Sreyroathana

texts.en: Mrs. Sreyroathana N. is a villager in Tasen Village in Kampong Cham Province. She owns a small restaurant where she sells food for lunchtime to the villagers and passengers. In this business, she now faces a small problem because she does not have enough material such as chairs, tables, spoons and so on. Thus, Mrs. Sreyroathana N. decided to ask for a loan to buy them for her current business. She is a 30-year-old widow with two children who are all attending the local school, and they also help her while they have free time after school.

loans.use: To buy chairs, tables, and spoons for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Sao

texts.en: Mrs. Sao H. was born in 1963 and she now lives in Tasen village in Kampong Cham province. She is a housewife who cooks delicious food for the family. Her husband, Mr. Horn Soeurn, is a motor taxi-driver who can earn a little income to support the family. In order to improve her family's living conditions, Mrs. Sao H. wants to conduct her own fried noodle selling business, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy a small restaurant in the local village. She will use the rest of the loan to buy ingredients for her starting business. She is 46 years old and the mother of a child who is attending the local school. Her husband is shown on the right of photo.

loans.use: To buy a small restaurant and ingredients for cooking.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru: Хамдамова Дилором замужем 35 лет имеет 5 детей, раньше кредитовалась с группой, но со временем из группы начали переходить в индивидуальное кредитование. Муж Дилором работает в Казахстане , каждый месяц он присылает деньги для семьи, и старается каждые три месяца приезжать , что бы увидеться с семьей и сделать крупную покупку для дома. В их кишлаке нет работы, кроме как пасти и продавать скот  ну и конечно коммерция продуктами питания и иногда одеждой , но дешевле покупать в городе. Когда муж в отъезде практически она сидит дома, ее свекор посоветовал заняться купли продажей скота , так как этот вид бизнеса самый выгодный и основной в их поселке. Она обратилась в очередной раз на получение кредита для покупки скота –овец.  До марта она выдержит, и ее свекор обещал помочь в продаже на рынке скотов. Ей понравилась выгодная для нее система кредитования по льготному  погашению.
texts.en:
Dilorom H. has been married for 35 years and has 5 children. Previously she had taken out group loans, but as time passed the group started transitioning to individual loans. Dilorom’s husband works in Kazakhstan, he sends money to the family every month and tries to visit once every three months in order to see the family and to make a major purchase for the house. There are no jobs in their village other than shepherding and selling livestock, and of course sales of food and sometimes clothing, however it is cheaper to buy these products in the city. While Dilorom’s husband is out of town she basically spends her time sitting at home. Her father-in-law suggested that she start buying and selling livestock as this business is the main and most profitable business in their village. Dilorom turned to us for another loan to purchase livestock – sheep. She will keep them through March and her father-in-law has promised to help her sell them at the livestock market. Dilorom likes this credit system which is helpful to her.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheep

loans.name: Oeurn

texts.en:
Mr. Oeurn I. was born in 1948 and he now lives in Sampong Chey village in Kampong Cham province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice for a living. In this plantation, he does not earn enough income to provide a better life for his family. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan to buy 0.5-hectar field of land to cultivate rice.

He hopes to increase his income and improve the family's living conditions. His wife, Mrs. Tith Noeurn, helps him on the plantation. Mr. Oeurn I. has five children, two of whom are laborers while the others are employed in the garment factory, and the remaining child is attending the local school. His wife is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy 0.5-hectar field of land to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Sroin

texts.en: Mrs. Sroin K. was born in 1959 and she now lives in Andoung village in Kampong Cham province. She owns a small grocery store in the local market. With the business, she now faces small problem because she has difficulty buying more grocery product because of mobility. Thus, Mrs. Sroin K. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy a motorbike. With the motorbike, she will be able to travel to buy grocery products to re-sell. She has two children who are construction workers.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to add to her saving to buy a motorbike in order to travel to buy grocery products to re-sell.

loans.name: Sok Ngoun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok Ngoun K. is a villager in Andoung village in Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer. Mrs. Sok Ngoun K. owns a plot of land for cultivating rice to sell for a living. In her plantation, she can gather a little rice revenue, but it cannot support the family well.

In order to be well supported, Mrs. Sok Ngoun K. decided to ask for a loan to buy a piece of land for cultivating more rice, thus increasing her revenue. Her husband, Mr. Mong Soknim, helps her in the plantation. Mrs. Sok Ngoun K. is 29 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study. The child is two years old. Her husband is shown on the left of photo.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land to cultivate rice to expand her revenue.

loans.name: Neyseang

texts.en: Mrs. Neyseang S. is a villager in Andoung village in Kampong Cham province. She and her husband, Mr. Phet Phat, are laborers who make little income to support the family, but it is not enough to support the family well. To provide a better life for their family, Mrs. Neyseang S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike for her husband to use as a motor taxi. Mrs. Neyseang S. is 47 years old and the mothers of five children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while the remaining two are attending the local school. Her husband is presented at the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to use as a motor taxi.

loans.name: Chhunn

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhunn C. was born in 1955 and she now lives in Damnak Lo Erth village in Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land, where she cultivates rice to sell for a living. Her husband, Mr. Kong Mao, helps her in the plantation. They have five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory, two help their parents on the plantation, and the youngest one is attending the local school.

Since her two children’s work place are far from house, they usually pay much money on transportation, so Mrs. Chhunn C. is asking for a loan to buy a motorbike for them to go to work. The whole family will save money this way.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the children to go for work.

loans.name: Halicha

texts.ru: Халича  замужем, имеет 4 детей. Халича  получает кредит для расширения бизнеса. Ее точка находиться  в не очень хорошем условием: зимой  сквозняк, а навес, покрытый целлофаном  протекает вот время дождя, но все-таки  выгодное место, не далеко от прохода базара, люди проходят мимо обязательно что-нибудь купят. Она торгует конфетами и печеньями, которые привозят поставщики или какие – либо фирмы снабжают. Ее доход позволяет рассчитываться с ними за 2-3 дня, в зависимости от сезона продажи.  Свою прибыль Халича  рассчитывает по ровно, часть на бизнес в оборот –приобретает конфеты , часть  для домашнего быта.  Она планирует расширить  свой бизнес увеличив и  разнообразив ассортимент.
texts.en:
Halicha is married and has four children. She wants to get a loan to expand her business. Her vendor point location is not in a very good condition: in the winter it's cold and the roof is covered with cellophane which leaks when it rains, but nevertheless is a profitable place, not too far from the market where people pass by often and stop by to buy something. She sells candy and cookies which suppliers or other firms bring in. Her income let's her pay them back in two-three days depending on the season's sales. Halicha divides her profits in half, one part goes back into business to by more candy and other half info the household. She plans to expand her business by increasing and diversifying the variety of goods.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For business expansion

loans.name: Chreb

texts.en:
Mrs. Chreb K. is a farmer in Tuol Tonsong village in Kampong Cham province. Her husband, Mr. Chhoeurn Savoeurn, owns a loud speaker, which he hires out to the villagers when they have parties. To operate this business well, Mrs. Chreb K. decided to ask for a loan to buy an electricity machine for her husband's business.

Mrs. Chreb K. is 38 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study; that child is five years old. Her husband is presented on the left of photo.

loans.use: To buy an electricity machine for her husband's business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to start motor taxi business.

loans.name: Adolat

texts.ru:
Адолат 46 лет, у нее 2 детей. Ее жизнь сложилась не очень удачно, но она не из тех, кто отпускает руки. После распада СССР , она  как и все осталась без работы с мужем они развелись. Со временем устроилась ученицей у знакомой, помогала стричь, и научившись , накопила необходимый капитал. Сестра, дала денег Адолат открыла свою парикмахерскую. Адолат и ее детям пришлось не  легко, без мужской опоры трудно, она во второй раз вышла замуж, муж поддержал ее бизнес.
По настоящий момент у нее 18 лет стажа опыта работы, она стрижет, делает укладки волос и окрашивает, также сдает свадебные платья. Ее помещение находилась в неудобном для клиентов месте.  Сейчас она открыла в центре  своего района  салон красоты, наняла 3 работников,и клиентам очень нравиться  услуги Адолат.  В данный момент ей необходима определенная сумма , так как она заказала в Москве свадебные платья, скоро весна  и сезон свадеб начинается.
texts.en:
Adolat is 46 years old and has two children. Her life did not turn out well, but she is not the kind who gives up. After the collapse of the USSR, she was left without work as many others, and she got divorced with her husband. In time, she became a student of a friend who taught her to cut hair and when she learned she saved some necessary capital. Her sister gave her money to help Adolat open her own hair salon. It was tough for Adolat and her children without a man in the family, but she remarried and her husband supported her business. To this day she has eighteen years experience in this field, she cuts hair, styles and dyes it, and also rents wedding gowns. Her salon was not in a very good location for her customers. So she has opened a salon in the center of her region, hired three employees and her customers are very happy with Adolat's services. At this time she needs a certain amount of money to cover the cost which went towards ordering wedding gowns from Moscow. The spring is coming soon and so is the wedding season.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wedding gowns and expand business

loans.name: Kuldosh

texts.en:
Kuldosh is 58 years old but in spite of his years he still works in the fields. He and his three sons grow potatoes on land that he rents. They work from early in the morning to late at night. Kuldosh would like to have a rich harvest this season so that his son can get married. To make this possible, he has applied for a loan to buy more potato seeds.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only 7 percent of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients have a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy potato seeds

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en:
Nasiba is raising her four children while her husband is in Russia seeking a job. Since she is alone, she decided to start her own business breeding cattle. Because she has worked in this field before, business is good. Today she has three cows and two sheep. She also has lots of hay and forage--enough for more cattle than she currently owns. So she decided to take out a loan to buy more cattle.

loans.use: To buy more cattle

loans.name: Sadokat

texts.en:
Sadokat is married and has one child. Her husband makes a living as a driver, but his salary isn’t enough to feed their young family. So Sadokat decided to learn how to sew dresses. After completing her training, she bought herself a simple old sewing machine, then started buying fabrics from the market and sewing men and women’s versions of the national dresses. But now she understands that her sewing machine is not good enough to make better dresses. So she decided to apply for a loan to buy a new sewing machine which will allow her to make better dresses for her clients.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Zumratoi

texts.ru: Душабаева Зумратой 1975 года рождения  замужем имеет 2 детей. Она сидит дома муж уехал на заработки. Каждый месяц присылает деньги. Но  ее подруги занимаются  бизнесом, ей посоветовали заняться откормом скота. У нее дома есть овцы,  она ухаживает за ними. Подруги поддержали ей в бизнесе, они в таком же положении, как и Зумратой,  им помогают братья отвозить скот на продажу на рынок, каждую субботу.  Она получает кредит для откорма скота , брат ее мужа решил помочь  , каждый день она ухаживает за скотом, а через 3-4 месяца  они отвозят скот на рынок и продают по выгодной им цене. Если скот продают по дороже , то приобретают еще один скот по дешевле и корм для скота.
texts.en:
Zumratoi D. was born in 1975 and is married with two children. She has stayed behind while her husband is away working. Each month he sends home money. Her friends run a business and advised her to take up raising cattle, so she raises sheep at home. Her friends supported her business aspirations because they live in circumstances similar to hers, and their brother helps them by taking the livestock to market on Saturdays. Zumratoi buys livestock feed on credit. Her brother-in-law has decided to help out, while she takes care of the day-to-day care of the livestock. Every three to four months they take the cattle to market and sell them at a profit. If the price of livestock is up, they purchase an additional head and livestock feed.


Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Ali

texts.ru: Алиев Али житель района Шахринав.Возраст 36 лет,женат.Али вот уже 6 лет занимается куплей продажей крупно-рогатого скота.Он скупает на местном рынке молодых телят,откармливает их и перепродает на том же рынке.Бизнес является основным источником дохода его семьи.Планирует погасить кредит в тчении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Ali A. lives in the Shahrinav region. He is 36 years old and married. For the past six years Ali has bought and sold large-horned cattle. He buys young calves at the local market, feeds them and resells them at the very same market. This business is the main source of income for his family. He plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase cash flow

loans.name: Ruth's Group

texts.en: K. Ruth is the leader of Victory group in Kampala. She is a hard-working businesswoman with a retail shop that she has been running for 6 years now. She is grateful that she has seen her shop grow from a very small shop selling a few items to a much bigger shop that has increased in capital and the amount of products to be sold. In her shop she sells cereals, oils, maize, and wheat flour plus bread and so much more. With the loan, she plans to increase the quantity of products in her shop for more profits.

loans.use: To increase inventory.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ru: Алиев Хасан житель района Шахринав .Возраст 49 лет,женат ,имеет 5 детей.Образование средне-техническеое,по специальности механик. Клиент занимается  куплей продажей крупного рогатого скота.В семье клиента работает только он .Жена занимается   домашним хозяйством.На полученный кредит Хасан хочет закупить 2-х бычков.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Hasan A. resides in the region of Shahrinav, is 49 years old, married and has five children. He has a secondary school education, and trained as a mechanic. He specializes in the buying and selling of large-horned cattle, and is the sole support of his family, because his spouse is a housewife. With this loan Hasan wants to purchase two bulls, and plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of two bulls

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en: Sarah K. is the chairperson of the 4-member group known as the Byona Biyinzika Lending Group in Kyebando, Uganda. She is 57 years old and married with 10 children, who are all grown up, and 6 dependents whom she care for. Sarah has two businesses: a poultry business keeping layers and broilers plus a health drug business selling mostly vitamins, nutritional supplements, and products for HIV/AIDS prevention and care. Her customers come from all over Kyebando, Nansana, and Kampala. She has been operating the business for 6 years and has been a member of her lending group for the past 9 years. With her loan, she plans to buy more health products to distribute in the markets and chicken mash for feeding her chicks.

loans.use: To purchase health products for sale and chicken feed.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en: Charito G., 46 years old from East Poblacion, Rizal, Zamboanga del Norte owns and operates a "sari-sari" (variety) store.  She is married and the mother of three children.  Her husband is a fire fighter, but his salary is not enough to sustain the family's needs. Charito's sari-sari store increases the family income. Mrs. G. and her husband put most of their extra money towards education for their children. Charito has worked hard to grow her business from the little store she built with 3000 Philippine Pesos (63 USD). She is amazed by how far she has come, and is hopeful for the future of her business. They have built a network loyal customers, mainly friends and neighbors. Charito had been a member of Paglaum MPC for three year, and she has never missed a payment.

loans.use: buying supplies and expanding inventory

location.town: East Poblacion, Rizal, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Joweria Kikomeko Group

texts.en: K. Joweria is the chairperson of the 12-member Kisakyamukama Lending Group in Kikajjo, Namasuba, Uganda. The group meets at her home. She has been running a retail shop for more than 20 years and the shop has never faltered since she joined her group. Joweria’s children are all grown up but she cares for 4 school-age dependents at her home. Her past loans have helped her a great deal, allowing for savings that help with school fees and upkeep. She now needs a loan to help with restocking her shop.

loans.use: To purchase inventory.

loans.name: Zenie

texts.en: Zenie C. is 39 years old, married and has 3 kids.  Her husband is a motorcycle driver. They admit that living with only the income from driving is difficult.  Education for her children is also an expense that they have to suffer.  Zenie thought of opening a store on their doorstep.  It's a matter of "diskarte" (strategies) on how to live life.  One has to work hard and make sacrifices.  Zenie and her husband really take care of their business.  The populated area around her store is what gives her the edge over other stores in the area.  They hope that Paglaum MPC will always be there for them in times of need.  To put up a decent home and children established with their own field is a dream come true for the C. family.

loans.use: purchase of additional inventories to her sari-sari store

loans.name: Mirna

texts.en:
Mirna is a 28-year-old woman who lives in Bourj el Barajneh in the southern suburbs of Lebanon. Mirna has been working as a home hairdresser and doing tattoos for nine years. 

She has requested a loan of $1200 USD from Al Majmoua to purchase merchandise for her business and needles for tattoos. Mirna has been a microcredit client for six years and has always paid on time.

Her previous loans have influenced her life in a good way. Thanks to the loans, she was able to improve her work and her family situation. Mirna is special in her work because she is talented and she does it well. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. In the future, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: Mirna will use the loan to purchase merchandise for her business and needles for tattoos.

loans.name: Vincent's Group

texts.en: Vincent S. is a member of the 10-member Byona Biyinzika group in Kyebando, Uganda. He is a businessman and since 1993 he has been a distributor of sodas and beer that he sells in cases to retailers who sell to their customers for 600 – 700 shillings. The beers and sodas are distributed to Vincent's shop directly and he does not have to spend on transport costs. He has been with his lending group for the past nine years and he has not regretted it. Vincent has a dream of using he savings to build commercial houses for rent. With his loan, he plans on stocking more beers and sodas.

loans.use: To increase inventory.

loans.name: Marguérite

texts.fr: Née à Dangbo; un petit village situé à près de 32 Km de la ville de Porto-Novo, la capitale politique du BENIN, dans le département de l'OUEME. A. Marguérite est âgée de 35 ans et est mariée à DASSI Fulbert un mécanicien de profession qui exerce son activité dans leur domicile. Mère d'une fille de 2 ans, A. Marguérite vend des habits pour enfants, des produits de beauté et de cheveux. A. Marguérite exerce cette activité depuis 17 ans. Elle est à son troisième crédit.
texts.en:
Born in Dangbo, a small village located about 32 km from the city of Porto-Novo, the political capital of BENIN, in OUEME County, Ms. Marguérite A. is married to Fulbert DASSI, a mechanic by trade who works at home. She is 35 years old and the mother of a 2-year-old girl. She sells children's clothing and beauty products and has been in this business for seventeen years. This is her third loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and beauty products

loans.name: Mchakato Group

texts.en:
Margaret M., age 37, is married with two children, ages 15 and 17.  She has a grocery where she sells only drinks. She started this business three years ago and works daily from 8am until 11pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of around $729. 

This will be Margret’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase the stock of her grocery and has repaid the loans successfully. She now hopes for a second loan to start selling food.
\t
Margaret will share this loan with her loan group, Mchakato, which totals 15 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Margaret is second from the right.

loans.use: To start selling food products

loans.name: Mukadas

texts.ru: Сидикова Мукадас жительница района Варзоб.Возраст 34 года,разведенна ,имеет 1 ребенка.Образование высшееюРабатает в детском садике.Заработная плата маленькая,поэтому клиентка занимается пошивом занавесей.На доход от бизнеса она содержит свою семью.На полученный кредит Мукадас хочет закупить у оптовых поставщиков ткань.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mukadas S. is a resident of the Varzob region. She is 34 years old, is divorced and has 1 child. Mukadas has a college education; she works in a daycare center. Her salary is small, so she also sews curtains. Mukadas uses the earnings from her business to support her family. She will use her loan to purchase fabric from wholesalers. She plans to pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric

loans.name: Muungano Group

texts.en:
Khadija M., age 44, is married with four children ages 27, 25, 22 and 18. She has a grocery and a retail shop where she sells food. She started these businesses in 1994 and works daily from 7am until 11pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of about $800. 

This will be Khadija’s six’s loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the first five to increase the stock in both businesses and has paid the loans back successfully. She now hopes for a new loan, part of it to increase her stock, to buy chairs for the grocery and to buy an ironing table for home use. 

Khadija will share this loan with subgroup A of the Muungano group. The subgroup has 7 members, who run shops, grocery, sell clothes, food and charcoal. These members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Khadija is 1st on the right.

loans.use: To increase her inventory, buy more chairs for grocery and ironing table

loans.name: Pascaline

texts.fr: Originaire d’Afanmè, un village situé à près de 58 km de la ville de Porto-Novo (capitale politique du BENIN) dans le département de Plateau. B. PASCALINE est née le 10  Avril 1977 à  Cotonou. Mère de trois enfants dont deux garçons et une fille,tous scolarisés sauf le benjamin qui n’a pas encore l’âge d’être scolarisé. B. PASCALINE s’est mariée à AHOSSA  Marcel, couturier de profession. Le couple vit à Agbodjèdo un quartier périphérique de la ville de Cotonou. PASCALINE vend des balles de Bazin (tissus riche) et des divers. Elle va s’approvisionner à Lomé et à TOKPA, le marché international du BENIN. Sa clientèle devient de plus en plus nombreuse; et elle n’arrive pas à satisfaire toute la demande de sa clientèle. Actuellement ses activités économiques sont très florissantes et le besoin de financement se fait sentir de plus en plus. C’est pour cela qu'elle sollicite son troisième prêt.
texts.en:
From Afanmè, a village located about 58 km from the city of Porto-Novo (political capital of BENIN) in Plateau County, Ms. Pascaline B. was born on April 10, 1977 in Cotonou. The mother of three children (two boys and one girl) who are all in school (except the youngest, who is not yet school-age), she is married to Marcel AHOSSA, a tailor by trade. The couple live in Agbodjèdo, an outlying village of Cotonou. She sells bales of damask (a rich fabric) and various other items and is going to supply herself in Lomé and in TOKPA, the international marketplace of BENIN. Her customers are becoming more and more numerous, and she isn't able to satisfy all their demands. Currently, business is booming, so the need for financing is being felt more and more. This is why she is requesting her third loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy damask and other items

loans.name: Haysam

texts.en:
Haysam is a 44-year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their six children. Haysam has been working as a constructor for fifteen years. He requested a loan of 700 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that Haysam has requested a loan.

His clients are his neighbors and the people for his area. When he first started his business, he didn’t have much start-up capital. Haysam decided on doing this business because of his experience in it. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase tools for his work

loans.name: Cheikh Oumar

texts.fr: cheikh est agé de 39 ans ,il est marié et pére de 3 enfants.Pour gagner sa vie il a depuis trois (03)ans  ouvert un atelier de réparation  de vente de pneus et de chambre à air pour les vehicules.A fin de renforcer son activité  par la l 'achat de quantités importante de pneus et chambre à air ,il sollicite un prêt .
texts.en:
Cheikh is 39 years old, married, and the father of three. To earn his living, he opened a vehicle repair shop three years ago. In order to bolster his business, he is requesting a loan to buy a significant number of tires and inner tubes.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jamaica Group

texts.en:
Nasra S., age 39, is married with three children, ages 14, 9 and 3. She has a charcoal  and fish businesses that she started 3 years ago. She works daily from 8am until 6pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of about $.218. 

This will be Nasra’s fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the three previous loans to improve both of her businesses and has repaid the loans successfully. She now hopes for a new loan to increase her fish stock. 

Nasra will share this loan with subgroup B of the Jamaica group. The subgroup has 6 members who run stationeries, and sell fish, charcoal, and clothes. These members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. 

In the picture, Nasra is the second person from the left in the back row.

loans.use: To increase her fish stock

loans.name: Tushikamane Kongwe Group

texts.en:
Saluma M., age 36, is married with one child of 19 years. She owns a cosmetics shop which she started in 2004 and works daily from 8am until 8pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of about $73. 

This will be Saluma’s third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the first two loans to open a shop.  She used to sell her products from door to door and has paid the loans back successfully. She now hopes for a new loan to open yet another shop.

Saluma will share this loan with subgroup B of the Tushirikiane Komgwa group. The subgroup has 7 members, who run different types of shops, some sell charcoal, some are tailors. These members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Saluma is 1st on the left.

loans.use: Open another shop for clothing and cosmetics

loans.name: Christine

texts.fr: Née en 1977 à Agbato, un quartier périphérique de Cotonou dans le département de l’ATLANTIQUE, K.  Christine est mariée à AZIZAHO Toussaint, menuisier de profession.Christine est mère de quatre enfants dont deux garçons et deux filles tous scolarisés. Christine vend de la nourriture devant son domicile où elle vit depuis son enfance. Avec les revenus de l'activité du mari, le couple n’arrivait plus à faire les besoins de leurs enfants. Car l'activité du mari ne marche plus.le mari a abandonné son métier pour devenir conducteur de taxi moto, localement appelé Zémidjan. Christine s’est aussi lancée depuis sept ans dans la vente de crevettes fumées, du savon et des détergeants. Actuellement le couple arrive à satisfaire les besoins de leurs enfants. La demande de sa clientèle est forte; c'est pourquoi elle sollicite un troisième crédit.
texts.en:
Born in 1977 in Agbato, a suburb of Cotonou in the department of Atlantique, Christine K. is married to Toussaint Azizaho, a carpenter. Christine has four children: two boys and two girls who all attend school. Christine sells food in front of her home, where she has lived since childhood. With the money her husband was making, the couple was not able to support their children. Because her husband's work is not making money, he is now driving a mototaxi, locally called a "Zémidjan". Christine has also been selling smoked shrimp for seven years, as well as soap and detergents. The couple is now able to support their children. Customer demand is high, which is why she is asking for this, her third loan.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy smoked shrimp, sundries, "pagnes" and plastic dishes.

loans.name: Onakhon

texts.en:
D. Onakhon is 56 years old, married and has a son. Years ago, Onakhon's lack of a stable job and the slow growth of her husband's construction business mean that the family did not have enough money to pay its expenses. This was why Onakhon decided to start her own business seven years ago selling fabrics used to make her nation's favorite style of dresses. Little by little, she has made her business grow, and because she allows her clients to pay in installments her orders are getting bigger and her business is doing well. However, she would like to continue to improve her life (and grow her business) so that her life will be more stable in the future. She is asking for a loan of $1,000 that she will pay back in six months. With this money, Onakhon will be able to buy seasonal fabrics. Please help her business grow. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

loans.use: To buy more fabrics

loans.name: Matar

texts.fr: Agé de 28 ans Matar est un celibataire sans enfant.Il a abandonné les études à, l 'école primaire pour apprendre le metier de tailleur ce qui lui a permis aujourd'hui  ouvrir son propre atelier qu'il gere depuis cinq (5) ans.Les revenus tirés de son activité lui permettent d'entretenir ses parents et ses freres.Avec le prêt sollicité.Matar envisage d'acheter une nouvelle machine à coudre  pour faire face aux mutations du metier.
texts.en:
Matar is 28 years old, single and has no childrren.She left school at the primary level to learn the trade of tailoring, which allowed her to start her own workshop, 5 years ago. The revenue earned from her business enables her to look after her parents and brothers. With this requested loan, Matar hopes to buy a new sewing machine to keep up with changes in the trade.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating funds to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Shuhratjon

texts.en:
H. Shuhratjon is 24 years old, married and has two children. For the last two years, he has made a living as a taxi driver using his own vehicle. Shuhratjon's goal is to provide high-quality service at a reasonable price. He works hard to make his business stable and profitable, as he is the main bread-winner in his large family, which includes his parents. He is always ready to work, from early morning till late at night, in order to keep his current customers and win new ones. As with any business, Shuhratjon must make investments from time to time. And at the present moment, his car needs repairs. To make this possible, Shuhratjon is applying for a $800 loan for 12 months. He thanks everyone for supporting him and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner. Please help him improve his family's life.

loans.use: For repairs to his taxi

loans.name: Uguloy

texts.en:
R. Uguloy is 40 years old, married and has four children. With her husband, she runs a business buying and selling cows. She would like to secure a loan of $900 for nine months in order to buy additional cows to increase her inventory and meet customer demand. She believes this will lead to greater revenue and, ultimately, greater profit for her family. In the future, she would like to reinvest the earnings generated by this loan back into her business to purchase even more cows and increase her income even further. She and her husband plan to use their increased earnings to fund their children’s education. Uguloy deeply appreciates the trust and support her lenders are giving her.

loans.use: To expand her business by buying additional cows.

loans.name: Bahromjon

texts.en:
T. Bahromjon is 42 years old, married and has four children. He makes his living as a market vendor, having sold fruit for the past 20 years. Over this period of time, Bahromjon had acquired the knowledge and skills required to succeed in this business. For instance, he knows how to store fruit so that it remains marketable and does not lose its taste. He sells melons, apples, pears and pomegranates in his town's central market. He is well-known in this market for his attractive prices and friendliness. All of this allows Bahromjon’s business to generate the stable income his family needs. During this time of year, demand for Bahromjon’s products is high. That is why he is planning to buy more fruit to sell. He is requesting a loan that will allow him to do this and expand his business. He promises to repay the loan within 10 months and thanks everyone who chooses to support him.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Kulmahmat

texts.ru: Эралиев Кулмахмат житель города Турсунзаде.Возраст 57 лет,женат,имеет 5 детей.Клиент при доме имеет небольшой земельный участок,на котором  сеет пшеницу.Собрав урожай ,клиент в течении года не покупает на рынке муку и хлебо-булочную продукцию.На получененый кредит Кулмахмат хочет купить минеральные удобрения для пшеницы.Планирует погасить крдит в тчении 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Kulmahmat E. resides in the town of Tursun-zoda. He is 57 years old, married and has five children. At home he has a small plot of land, where he plants wheat. After he harvests his crop, he has no need to buy flour or bread products for a year. With this loan Kulmahmat wants to buy chemical fertilizer for the wheat. He plans to repay the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Fathullo

texts.en:
Fathullo runs a computer center where he offers various services. He is married and has three children. His wife is a housekeeper. At his center, customers can print out, type, fax, copy and scan documents, among many many other things. As his work is of very high quality, he has a lot of clients. Unfortunately in wintertime they have limited access to electricity so he can work only for 1-3 hours per day. That’s why he decided to buy a generator so he can have electricity all day long.

loans.use: To buy a generator

loans.name: Raïmatou

texts.fr: Née le 01/12/1968 à Cotonou le capitale éconmique du BENIN, Y. Raïmatou est originaire de LAGBE un petit village situé à plus de 42 Km de la ville de Porto-Novo,la capitle politique du BENIN. Y. Raïmatou est mariée à MOUSTAPHA Ibrahim, vendeur de pneux d'occacion à Zongo, un quartier populaire de cotonou. Raïmatou a trois enfants dont un garçon et deux filles tous scolarisés.Raïmatou exerce l'activité de la vente des ustensiles de cuisines, des balaies, des glacières, des boles et bassines en plastiques, des verres et des miroirs.Raïmatou va s'approvisionner à Tokpa, marché international du Bénin. Elle sollicite un troisième prêt.
texts.en:
Born on December 1, 1968 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Raïmatou Y. is originally from Lagbe, a small village 42 km from the town of Porto-Novo, the political capital of Benin. Raïmatou Y. is married to Ibrahim Moustapha who sells used tires in Zongo, a densely populated neighbourhood of Cotonou. Raïmatou has three children: one boy and two girls who all attend school. Raïmatou sells kitchen utensils, brooms, coolers, plastic bowls and basins, glasses and mirrors. Raïmatou travels to Tokpa to buy her goods: this is the international market of Benin. This is her third loan.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plastic bowls and basins, coolers, brooms, mirrors.

loans.name: Juraev

texts.en:
Akbar is married and has one child. His wife has a degree and works as a teacher in high school. But unfortunately her salary isn’t enough to support the family, so Akbar started a business transporting goods with his truck. He has done this for more than three years, but earns barely enough money to live on. So he decided to save on road expenses by buying another gas cylinder. He also wants to get some spare parts for his truck.

loans.use: To buy a gas cylinder for his truck.

loans.name: Abdullo

texts.ru: Алламуродов Абдуло житель города Турсунзаде .Возраст 30 лет, женат ,имеет 3 детей.Образование среднее.Клиент работает таксистом,так же занимается выращиванием пшеницы.Так как мука  на рынке стоит намного дороже. На полученный кредит Абдулло планирует закупить минеральные удобрения для хорошего урожая.Планирует погасить кредит в тчении 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Abdullo A. is a resident of the town of Tursun-zoda. He is 30 years old, married and has three children. He has a secondary school education and drives a taxi. Abdullo also raises wheat because flour is much more expensive at the market. With this loan Abdullo plans to purchase mineral fertilizer to increase his harvest. He will repay the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Bekmurot

texts.en:
A. Bekmurot is 41 years old, married and the father of four children. Bekmurot is a hard-working and enterprising man who constantly tries to do things better and improve day after day. He works hard in his fields, where he spends as much time as possible providing the care is crops need, fertilizing his land and spraying to prevent diseases that might affect his yields. Bekmurot needs tools and fertilizers to continue his difficult work, so that his crops can be taken to the capital for sale. That's why he's applying for a loan of $850 for eight months. Let's reach out to help Bekmurot!

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, fuel and lubricants.

loans.name: Olawoyin

texts.en: Olawoyin A. sells drinks wholesale and retail, and she has been in this business since 2005. She needs the loan amount of N140000 to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. She has a deep freezer where she cools her drinks for her customers. A. is 37 years old and married with 3 children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Nabi

texts.en:
A. Nabi is 40 years old, married and the loving father of five children. For eight years, Nabi has been raising cattle and growing crops on his land with his wife, who we see here. He is now planning to sow wheat on his two-hectare plot. He wants to borrow money to buy fertilizer, fuels and lubricants to increase his yield. He also wants to use part of the loan to buy more cattle. To make all of this possible, Nabi is asking for a loan of $725 for eight months. You could become an important part of the Nabi family's life, and he deeply appreciates the trust and support Kiva lenders are giving him.

loans.use: To buy supplies and purchase more cattle.

loans.name: Yatim

texts.ru: Ашуров Ятим житель района Ваорзоб.Возраст 56 лет,женат ,имеет 9 детей.Образование среднее.Клиент занимается животноводством.Клиент покупает на рынке молодых телят и откармливает их в течении 45 дней.После чего продает их на рынке.На доход от этой деятельности содержит свою семью.На полученный кредит хочет купить очередного бычка.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Yatim A. is a resident of the Varzob region. He is 56 years old, is married and has 9 children. He has a secondary education. The client raises livestock. He purchases young calves at the market and raises them for 45 days. After this he sells them at the market. He uses the earnings from this business to support his family. Yatim will use his loan to purchase another calf. He plans to pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a calf

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca is an industrious woman who assists her husband in making sure the home is in good order. She styles hair for people and also sells styling creams and combs. She has been in this business for the past ten years.  Francisca needs the loan amount of N140000 to purchase more weave-on hair extensions to sell. She is a client of LAPO (Kiva's Field Partner). Francisca is 42 years old and married with six children. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more weave-on hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Abduraim

texts.en:
E. Abduraim is married and has five children. His family may be typical for his town of Shahrituz, Tajikistan, but Abduraim is a unique entrepreneur. Together with his wife (who we see in the photo), he has sold shoes in the central city market for about 15 years. The secret of his success is simple: he tries to not only let customers know the benefits of his products – he also develops relationships that keep them coming back again and again. However, he doesn’t want to stop where he is with his venture. Abduraim is seeking a loan to re-stock his store for the current season. We believe that Abduraim’s desire to excel at pleasing his customers will bring further success and encourage new customers to buy from him.

loans.use: To buy new shoes and boots for men.

loans.name: Odiyi

texts.en: Odiyi N. is a hard-working young lady. She has a boutique where she sells male and female clothes, bags, and shoes. She has been in this business since 2005. She is a dedicated client of  LAPO (Kiva's Field Partner). She needs the loan amount of N140000 to purchase more clothes to sell. She hopes to increase her profit margin. She is 32 years old and single. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Muhaiyo

texts.en:
I. Muhaiyo is 43 years old. She is married and the loving mother of two children. Muhaiyo is a market vendor. She started out three years ago with only a few products, but her business is currently more stable. Muhaiyo sells fruits such as apples, bananas, mandarins, pomegranates, and pears. In the market, she is known for her friendliness and for the attractive prices. All of this allows Muhaiyo’s business to generate a good, stable income for her family. Currently, Muhaiyo wants to expand her business and she is requesting a loan of 2000 Somoni (US $575), which she will repay in 6 months. She would like to thank everyone for supporting her.

loans.use: Purchasing fruit to increase the range of goods for sale

loans.name: Fozila

texts.en:
Fozila is an enterprising woman with a great desire to improve the quality of life for her family. She is married and the mother of two children. Fozila has been a seamstress since she was very young, learning in her mother's shop. With a lot of effort, she has been able to open her own shop at her home and has been successful because her customers have recognized the high quality of her products. In this way, she constantly adds new clients and has seen her business grow. Today, Fozila is applying for her fourth loan through IMON International. She is requesting a loan of 4000 Somoni (US $1150) for the term of 12 months for purchasing new, modern fabrics for sewing national dresses. You can help improve the quality of life of her family. Fozila and her children are grateful for your generosity and support.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets (including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others). loans.use: Purchasing fabrics for sewing the national dress

loans.name: Shoira

texts.en:
R. Shoira is 38 years old. She is married with two children. Shoira has a tailoring business at her home. Her business is sewing clothing for women and children. Her workmanship is very good and she has a good eye for design. She is very organized and has a good head for business. She has had this business for 8 years and this is her second loan from IMON International. With her loan, she is planning to purchase a new sewing machine. She promises to repay the loan in 12 months. Help this family improve the quality of their life by contributing to the growth of Shoira’s business. They will sincerely thank you for it.

loans.use: Purchasing a new sewing machine

loans.name: Habiba

texts.ru: Одинаева Хабиба жительница района Варзоб. Возраст 44 года,замужем ,имеет 5 детей. Образование среднее.Клиентка занимается животноводством.Имеет опыт в этой деятельности более 20 лет.Животноводством является основынм источником дохода ее большой семьи.На полученный кредит Хабиба хочет купить 2-х бычков.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Habiba O. lives in the Varzob region. She is 44 years old, married and has five children. She has secondary education and does animal husbandry. She has more than 20 years of experience in this field. Animal husbandry is the only source of income for her large family. Habiba wants to use the loan to buy two calves. She plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two calves

loans.name: Norboy

texts.en:
Norboy is 42 years old and lives with his wife and five children. He is a humble farmer dedicated to growing produce such as potatoes, onions, wheat, corn, and other crops. He is gratified with the harvest of his land and wants to harvest even more. However, he needs to invest money for a larger harvest with better results because vegetables of better quality will increase his income from sales. Norboy also raises livestock. Now he wants to increase his crop production and to purchase more cattle to breed, so he has applied to IMON International for a loan of 3000 Somoni (US $875) for the term of 12 months.  
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets (including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others). loans.use: Purchasing of plants and livestock

loans.name: Morekegi

texts.en: Morekegi sells drinks, bottled water, and sachet water. She needs the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She is 35 years old and married with a child. She hopes to expand her business through this Kiva loan. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Barno

texts.ru: Сидикова Барно жительница района Варзоб.Возраст 57 лет,замужем,имеет 4 детей.Барно более 35 лет занимается животноводством.В данное время в ее доме нет дойной коровы.К своим средством она хочет добавить кредит и купить дойную корову. Имея коорову,дающая молоко  Барно обеспечит свою семью молоком и кисло-молочной продукцией.Планирует погасить крдит в течении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Barno S. is a resident of the Varzob region. She is 57 years old, is married and has 4 children. Barno has been raising livestock for over 35 years. Currently she does not own a dairy cow. She would like to take out a loan and use it, combined with money that she already has, to purchase a dairy cow. By owning a cow, Barno will be able to provide her family with milk and dairy products. She plans to pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Kholmat

texts.en:
Kholmat N. is 43 years old and lives with his wife and five children. He has been breeding cattle for more than three years, and he is trying to improve the breed in order to increase his prices. He invests time and money in the feed and medicines that the animals require. He enjoys this work, especially getting milk from his cows, which he sells in local markets. Kholmat keeps going, thanks to the help and enthusiasm of his children and his wife, who helps him with caring for the animals. Now, Kholmat needs a loan of 2500 Somoni (US $725) to purchase more cattle to expand his business. With your help this will be possible.

loans.use: Purchasing cattle and calves to expand business

loans.name: Menzelakhon

texts.en:
Menzelakhon is a devoted mother who struggles day after day to provide the best for her family. Ten years ago, she got the idea to start raising cattle to contribute to the family finances, taking advantage of the space she had available in their land for this business. She and her husband are engaged in this business together. Slowly, the number of cows has increased and her clients have started asking for more and more. With an endless list of requests, she has finally decided to increase the number of livestock she keeps and for this reason she is requesting a loan. Be an important part of the growth of Menzelakhon’s business.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets (including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others). loans.use: Purchasing cattle and calves to expand the business.

loans.name: Kholiyar

texts.en:
Kholiyar C. is 37 years old. He and his wife (pictured here) have five children. Kholiyar has a middle special education. His specialization is engineering, but he went into agriculture because his salary was too small to feed his family and pay for his children’s education. Kholiyar works hard to cultivate his crops, such as potatoes, carrots, onions, and other vegetables. He works from early morning till late at night, hoping to have a rich harvest. Kholiyar sells his produce in the market where it is always in high demand due to its good quality. He also raises cattle. His work fills him with great optimism and allows him to help his beloved children. His goal is to improve the quality of his agricultural products even more and grow his business. Kholiyar has a large and friendly family who are all always trying to help each other. Today Kholiyar requests a loan of 2500 Somoni (US $725) for the term of 9 months to buy fertilizer and also calves. Let's help Kholiyar as he works hard to improve the quality of life for his family.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets (including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others). loans.use: Purchasing mineral fertilizer and calves

loans.name: Parmonkul

texts.en:
Parmonkul C. is 55 years old. He is married with two children. Parmonkul works in agriculture and has always been efficient in his labors. The role of being a father for 27 years has helped him to understand the sacrifice and hard labor of the women of the house. He grows potatoes, onions, carrots, and other kinds of vegetables in his garden. Parmonkul dreams of making it possible for all of his children to be well educated and to ensure them with bright futures. That’s why he works from early morning till late at night. He wants to borrow a loan of 2500 Somoni (US $725) for the term of 9 months so he can buy mineral fertilizer, fuels, and lubricants. This request is in support of making his dream come true, and Parmonkul is asking for help from your generous heart. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets (including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others). loans.use: Purchasing seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Mrs. Emerita C. T. is a resident of Pan-ay, Clarin, Misamis Occidental blessed with 5 children and her husband who is a company driver. Two of her children are studying in college, two are in Elementary School, and her eldest son is a casual employee as a promodiser.

After her marriage life she has enjoyed raising swine in her backyard to use for her family's consumption during her childrens birthdays and other family occasions. But on the long run she decided to raise hogs and sells piglets to her neighbors. She personally manages and feeds her pigs in her backyard. 

Mrs. T. joined Paglaum MPC 4 years ago. She is a member in good standing at Masanagon Center at Pan-ay, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, and is very participative and helpful to her co-members. As of this moment she is applying for a loan of Twenty Thousand Pesos (Php 20,000.00) as additional capital to purchase feed for her pigs.

Her plan is to be able to fund her childrens college education and to build someday from backyard piggery to Farm Piggery with God's help and kind hearted Kiva Lenders.

loans.use: Feeds for her piggery business

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Mrs. E. is 46 years old, married with no children and resides in Maribojoc, Tudela. Her husband is motorcycle driver known as Habal-habal Driver and also a farmer. She started her grocery store when she got married, and because of a lack of profit, she borrowed the capital from her close friend and neighbor. Until now, her business still works with m management. Upon learning from her neighbor that Paglaum MPC is inviting new members to join the Coops programs, with a Theme "Helping People, Help Themselves". She became interested and became one of the members of Rose Center in Maribojoc, Tudela. She admires the continuous education conducted by the Technical Officer of their Center and enjoys being a member of the Cooperative. As this time, Mrs. E. is applying for a loan of Fourteen Thousand Pesos as additional capital to purchase grocery items for her grocery. Her plans are to be able to renovate her house and expand her business.

loans.use: Additional Grocery Items

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.en:
Gulshan N. is 30 years old. She teaches kindergarten. However, for seven years, Gulshan has also sold clothing. She sells socks for men and children in the central local market. Gulshan spends the income from the business for the well being of her family. Today, she requests 2500 Somoni (US $725) for purchasing new goods for selling. Gulshan promises to repay the loan in four months and thanks all who are supporting her. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets (including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others). loans.use: Purchasing new goods for selling in order to increase the range of goods.

loans.name: Yemisi

texts.en: Yemisi sells foodstuffs, and she has been in this business for a long time. She needs the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell to her customers. Yemisi is 40 years old and married with three children. She is a committed client of LAPO (Kiva's Field Partner). She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: Bola is 39 years old and married with three children. Bola sells foodstuffs and drinks. She has been in this business for the past eight years. She is a dedicated client of LAPO (Kiva's Field Partner). She needs the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and drinks to sell. She is grateful to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Edisa's Group

texts.en: N. Edisa has a stall selling cabbages, tomatoes, onions, carrots and spices. She lives in Kisoga, Uganda, and she has been a member of her 13-member group, Kyosiga, since its inception. She is a widow with 5 children and she pays their school fees single-handedly with the help of loans. Her eldest child is 14 years and the youngest is 1 year. She buys her goods from farmers in the villages and she sells from her stall.  With her portion of the loan, she intends to buy more cabbages, pineapples, carrots, onions, and tomatoes for sale. With the savings from previous loans, Edisa has bought goats that are kept at her home and next on the list is to buy a cow that will give her milk.

loans.use: To increase inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To supply her shop

loans.name: Christine's Group

texts.en: N. Christine sells used clothes by moving around to the daily markets in and around Kayunga, Mukono, and Jinja, Uganda. She is a married woman with 5 children of her own and 2 more children in her care. She sells mostly ladies skirts and blouses, nets, and children’s wear and previous loans have been helped her to increase her clothing inventory. As a result of using loans, Christine has been able to buy herself a plot of land, care for her parents, and buy two cows with the hope that they will produce and give her more milk.

loans.use: More ladies', children and men's clothes in a bale for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To supply his shop of ready-to-wear clothing

loans.name: Olufunke

texts.en: Olufunke sells provisions like toothpaste, toothbrushes, bathing soap, cream, etc. She needs the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. Olufunke is 34 years old and married with three children. She lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. Olufunke is a client of LAPO (Kiva's Field Partner). She says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell at her market.

loans.name: Bisola

texts.en: Bisola is 34 years old and married with two children. She is a client of LAPO (Kiva's Field Partner). Bisola sells provisions, drinks, and bottled water. She needs the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She hopes to expand her business. She says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell at her shop

loans.name: Adeyeyin

texts.en: Adeyeyin M. sells kerosene wholesale and retail to her customers. She has been in this business for a long time.  She hopes to expand this business through this Kiva loan.
