Agées de 38 ans  en moyenne, les femmes du groupe Benkadi, ont au moins 4 enfants chacune en charge et vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris leurs coépouses et leurs enfants. 
Ayant le souci d’améliorer leurs activités quotidiennes, ces femmes ont accueilli avec plaisir l’intervention de Soro Yiriwaso dans leur localité et depuis 3 ans maintenant elles sont clientes de cette institution. Ce prêt est leur cinquième après avoir remboursé correctement les quatre précédents.
 Elles habitent des grandes familles dans le village de kimparana où elles mènent diverses activités telles que la restauration, la vente de riz, de haricots et d’igname. 
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter en cette période de récolte des sacs de riz et du haricot à un prix abordable.  
 Elles vendent les nourritures dans des gargotes ou en ambulant au marché ou au carrefour. Le riz est acheté à koury kimparana et niokoyiri, vendu sec ou préparé sur place, elles réalisent un bénéfice moyen de 175 000FCFA par cycle. 
En plus du remboursement des intérêts du prêt de Soro Yiriwaso, les membres du groupe Benkadi utilisent une partie de leur épargne pour augmenter le fonds de commerce et faire face aux dépenses de la famille. Dans l’avenir, le groupe Benkadi souhaite rester en collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso en espérant avoir des montants élevés.
texts.en:
The six women of the Benkadi group of the Sorotekoumbela association from the village of Kimparana in Mali know each other well due to their traditional village association. Averaging 38 years of age, the women of the Benkadi group have at least four children each and live in traditional extended families with their husbands and co-wives and their children. Because they wanted to improve their daily revenues, these women welcomed Soro Yiriwaso in their area and have been clients for the past three years. This loan is their fifth as they have repaid all four previous loans. They live in large families in the village of Kimparana where they have a variety of businesses such as selling food, rice, beans and yams. This loan will be used to buy bags of rice and beans at a reasonable price as it is harvest time. They sell food in diners or walking in the marketplace or at crossroads. They buy their rice in Koury, Kimparana and Niokoyiri; it is sold dry or prepared on the spot. They make an average profit of 175,000 FCFA per cycle. In addition to repaying the loan interests to Soro Yiriwaso, the members of Benkadi use part of their savings to increase their businesses and pay household expenses. In the future, the Benkadi group wants to continue working with Soro Yiriwaso in the hope of borrowing more substantial amounts.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods for resale.

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
Ana es social del Bancomunal 24 de 0ctubre
Ana  tiene 40 años,  ella vive en la casa de sus padres, ella estudio administración de empresas pero lo dejo por falta de dinero, los pago de sus pensiones eran muy altos y no podía pagarlos consiguió trabajo  en una empresa “Proseguros” por varios años, lamentablemente  dejo el trabajo por que su mama le dio derrame cerebral, no había quien la cuide, su Papa es jubilado pero trabaja en construcción, una vez que su mama estaba mejor de salud empezó  nuevamente a trabajar como secretaria, pero al tiempo a la mama de Ana le da nuevamente le da otro derrame cerebral, Ana tuvo nuevamente que dejar de trabajar para cuidar a su mama, pero esta vez  con sus ahorros se compro un carro, en cual en la actualidad lo alquila  y se dedico a la venta de productos de bellaza por catalogo y a la venta de zapatos por Catalogo, desde hace ocho años. hace un año se acaba de casar. 
Desde que esta en Finca ella a crecido como micro empresaria con Finca pudo ahorrar hasta comprarse su carro, las charlas que a recibido han sido de mucho beneficio para ella.

Necesita un crédito de 1600 soles, que los va invertir en  pintar su carro y algunos arreglos que el carro necesita.
El sueño que tiene Ana  es quedar embarazada, quiere tener su hija, se esta sometiendo a tratamientos fertilización, es caro pero ella se esfuerza trabajando  y con la ayuda de Dios vera su sueño hecho realidad.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the Bancomunal 24 de 0ctubre. Ana is 40 years old and lives in her parents' house. She studied business administration but was forced to give it up for lack of funds. The school fees were very high and she was unable to pay them. She found work in the company Proseguros and was there several years. Unfortunately she had to leave her job because her mother suffered a brain hemorrhage and had no one to take care of her. Her father is retired but works in construction. Once her mother's health had improved, Ana began to work again as a secretary, but in time her mother suffered another brain hemorrhage and she was forced to leave her job in order to care for her mother. This time she used her savings to buy a car, which she now rents out. For eight years she has worked selling beauty products and shoes from catalogs. She got married a year ago. Since she's begun working with Finca she's grown a lot as a small-business owner. Finca made it possible for her to save up and buy her car, and the advice she's received has been very useful for her. She needs a loan of 1600 soles, which she will use to paint her car and do some needed repairs. Ana's dream is to become pregnant and have a daughter. She is undergoing fertility treatments. They are expensive but she works hard and with God's help will see her dream come true.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Painting and repairing her car

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina has been a private entrepreneur for some years and she works in the central market. She sells paint, brushes, and other items of this type, in Cahul. Her main activity is to manage the business, to have more sales, however, she works alone. The business is located in Cahul town.

Galina is experienced in commerce and has been in business for about 10 years. This is her second loan borrowed from MicroInvest. With the first one she was very diligent and the payments were always made on time. The purpose of the loan is to increase the assortment of goods.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of her goods

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza  es social del Bancomunal 24 de 0ctubre
Maritza es casada, tiene 45 años dos hijos de 16  y 7 años que estudian en la escuela estatal Francisco Bolognessi en San Juan.   
Empezó su negocio con un bazar en la casa de su suegra en el distrito de San Martín de Porras, pero  vive en San Juan, y la distancias eran muy lejos, dejaba sola a su hija que sufría de constantes cuadros de asma, primero era la salud de su hija,  tuvo que cerro su bazar.
Entro a trabajar en el cafetín del colegio donde su hija estudiaba, estuvo allí  por varios años, hasta que decidió poner  una bodega en su casa, ya tiene funcionando su bodega  tres años. 
Desde que esta en Finca ha aumentado su capital, con los prestamos que finca le da, le gusta las reuniones del Bancomunal, es el día mas esperado, por que se distrae y aprende de las demás socias.

Necesita un crédito de 2000 soles, para surtir su bodega y compra  harina, aceite, arroz, gaseosas y también quiere comprar joyas de plata para venderá en su bodega.
El sueño que tiene es tener otra tienda, un bazar y ver a su hijos profesionales.
texts.en:
Maritza is a member of the Bancomunal 24 de 0ctubre. Maritza is married and 45 years old. She has two children, 16 and 7 years old, who study in the Francisco Bolognessi public school in San Juan. She started her business with a general store in her mother-in-law's house in the San Martín de Porras district, but she lives in San Juan, which is quite far away. She had to leave her daughter, who suffered constant asthma attacks. Her first priority was her daughter's health, so she was forced to close down her store. She began working in the cafeteria at the school where her daughter was studying, and worked there several years before deciding to set up a grocery shop in her house. The shop has been in business for three years now. Ever since she has begun working with Finca her amount of capital has grown because of the loans they offer. She enjoys the Bancomunal meetings. It's the day she most looks forward to because she has fun and learns from the other members. She needs a loan of 2000 soles so she can stock her store and buy flour, oil, rice and sodas, and she also wants to buy silver jewelry to sell in the shop. Her dream is to have another shop, a general store, and for her children to become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for her store

loans.name: Eloisa

texts.en: Eloisa is a family woman with a loving husband and three children.  On the day we visited, two of her children were at school, so the picture includes only one daughter.  Eloisa operates a "colomado" that sells fresh food products.  Many of her products she cooks with her daughter.  This loan will finance an addition to the house that includes a kitchen and another room.  This renovation will greatly enhance the family's daily life and the business.  Please help finance Eloisa's dream!  Thank you!

loans.use: a new kitchen

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen  es social del Bancomunal 24 de 0ctubre
Carmen es casada, tiene 59 años, cinco hijos todos son mayores y están casados,  Cuando era joven  estudio cosmetología y trabajo en un salón de belleza, después puso  un salón pero no le fue bien,  tuvo que cerrar entonces iba  a las casas de sus clientas a cortar cabello y peinar, pero sufrió un accidente se rompió su brazo impidiéndole trabajar como estilista.     
Con el tiempo puso una bodega “La Única” por que por su casa no había bodega, y la gente buscaba donde comprar, también empezó a vender productos de belleza por catalogo. 
En las ventas por catalogo de producto de belleza, es vendedora estrella  ha logrado obtener la llave de plata, Carmen aprendió en Finca como vender, ha levantado su autoestima, por las charlas que ha recibido en el Bancomunal. 

Necesita un préstamo de 3200 soles, para la compra de cerveza, gas, cubrir los pagos de los productos por catalogo, comprar productos en oferta para su stock
El sueño que tiene es seguir creciendo como persona, sentirse útil, optimista trabajar hasta cuando tenga fuerzas, le gustaría conocer los Estados Unidos
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the Bancomunal 24 de 0ctubre. Carmen is married and 59 years old. Her five children are all married adults. When she was young she studied cosmetology and worked in a beauty salon. Later she started her own salon, but it didn't go well and she had to shut it down. She began visiting her clients' homes to cut and style their hair, but was in an accident and broke her arm, which prevented her from working as a stylist. After a while she set up a grocery shop, La Única, because there aren't any stores near her house and people needed a place to shop. She also began selling beauty products from a catalog. She's a top saleswoman in beauty product catalog sales and has received the silver key. With Finca, Carmen learned to sell and has a higher self-esteem thanks to the talks she's had in the Bancomunal. She needs a loan of 3200 soles in order to buy beer and gas, make payments for the catalog products, and purchase sale products for her shop inventory. Her dream is to continue growing as a person, feel useful and optimistic, and work as long as she can. She would like to visit the United States.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replenish shop inventory and make payments on catalog products

loans.name: Nimia

texts.es: Nimia cuenta con 26 años de edad, lleva conviviendo con su pareja cerca de 6 años y hace poco ha dado a luz a su primer hijo, viven en la casa de sus padres, en todo este tiempo ellos los han apoyado para comprar su terreno y luego construir, y de aquí a unos 3 meses se instalará a su casa propia. En este tiempo se está dedicando al cuidado de su hijo mientras adquiera los meses necesarios, se encarga de preparar los alimentos para su esposo y su padre que trabajan en la chacra, y para su madre que se dedica a pastar sus vacunos. Nimia y su esposo están muy agradecidos con su padre porque les han donado un par de hectáreas para que puedan sembrar y generar sus propios ingresos, asimismo la ha apoyado en la construcción de su casa con la mano de obra, por esa gratitud su esposo le apoyan en los trabajos de la chacra. En esta oportunidad van sembrar arvejas, papa y sus infaltables gladiolos, que sembrando en este mes llegará a cosechar exactamente el mes de mayo donde las flores llegan a subir de 30 a 80 ó 90 soles por paquete de 120 paletas. Nimia está muy contenta con la actividad que realiza, ella y su esposo tienen metas se seguir trabajando y progresando para poder comprar un terreno en la ciudad. Nimia conoció de MFP a través de su padre que perteneces a un banco comunal, debido a ello han organizado otro grupo donde ella es la secretaria, con el juramento de cumplir su cargo eficientemente y de realizar cada mes sus pagos correspondientes. Este dinero será invertido en la compra de sacos de abono y semillas de arvejas, Nimia está muy agradecida por la oportunidad de este crédito, el cual le permitirá independizarse de su padre, del quien siempre estará muy agradecida.
texts.en:
Nimia is 26 years old, married for nearly 6 years and recently had her first son. They live in her parent’s home and they have been supporting them so they may buy their own land and then build a home, and in about 3 months they will be in their own home. Nimia has been taking care of her son, and she is in charge of preparing the food for her husband and father who work on the farm, and for her mother who takes care of the cattle. Nimia and her husband are grateful to her father because they have given them some land where they can grow crops and generate their own income, as well as having supporting them in the building of their home with his labor, and in gratitude her husband helps her parents with the farm chores. Now they are going to plant peas, potatoes, and gladiolas, which if planted this month will be harvested in May when the flower prices increase from 30 to 80-90 soles per bundle of 120 pallets. Nimia is very happy with this work; she and her husband have goals to continue working and growing in order to be able to buy land in the city. Nimia became involved with MFP through her father who belongs to a communal bank, so they have organized another group of which she is secretary, and she promises to efficiently meet and pay her monthly payments. This money will be used to invest in the purchase of sacks of fertilizer and pea seeds. Nimia is very grateful for the opportunity to receive this loan, which will enable her to become self-sufficient and no longer rely on her father, to whom she will always be very thankful.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and pea seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To equip her center with new machines and supplies

loans.name: Djekafo (Parlons La Même Voix) Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Djekafo est un regroupement de 8 femmes de Sogomougou Koutiala (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali) qui se connaissent bien car vivent dans la même grande famille. Elles ont en moyenne 36 ans, mariées et mères d’au moins 3 enfants.
 Elles mènent  une seule activité (la vente de tabac en poudre.)Les feuilles de tabac sont d’abord pilées dans des mortiers pour les transformer en poudre avant la vente.
 Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a six mois. Le montant du prêt est passé de 50.000 FCFA au premier prêt à 75.000 FCFA pour le deuxième prêt après le remboursement du premier.  
Ce prêt sera utilisé pour acheter, des sacs de feuilles de tabac et d’autres ingrédients entrant dans la transformation en poudre. 
Elles se procurent  de ces marchandises à Béléko et Bamako (capitale du Mali). Elles vendent les produits finis dans tous les marchés qui sont aux environs de koutiala et au grand marché.
Les membres du groupe Djekafo comptent réaliser un bénéfice de 80 000 FCFA chacune avec ce prêt. 
 En dehors du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille. .
texts.en:
The Djekafo group is an association of 8 women from Sogomougou Koutiala ( the third administrative region of the republic of Mali) who are all members of the same large family. They are. on average, 35 years old, married and the mothers with at least 3 children.They all operate the same type of business, the sale of powered tobbaco. The tobacco leaves must be ground up in mortars to transform them into a powder before sale. To increase the size of their businesses, the members of this group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program, six months ago. The amount of this loan surpassed their first loan by 50,000 FCFA. This second loan of 75,000 FCFA will be taken out after repayment of their first loan. This loan will be used to buy sacks of tobacco leaves and other ingredients used in making the tobacco powder. They will buy these products in Beleko and Bamako, the capital of Mali. They will sell the finished products in all the markets around Koutiala and at the main market. The members of the Djekafo group each expect to earn a profit of 80,000 FCFA with this loan. Along with making loan payments, they will use part of the revenue to meet family expenses.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tobacco leaves and ingrediants

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana R. G. vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos, ellos tienen 30 años viviendo en su hogar, su esposo trabaja como taxista y la señora Juana R. tiene un negocio de venta de botanas llamado “Mini Snack Juany”, que es atendido por ella, este negocio lleva 5 años de estarlo operando.
La señora Juana R. está solicitando un préstamo para comprar equipo para su negocio para así poder atender a sus clientes más eficientemente y ofrecerles productos de mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Juana R. G. lives with her husband and her two children. They have lived in their home for 30 years. Her husband works as a taxi driver and Juana R. owns a business selling snacks called "Mini Snack Juany" that she attends. This business has been operated for five years. Juana R. is requesting a loan to purchase equipment for her business so she may attend to her customers more efficiently and offer them better quality products.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase equipment for her business.

loans.name: Amilcar

texts.es: Amilcar tiene 25 años de edad, es soltero, aún está viviendo en la casa de sus padres, sus demás hermanos ya migraron a otras ciudades. Cuando sus hermanos se fueron a vivir a otras ciudades se hizo cargo de todos los sembríos, tanto de su padre como los propios. Amilcar comenta que gracias a su madre a aprendió a ser responsable, ahora trata de cumplir en realizar el trabajo de las chacras de sus padres y de él mismo con gran responsabilidad. En esta oportunidad quiere incrementar sus siembras de papa con la siembra de más de 10 sacos de semilla, y también una bolsa de semilla de arvejas, para el próximo mes tiene preparada su chacra para sembrar maíz para su consumo propio. Labrar la tierra le complace enormemente, lo dificultad es cuando el mercado no cotiza un buen precio a los productos, y muchas veces con las justas llega a recuperar lo invertido. Amilcar ingresó a su banco comunal por recomendación de un cliente antiguo de ese banco, y en sus préstamos solicitados no ha caído en morosidad. Con el dinero que está solicitando es para la compra de un saco de semilla de arvejas y de abono para la chacra de papa.
texts.en:
Amilcar is 25 years old; he is single and still living in his parents' home. All his brothers have moved to other cities. When his brothers moved away, he took on the responsibility for all the crops: those of his father and well as his own. Amilcar says that thanks to his mother he learned to be responsible. He is trying to do the work on his parents' farm as well as his own with great responsibility. He wants to take this opportunity to increase his potato crops by sowing more than 10 bags of seed as well as a bag of seed of peas, and to prepare his farm to sow corn for his own consumption next month. He is very happy to work the land; it is hardest when the market does not pay well for his products and many times he just breaks even. Amilcar joined his community bank at the recommendation of a long-standing client of this bank, and he has repaid his loans on time. He will use the loan monies to buy a bag of pea seeds and fertilizer for his potato farm.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Priscila Maritza

texts.es:
Priscila es social del Bancomunal 24 de 0ctubre.
Priscila es de cerro de Pazco, tiene 43 años, tres hijos de 18, 11 y 7 años, ella  llega a Lima cuando tenia siete años por motivos de la  salud de su papá, quedándose a vivir en lima. Ella estudio contabilidad, teniendo oportunidad  de trabajar en la administración de un hostal en Villa solidaridad, por varios años  hasta que lamentablemente se separo de su esposo,  pasando momentos emocionales difíciles,  teniendo que dejar el trabajo y volver a casa de sus padres, ellos tienen negocio de alquiler de cochera, a los pocos años su papa falleció y ella se queda con la administración de la  cochera lo ha ampliado ahora tiene capacidad para 14 carros. También en la cochera piensa dar desayuno por las mañanas. 

Necesita el préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de material de construcción para ampliar la cochera.
La ayuda que ha recibido de finca es en cuanto a los prestamos sacar, para invertir en su negocio.
El sueño de Priscila es construir su casa y que su hija estudie psicología
texts.en:
Priscila became a member of the Bancomunal 24 de Octubre ("October 24th Communal Bank"). Priscila is from Cerro de Pazco, she is 43 years old, and has three children who are 18, 11, and 7 years old. She came to Lima when she was seven years old, and her family stayed in Lima because of her dad's health. She studied accounting and had the opportunity to do administrative work at a hostel in Villa Solidaridad for a few years until she unfortunately separated from her husband. Due to a difficult, emotional time, she had to leave her job and return to her parents' home. They have a rental car business. Her father passed away a few years ago and now she has to do the administrative work for the garage. She has increased the garage's capacity to 14 cars. She is also thinking of serving breakfast in the garage in the mornings. She needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy construction materials to expand the garage. The help that she has received from Finca has been about what loans to request in order to invest in her business. Priscila's dream is that she can build her own house and that her daughter will study psychology.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy construction materials to expand the garage.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria  es social del Bancomunal 24 de 0ctubre
Gloria es conviviente, tiene 53 años,  tres hijos todos mayores que estudian y trabajan.
Desde joven vendió productos de belleza por catalogo y entro a trabajar en un taller de costura por varios años, hasta que renuncio, pero hace tres años se dedica a dar menús, su esposo es jefe de una obra de construcción y ella lleva los menús cada día, reparte de 70 a 100 menús, en la cocina cuenta con un ayudante de cocina, todo tiene que estar listo a los 11 de la mañana lo lleva hasta la avenida arequipa. 

Necesita un crédito de 3000 soles, para comprar una olla arrocera de 10 kilos, implementar su cocina con la compra de licuadora, sartenes,  y remodelarla  
El sueño que tiene es de poner un negocio de bazar por que es mas reposado,  ella esta pensando en su vejez
texts.en:
Gloria is a member of the Bancomunal 24 de Octubre ("October 24th Communal Bank"). She is married, 53 years old, and has three older children who study and work. Since she was young, she sold beauty products from a catalog. She worked in a sewing shop for a number of years until she quit. But three years ago she started providing meals. Her husband is a construction boss. Every day, she brings the meals and hands out 70 to 100 of them. In the kitchen she relies on an assistant. Everything has to be ready by 11 A.M. She takes the food to Avenida Arequipa ("Arequipa Avenue"). She needs a loan of 3000 soles to buy a 10 kilo rice cooker, stock her kitchen with a blender and frying pans, and to remodel the kitchen. Her dream is to run a bazaar because of the more relaxed atmosphere. She is thinking about her old age.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She needs a loan of 3000 soles to buy a 10 kilo rice cooker, to buy a blender and frying pans, and to remodel her kitchen.

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es: Marleni cuenta con 28 años de edad, viene conviviendo con su pareja más de 9 años, fruto de ello tienen un hijo, esta familia vive en su casa propia. A los 19 años tuvo su hijo, desde entonces empezó a trabajar en la chacra con su esposo como lo hacía su madre y su padre, tenía que hacer todas sus labores cargando a su bebe, ahora que ha crecido su hijo ya no lo considera su trabajo pesado ni dificultoso. Esta temporada va a sembrar 30 sacos de semilla de papa, y dos bolsas de alverja, ya tiene preparada su tierra y solo falta abrir los surcos. Marleni al igual que sus demás paisanos quiso comprar la semilla llamada súper mejorada que es muy resistente y da una mejor producción; pero esta semilla está muy escasa y de un costo elevado. Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP, y en todo este tiempo ha pagado sin dificultades sus cuotas fijadas. Con el dinero solicitado comprará semilla de arvejas en un importe 800 soles, el resto del dinero lo utilizara en la compra de insecticidas.
texts.en:
Marleni is 28 years old and has lived with her partner for more than nine years. They have a son together and live in a house they own. She had her son at 19 years old, and since then has been working on the farm with her husband just as her mother and father did. She had to do all her work carrying her baby. Now that he is older, she does not consider her work to be strenuous or difficult. This season, she will sow 30 bags of seed potato and two bags of peas. She has already prepared her land; only the furrows need to be plowed. Marleni, like her fellow farmers, wants to buy the "súper mejorada" brand of seed as it is highly resistant and produces a more abundant crop, but this seed is very small and very expensive. This is her fourth loan with MFP, and she has always repaid her loans on time. She will use the loan to buy 800 soles' worth of pea seeds and the rest of the money to buy insecticide.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds and insecticide.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Pertenece al  Banco Comunal “Juntas hasta el final”, tiene 65 años D. edad, con 4 hijos mayores D. edad, 10 años socia.

El primer préstamo que recibió D. S/. 300  Nuevos Soles puso un lavandero pequeño en el patio D. su casa, y la venta D. bebidas con lo cual ayudaba al ingreso económico en su casa ya que lo que su esposo ganaba no alcanzaba .

Con este préstamo D.  S/. 1,000 Soles compro materiales para arreglar su tanque, ya que por los años se deterioro. 

Esta muy contenta con Manuela Ramos que le entendió la  necesidad que tenia y ahora trabaja tranquilamente, incluso tiene personas que trabajan con ella .
texts.en:
Alejandrina belongs to the Community Bank “together to the end” and is 65 years old with 4 adult children and a partner of 10 years. The first loan she received of 300 Soles she used to put a small washer in the courtyard of her house and to sell drinks which have helped increase her household income as her husband does not earn enough. With this loan of 1000 Soles she will buy materials to fix her gas tank, which has been deteriorating for years. She is very happy with Manuela Ramos who understands her needs and now works peacefully with the people who work with her.

Translated from Spanish by Jeanette Chase, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials to fix the gas tank used for motorcars.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es: Javier acaba de cumplir 30 años, lleva conviviendo con su pareja aproximadamente 12 años, su esposa y sus 3 hijos viven en la casa de su madre, vivienda que cuidan porque su madre vive en otra ciudad. Desde que migraron sus padres a otra ciudad se quedó ha cargo de todas las chacras, pero por falta de capital no puede sembrar como la hacia su padre, en grandes cantidades, pero tiene la ilusión de ir incrementando cada vez más sus cultivos de papa y arvejas.  Cultivar papa en esta temporada es muy bueno, pero como se ha elevado el precio de los fertilizantes ha sembrado solo 10 sacos de semilla, en esta próxima siembra sembrará 20 sacos, paralelo a acaba de sembrar una bolsa y media de arvejas, y ha guardado semilla para su otra chacra que va preparar, porque estos granos guardados mucho tiempo no producen bien. A Javier le agrada su actividad, la cual depende de las fechas en que siembran y cultivan para cosechar buenos frutos y sobre todo para que puedan tener buen precio. Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP, y ha juramentado en el cargo de secretario del banco comunal al que pertenece, comprometiendo a cumplir fielmente con todas las actividades, asimismo a incentivar que los demás socios efectúen los pagos en las fechas exactas. Con el dinero solicitado comprará 2 bolsas de semilla de arvejas y abono para la chacra de papa que tiene sembrada.

loans.use: Compra de semillas y abono

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
Pertenece al Banco Comunal “Juntas hasta el final”, tiene 34 años de edad, con 4 menores hijos, su esposo se dedica a la construcción  de  botes.

Ingreso  a Manuela Ramos en busca de ayuda, su esposo no aportaba con la canasta familiar, tenia  problemas pues no tenia clientes como antes. Recibió su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, continuo con su trabajo de costurera, compro mas telas, confecciono vestidos para niños y creció poco a poco.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1700.00 Nuevos Soles, y compro una  remalladora  para darle mejor acabado a sus prendas , mas telas porque en época de fiestas tiene mas clientes , su negocio crece más, su familia está bien y su esposo ya tiene trabajo.

Esta muy agradecida con la Institución  Manuela Ramos por darle la oportunidad de trabajo hacerle crecer como persona y creer en ella .
texts.en:
Clara belongs to the Community Bank “together to the end” and is 34 years old with 4 young children and a husband who works in boat construction. She came to Manuela Ramos looking for help; her husband doesn’t contribute to the family income because he does not have the clients he had before. She received her first loan of 300 Soles and continued her work as a seamstress, bought more fabric and made clothes for children, growing little by little. With this loan of 1700 Soles she will buy a mending machine to give a better finish to her garments, and more fabric because during the holidays she has more clients and her business grows. Her family is doing well and her husband already has work. She is very happy with the institution of Manuela Ramos because it gives her the opportunity to work and grow as a person because they believe in her.

Translated from Spanish by Jeanette Chase, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a mending machine to give a better finish to her garments and more fabric to make more garments.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es: Florentina tiene 40 años, vive con su pareja cerca de 22 años, tiene 6 hijos, de los cuales 3 de ellos viven con ellos en una casa alquilada mientras puedan construir su casa.  Cuando empezó a convivir con su esposo trabajaban de sol a sol en la chacra; ahora quien más se dedica a la chacra es su esposo, mientras que ella lo apoya de dos a tres veces por semana, el resto de días se dedica a comprar frutas ya cosechadas, las transporta a su casa, las selecciona para luego acomodarlas en javas de 12 kilos. Por su parte su esposo también carga sus propias frutas, de ese modo alquilan un solo carro para trasportarlas al mercado. Florentina trata de tener productos variados por lo que compra plátano, palta y otras. Cuando lleva una carga de 1500 soles de inversión gana 500 soles líquido, y si es que todas las frutas se mantienen sus precios gana mucho más. Este es su 4to préstamo con MFP, durante el segundo crédito tenia el cargo de vocal, donde convocaba a reunión a todos los socios con eficacia. El dinero que ha solicitado es para la compra de una camionada de frutas, para que le sirva de capital para sus próximas ventas.
texts.en:
Florentina is 40 years old, she lives with her partner of nearly 22 years, and she has 6 children, 3 of whom live with her in a rented house while their own home gets built. When she began her partnership with her husband they worked from dawn to dusk on the farm; now her husband is more involved with the farm, and she helps him two to three times a week. The remaining days she buys fruit, transports them to her home, and then selects the fruit to make crates weighing 12 kilos. Her husband also loads his own fruit, so they rent one car to transport everything to the market. Florentina tries to carry a variety of products so she buys bananas, avocados and other fruit. When she invests 1,500 soles she earns 500 soles in profit, and if all fruit prices remain stable she earns more. This is her fourth loan with MFP, during her second loan she served as a vocal member where she called all partners to meetings. The money she has requested is to purchase a truckload of fruit, and it will serve as capital for future sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a truckload of fruit

loans.name: Teopista Nantume Group

texts.en: N. Teopista is a farmer with plantations of bananas, beans, maize, cassava, and potato. She has a stall at her home where she sells cabbage, tomatoes, onions, carrots and spices, some from her plantations and other items that she buys from fellow farmers. She is married with 5 children, all in school, and she pays their school fees single-handedly with the help of loans. She has been able to buy herself a plot and more household items, a thing she had lost hope of achieving. She needs her portion of this group loan to buy more produce for sale.

loans.use: Buying more produce for sale.

loans.name: Sabaly (La Sagesse) Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sabali est un regroupement de 7 femmes du village de  kimparana (préfecture de San région de Ségou) qui se connaissent bien à travers des voisinages. Vivant dans des familles traditionnelles, elles ont en moyenne 27 ans, mariées et mères d’au moins  5  enfants.
L’activité dominante de ses clientes est  la vente de Soumbala qui est un condiment à base de néré très apprécié par les maliens.
 Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a six mois. Le montant du prêt est passé de 50.000 FCFA au premier prêt à 75.000 FCFA pour le deuxième  prêt.
Elles se procurent  de ces marchandises à koury et Koutiala et à kimparana.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter des sacs de noix de néré et du bois de chauffe.
Les membres du groupe Sabali estime avoir 70 000 FCFA par cliente pendant avec ce prêt.
En dehors du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille. 
NB : sur la photo, il manque Nana Dembelé qui a accouché le moment de la prise de la photo.
texts.en:
The group Sabali is composed of seven women of the village of Kimparana (San Prefecture, Ségou region) who are well known throughout these neighborhoods. Living in traditional families, they average 27 years of age, are married, and have at least five children. The dominant work they do involves selling "soumbala", a condiment made of "néré nuts", which is highly valued by Malians.

To expand their business, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program six months ago. The loan amounts have gone from 50,000 francs CFA for the first loan to 75,000 francs for the second. They get their merchandise in Koury and Koutiala and in Kimparana. The current loan will be used to buy sacks of néré nuts and firewood.

Each group member expects to earn 70,000 francs from this loan. Besides repaying the loans, the members will use part of the income to address common family expenses. Note: In the photo, Nana Dembelé is missing because she was in labor when the photo was taken.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy néré nuts and firewood

loans.name: Gilma

texts.es:
Pertenece al Banco Comunal  “Juntas hasta el final”, tiene 32 años, no tiene hijos, es soltera, la mejor forma de poder trabajar era poner un negocio, pero no sabía cómo hacerlo, su vecina le invito a participar en el movimiento Manuela Ramos.

Su primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/. 300 Nuevos Soles, compro gaseosas, Yogur, néctar  y golosinas, comenzó poco a poco a crecer.

Con este préstamo  de S/. 2000  Soles puso en su local una cabina telefónica, compro una vitrina para mostrar sus productos y un refrigerador para poder atraer mas clientes.

Esta muy agradecida de Manuela Ramos por confiar en ella y se siente muy optimista en las cosas que ella quiere lograr.
texts.en:
Pertenece al Banco Comunal “Juntas hasta el final”, tiene 32 años, no tiene hijos, es soltera, la mejor forma de poder trabajar era poner un negocio, pero no sabía cómo hacerlo, su vecina le invito a participar en el movimiento Manuela Ramos. Su primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/. 300 Nuevos Soles, compro gaseosas, Yogur, néctar y golosinas, comenzó poco a poco a crecer. Con este préstamo de S/. 2000 Soles puso en su local una cabina telefónica, compro una vitrina para mostrar sus productos y un refrigerador para poder atraer mas clientes. Esta muy agradecida de Manuela Ramos por confiar en ella y se siente muy optimista en las cosas que ella quiere lograr.

Translated from Spanish by Jeanette Chase, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a display case to show her products and a refrigerator to increase her sales.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es:
La señora Leticia T. R. es casada, tiene un hijo, ellos tienen 29 años de vivir en su hogar. Su esposo trabaja como transfer y la señora Leticia trabaja como secretaria en un consultorio médico en el cual lleva 12 años laborando. 
La señora Leticia está solicitando un préstamo para ampliar la planta baja de su casa con madera, para que de esta manera ella y su familia tengan en un hogar más amplio y en buenas condiciones para vivir cómodamente.
texts.en:
Leticia T. R. is married and has one child. They have lived in their home for 29 years. Her husband works in transportation and Leticia works as a secretary in a medical clinic, where she has worked for 12 years. Leticia is requesting a loan in order to expand the ground floor of her house with wood. In this manner, she and her family will have a larger home in good condition so they may live comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expansion of the wooden ground floor.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.es:
La Sra. Erlinda pertenece al banco Comunal “Juntas Hasta el final”  Tiene 58 años D. edad, es viuda, tiene 18 hijos y 10 años como socia en la Institución.

Su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300 Nuevos Soles compro telas, elásticos e hilos, para la confección  D. prendas D. vestir y estudio  auxiliar en enfermería. Ahora la señora acrecentó su negocio, solo cose pedidos.
 Con este préstamo D. S/. 2000.00 Nuevos Soles. compro mercaderías para su negocio como telas, hilos, elásticos, agujas, y también algunos accesorios  para  su maquina D. coser.

Ella esta muy agradecida con Manuela Ramos porque la apoyo con su negocio y pudo hacer estudiar a sus hijos .
texts.en:
Erlinda belongs to the Juntas Hasta El Final (Together Until the End) Community Bank. She is 58 years old, a widow has 18 children and has been a member of the Institution for 10 years. Her first loan was for 300 Nuevos Soles. She bought fabric, elastic and thread in order to make garments and studied to be a nursing assistant. Now she has increased her business, she sews only orders. With this loan of 2000 Nuevos Soles, she will buy merchandise such as fabric, thread, elastic, needles and also some accessories for her sewing machine. She is very grateful to Manuela Ramos because it supports her business and she has been able to give her children an education.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise such as fabric, thread, elastic, needles and also some accessories for her sewing machine.

loans.name: Jiguiya (L’Espoir) Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Jiguiya de l’association Faso kanu  de  Koutiala(troisième région administrative de la république du Mali) est un   regroupement de cinq femmes qui vivent toutes dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à Dar Salam II. Elles sont toutes mariées et mères d’au moins quatre enfants.
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, elles ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso    
Leur activité principale  est la vente de beignet et de viande, elles  vendent au carrefour le matin de bonne heure (beignet avec la tête de mouton bien cuite) un petit déjeuner très apprécié par les  habitants de la localité.
Le groupe Jiguiya de Faso kanu a connu Soro Yiriwaso  il y a plus d’un an, il  est à son troisième prêt après avoir remboursé correctement les deux premiers.
Le beignet est à base de petit mil ou du riz qu’elles achètent en gros avec les paysans à la foire du village à un prix abordable pour transformer et vendre.
 Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter des sacs de riz de petit mil et des bidons d’huiles.
Le bénéfice estimé avec ce prêt est de 110 000 FCFA par cliente. Ce bénéfice sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt et s’occuper des dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
The group Jiguiya of the association Faso Kanu de Koutiala (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali) is composed of five women who all live in large traditional families in Dar Salam II. They are all married and mothers of at least four children. To expand their work, they have decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program, which they discovered over a year ago. Their principal work involves the sale of beignets (a kind of doughnut) and meat. At the crossroads early in the morning, they sell beignets with well-done sheep’s head, which is a breakfast highly appreciated by the town’s inhabitants.

Beignets are made of millet or rice, which are purchased wholesale from peasants at the village fair at affordable prices. The current loan will be used to buy sacks of rice and millet and drums of cooking oil. The estimated profit is 110,000 francs CFA per member. This profit will be used to pay the loan interest and to take care of family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, millet, and cooking oil

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia Pertenece al Banco Comunal “Juntas hasta el final”, tiene 44 años,  4 hijos menores de edad, su esposo trabaja como vigilante.

Su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles compro arroz, huevos, pollos y hojas para preparar juanes y venderlo en el patio de su casa, ya que a su esposo no le alcanzaba con el sueldo que ganaba. 

Con el préstamo de S/. 1500.00 Nuevos Soles, compro una parrilla  para asar su pollo, pescados, plátanos y una refrigeradora para conservar sus productos, vende comida en el patio de su casa y tiene clientela ya que es muy atenta y alegre con sus clientes.

Agradece enormemente al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por el apoyo brindado hacia su persona y confía en que   sigan ayudándola.
texts.en:
Lidia belongs to the Community Bank "Juntas hasta el final" ["Together till the end"]. She is 44 years old, has 4 young children and her husband works as a guard. With her first loan of 300 soles, she bought rice, eggs, chickens, and leaves to prepare "juanes" [a typical Peruvian dish] to sell on the patio of her home, since her husband doesn't make enough with the salary he earns. With this loan of 1500 soles, she will buy a grill to roast her chicken, fish, and bananas and a refrigerator to preserve her products. She sells food in the patio of her home and has many customers, given that she is very attentive and friendly to her clients. She is extremely grateful for the Movimiento Manuela Ramos and for the support that has been offered to her. She has faith that they will continue to help her.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a grill to roast chicken, fish, and bananas and a refrigerator to preserve her products

loans.name: Doris

texts.es: Doris es madre soltera, vive con sus 3 hijos que ya son independientes y de familia, que sobre todo le brindan apoyo. La casa donde ella habita es propia. Es propietaria de un mocarro y a la vez vende ropa (recientemente) por las diferentes zonas de su región. La moto que tiene cuenta con un año de funcionamiento y brinda servicio de taxi, ganancias con las cuales puede sustentar sus gastos diarios. Este motocarro lo maneja uno de sus hijos, el mismo que se encarga de cuidarlo y mantenerlo. Doris está contenta porque tanto el motocarro como la venta de ropa le generan buenos ingresos, por lo que le va muy bien, y ahora tiene proyectado iniciar un nuevo negocio, que es la venta de abarrotes. Este es su 8vo crédito con MFP, y con el dinero que solicita mandará a reparar su moto para que trabaje al 100 %, así como también construirá un kiosco para poner posteriormente una bodega.
texts.en:
Doris is a single mother. She lives in her own home with her three children, who are grown up and have families but support her above all. She is the owner of a motorcoach and at times recently has sold clothing in the different areas of the region. She has had her motorcoach for a year, providing taxi services so she can afford her daily expenses. One of her children drives the vehicle, and he also cares for and maintains it. Doris is content because just like the motorcoach, her clothing sales have gone well and generate good income, and now she is planning to start a new business selling grocery items. This is her eighth loan through Kiva partner MFP, and she plans to use the money she is requesting to repair her motorcoach so it works 100 percent. She also plans to build a kiosk where she can later install her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair her motorcoach

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes, de 59 años es madre de 6 hijos, en la actualidad todos ya son independientes, ella vive con su pareja en su casa propia. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, pasamanería y bebidas en las instalaciones de su casa, actividad que viene realizando desde hace 3 años y le va muy bien. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dar una muy buena atención a sus clientes y sentirse útil. Además le es muy rentable porque sus ventas le generan ingresos los cuales están logrando incrementar su nivel económico. Este es su 9no crédito con MFP, y con el dinero solicitado quiere mandar a ampliar su local de venta e implementarse con más productos.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a 59-year-old mother of six children, all grown up. She lives with her partner in her own home and makes a living selling groceries, crafts and drinks out of it. She has been doing the job for three years, and it's going very well. What she enjoys about her work is providing good service to her customers and feeling useful. Furthermore, the business is very profitable, generating income that is raising her economic level. This is her ninth loan through Kiva partner MFP, and with the money she is requesting she plans to enlarge her store and implement more products.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Enlarge her store and add more products

loans.name: Sabougnouma (La Bonne Cause) Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sabougnouma est constitué de six femmes toutes mariées et vivant dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, les enfants et autres parents. Vendeuses  de légumes et de fruits, les six  femmes du groupe Sabougnouma de l’association Sabali de kimparana (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali) ont une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans et ont chacune six enfants au moins.
Très expérimentées, elles sont  à leur troisième année de collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso et leur  cinquième prêt. Elles ont commencé à  50 000 FCFA au premier cycle  et sont à 150 000 FCFA actuellement après le remboursement des quatre premiers.
Ce prêt sera utilisé pour acheter les légumes à Sikasso et les fruits sur place  avec les  paysans producteurs de kimparana.
Les marchandises sont vendues en ambulant  ou au carrefour, certaines d’entre elles ont des places fixes au marché de kimparana où elles vendent plus. 
Selon leur estimation, le bénéfice attendu peut être de  150 000 FCFA par cliente avec ce prêt. qui sera  utilisé pour rembourser le  prêt et faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille
Leur ambition est d’avoir des prêts individuels d’un montant élevé pour diversifier leurs marchandises. 
NB : Aminata Koné était malade couchée au moment de la prise de photo.
texts.en:
The group Sabougnouma is composed of six women, all married, who live in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and other parents. As retailers of vegetables and fruit, the women of this group of the association Sabali de Kimparana (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali) average 43 years of age and have at least six children each.

They are highly experience and are on their fifth loan in their third year of collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso. Starting off with 50,000 francs CFA in their first loan cycle, they are now at 150,000 francs after having repaid the first four loans. This loan will be used to buy vegetables in Sikasso and fruit locally from peasant growers of Kimparana. The goods are sold door-to-door or at the crossroads. Some of the women have a fixed spot at the Kimparana marketplace, where they sell more.

According to their estimates, the expected profit with this loan could be 150,000 francs per group member. The profit will be used to repay the loan and to adress common family expenses. They have the ambition to take out larger, individual loans for diversifying their merchandise. Note: Aminata Koné was sick in bed when the photo was taken.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables and fruit

loans.name: Lizbeth

texts.es:
La Sra. Lizbeth Pertenece al banco Comunal  “Juntas hasta el final”, tiene 34 años de edad, 1 hijo menor de edad, su esposo es comerciante.

Con este préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles y compro artículos de zapatería, sandalias, 1 mesita al frente de la casa de su mama en el Mercado de Bellavista .

Con este préstamo de  S/. 1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, lo invirtió en la compra de  mas sandalias zapatos, implemento su local, ilumino y compro rejillas para poner los zapatos.

Lizbeth se siente contenta por todo lo que a logrado en la vida y Agradece a Manuela Ramos por tener confianza en  ella y mantener la cordialidad de trabajar  juntos.
texts.en:
Lizbeth belongs to the Community Bank "Juntas hasta el final" ["Together till the end"]. She is 34 years old, has 1 young child, and her husband is a shopkeeper. With her first loan of 300 soles, she bought shoemaking items, sandals, and 1 small stand in front of her mother's house in the Bellavista market. With this loan of 1,200 soles, she will buy more sandals and shoes, set up her stand, and buy lighting and racks to display the shoes. Lizbeth is happy for everything she has achieved in life. She is thankful for Manuel Ramos for having faith in her and for the opportunity to work together.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more sandals and shoes and to set up her stand and to buy lighting and racks to display the shoes

loans.name: Godfrey Mwesigwa Group

texts.en: M. Godfrey is the leader of his group and a businessman with a retail shop. He is also a farmer with cows that he keeps at his home and these have been helpful in giving him milk for sale and home consumption. He is married with school-going children and the school fees have not been a burden especially now that he has access to loans that boost his business. He is really grateful for the support.

loans.use: To buy inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy vegetables, fruit, and charcoal for resale

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es: Fredy tiene 57 años D. edad, es viuda, vive con dos D. sus cuatro hijos quienes estudian. La casa donD. viven es propia. Se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes y productos D. primera necesidad, esfuerzo que hace por sus dos hijos, a los mismos que los apoya en con el pago D. sus estudios y otros gastos. La señora Fredy es una mujer que lucha duro por salir adelante, empezó con este negocio hace 3 años, con una atención desD. las 6 D. la mañana hasta las 9 D. la noche, y gracias a esta buena atención y sobre todo a la administración D. su bodega, ahora está mejorando la infraestructura D. su vivienda. Además le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que aprenD. muchas cosas cuando conversa con sus clientes, y por encontrarse ubicada en una buena zona, muy transitada no tiene inconvenientes, razón por la cual le va muy bien. Este es su 8vo crédito con MFP, y con el dinero que solicita ampliará e implementará su negocio para dar una mejor atención a sus clientes y variedad D. productos.
texts.en:
Fredy is a 57-year-old widow. She lives in her own home with her four children, who are in school. She makes a living selling groceries and other primary-need products, work that she does so she can support two of her children with their studies and other expenses. Fredy is a women who works hard to make headway. She started her business three years ago, serving her customers from 6 in the morning until 9 at night, and thanks this good service and especially her administration abilities she is now improving the infrastructure of her home. Furthermore, she really enjoys her job since she learns a lot of things while talking to customers. Because it's located in a good, well-passed area, she does not have any drawbacks, which is why it's going so well. This is her eighth loan with Kiva partner MFP, and with the money she is requesting she plans to enlarge and expand her store to improve her customer service and add a wider variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Enlarge her store and add more products

loans.name: Lucila Elsa

texts.es:
Pertenece al Banco Comunal  “cesar Vallejo”  del pueblo joven  09 de octubre de la ciudad de Pucallpa, con 33 años de edad natural de Pucallpa, tiene 2 hijos, su esposo trabaja en el conducto camisea, tiene 8 años como socia.

Cuando su esposo no tenía trabajo vendía comida apoyando a su madre, se unió al grupo de Manuela  Ramos. Con su primer préstamo de S/. 300 soles se independizo y fue creciendo poco a poco junto todo su dinero y compro un motokar que fue robado a los días de comprado, pero ella  persistió trabajando.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000 soles, con el cual compro un motokar que lo alquila y ella sigue vendiendo comida en la  noches. 

Esta contentísima por el apoyo  que le brinda Manuela Ramos  en los momentos que mas lo necesita..
texts.en:
Lucila belongs to the Community Bank "Cesar Vallejo" in the young district "09 de octubre" in the city of Pucallpa. She is 33 years old, has 2 children, and her husband works on the Camisea pipeline. She has been a member of the community bank for 8 years. When her husband did not have a job, she would sell food, supporting her mother. She joined the Manuela Ramos group. With her first loan of 300 soles she became independent and grew her savings little by little and bought a small car which was stolen a few days after buying it; however, she continued working. With this loan of 2,000 soles Lucila will buy a small car which she will rent. She will also continue selling food at night. She is very happy for the support that Manuela Ramos offers in the moments that it is most necessary.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a small car to rent

loans.name: Palmi

texts.es: Palmi tiene 52 años,  es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos que ya son independientes y viven lejos D. ella. En la actualidad vive sola en su casa que es propia y a pesar que está sola es muy emprendedora y vela por su futuro. Se dedica a la venta D. bebidas (gaseosas, cervezas y otros) tiene su pequeño bar al costado D. su vivienda, en donD. con su gran amabilidad y buena atención cuenta con una gran clientela que consumen sus bebidas heladas. Palmi inició este negocio por encontrarse en una buena zona y lo vienen haciendo ya desD. hace 4 años. Ella atienD. a cualquier hora del día, le gusta mucho su trabajo porque muy a parte D. generarle ingresos aprenD. a administrar cada vez mejor sus ganancias y sobre cómo debe ser el trato con sus clientes, ya que por parte D. una empresa cervecera recibe capacitaciones constantes. Este es su 6to crédito con MFP, y con la cantidad solicitada comprará más productos (cervezas y gaseosas) y también hará algunas reparaciones a su local para dar una mejor acogida a todo aquel que ingresa y consume sus bebidas.
texts.en:
Palmi is 52 years old, a single mother of three whose children are all now independent and live on their own. She is living alone in her home, which she owns, and because she is alone she is very enterprising and ensures her future. She sell refreshments such as soft drinks, beer, and so on. Her small bar is set at the siD. of her house, where she has many customers who drink her cold refreshments because of kindness and good service. Palmi opened her business four years ago because she was in a good location. She is open at all hours and very much enjoys her work because not only does she make money, but every day she learns to better manage her profits and above all how to treat her customers as she receives regular training from a beer company. This is her sixth loan with MFP. She will use the loan to buy more goods (beer and soft drinks) and make some improvements to her bar to give a better impression to the people who come in and drink her refreshments.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more refreshments.

loans.name: Amina Nalubega Group

texts.en: N. Amina sells used clothes from Mityana by moving around to the daily markets in and around Mityana, Mubende, and all the surrounding areas. She is a married woman with 5 children and more 2 children in her care. She sells mostly ladies skirts and blouses, nets, and children’s wear. She has used previous loans to increase her clothing inventory. As a result, Amina has been able to buy herself a plot of land and a sewing machine that she uses for part- time tailoring. She also owns a cow that gives her milk for sale. She needs her portion of the group loan to purchase clothing inventory.

loans.use: To increase inventory.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.es: La señora Lilia tiene 42 años D. edad, vive con su esposo y uno D. sus tres hijos quien está aún en edad escolar. La casa donD. habitan es propia. Se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes y productos D. primera necesidad desD. ya hace 5 años atrás en su casa, este negocio es el que vela por el sustento económico D. ella y su familia, a quienes les brinda lo necesario para salir adelante. Lilia ama su trabajo, ya que gracias al mismo y su carisma al atender cuenta con una gran clientela lo que le genera muy buenas ganancias. Este es su 8vo préstamo con MFP, y con el dinero solicitado comprará más productos comestibles y también espera mejora algunas estructuras D. su vivienda.
texts.en:
Lilia is 42 years old and lives with in her own home with her husband and the youngest of their three children, who is still in school. She has maD. a living for the past five years selling groceries and primary-need products out of the back of her home. This business provides the economic support for her and her family, giving them the means to make headway. Lilia loves her job, and thanks to her hard work and her charisma she has a large clientele and generates very good earnings. This is her eighth loan with Kiva partner MFP, and with the money she is requesting she plans to purchase more food products and make structural improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more products for her store

loans.name: Rosa Maritza

texts.es:
Pertenece al Banco Comunal “Juntas hasta el final”, tiene 36 años de edad con 4 hijos, su esposo es mecánico, tiene 6 años de socia en la Institución. 

Recibió su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles con los cuales compro artículos de primera necesidad,  perfumes ,talcos , cosméticos para venderlos entre sus amistades.

La señora con el préstamo de S/. 3000.00 amplio su casa y también invirtió en mas cosméticos, perfumes, talcos, champú, etc.  para su venta.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos por su consideración y hacerla sentir una mujer que puede realizar una  empresa , se siente útil, porque antes era solo ama de casa, ahora puede realizar lo que ella desea y ayudar con la economía de su casa.
texts.en:
Rosa has been a member of the communal bank "Juntas hasta el final "(Together to the end) for six years. She is a 36-year-old mother of four and her husband is a mechanic. With the first 300 soles loan she received she bought basic necessities such as perfumes, talcums and cosmetics to sell amongst her friends. With the 3000 soles loan she expanded her home and also invested in more cosmetics, perfumes, talcums, and shampoos, etc. for selling. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for working with her and making her feel like a businesswoman. She feels useful, because prior to this she was just a homemaker and now she can make her dreams come true and support her household economically.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invested in more cosmetics, perfumes, talcums, and shampoos, etc. for selling.

loans.name: Siguidia ( Bonne Cohabitation) Group

texts.fr:
le groupe Siguidia de l’association  Sabali de Kimparana est composé de  6 femmes, l’âge moyen des membres   est de 40 ans. Elles sont toutes mariées et ont au moins chacune 8 enfants. Dans ce groupe, l’activité dominante est la vente  de légumes,  de fruits et d’arachide.
Ce groupe est à son troisième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe) avec l’institution. Les  deux premiers ont été correctement remboursés.
Elles achèteront avec ce nouveau prêt, des fruits et légumes puis de l’arachide. Le groupe se procure  de ces marchandises au marché de  Sikasso (la troisième région administrative du mali) et comme lieu de vente les marchés de Koury, de San et de Kimparana.
Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice de 70 000f avec ce prêt,  en plus du  remboursement, elles utiliseront le reste de l’argent pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The group Siguidia of the association Sabali de Kimparana is composed of six women averaging 40 years of age. They are all married and have at least eight children each. In this group the dominant work involves selling vegetables, fruit, and peanuts.

The group members are on their third solidarity loan (group loan) with the institution. The first two loans were correctly repaid. They will use this new loan to buy fruit and vegetables and then peanuts. The group gets its merchandise at the Sikasso marketplace (third administrative region of Mali). And sales are made at the marketplaces of Koury, San, and Kimparana.

They hope to realize a profit of 70,000 francs with this loan. In addition to repaying the loan, they will use the rest of the money for addressing typical family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit, vegetables, and peanuts

loans.name: Yubbys

texts.es: Yubbys tiene 38 años de edad, es soltera, vive con sus padres y hermanos en casa de sus padres, la que es propia. Ella es una mujer emprendedora y dedicada a la venta de especerías (ajos licuado, culantro licuado, ají mirasol, entre otros) y condimentos en general, vende en un puesto del mercado de su localidad, su dedicación a este trabajo lo viene haciendo desde hace 12 años, debido a su linda sonrisa y amabilidad al atender cuenta con una fiel clientela, y lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que sus clientas siempre se muestran satisfechas por su buena atención. Este es su 8vo préstamo con MFP, y el dinero solicitado será para la compra de mayor cantidad de los productos que vende.
texts.en:
Yubbys is 38 years old, single, and lives with her parents and siblings in her parents' home. She is a very hard-working woman who works selling spices (liquefied garlic and cilantro, chili peppers, etc.) and condiments. She has sold them from a stand in her local market for the past 12 years. Due to her beautiful smile and friendliness in tending to customers, she has gained a loyal clientele. She enjoys seeing her customers happy and satisfied thanks to the service she offers them. This is her 8th loan from Prisma Microfinance and she will use the money to buy a greater quantity of products to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the amount of products she offers

loans.name: Ma. Ventura

texts.es:
La señora Ma. Ventura S. Romero está separada de su esposo, ella vive con sus 4 hijos, ellos tienen viviendo 4 años en su hogar, uno de sus hijos trabaja como promotor en una compañía de refrescos y apoya a su mamá con los gastos de la casa, mientras que la señora Ma. Ventura tiene un negocio propio de venta de artículos usados, el cual lleva en operación 2 años.
La señora Ma. Ventura está solicitando un préstamo para comprar mercancías y estructuras metálicas para colocar su mercancía, para que de esta manera su negocio este más surtido y les pueda ofrecer a sus clientes más variedad de productos y así pueda obtener ingresos los cuales serán necesarios para poder mantener a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria Ventura S. Romero is separated from her husband and lives with her four kids. They have lived in their home for four years, and one of her sons works as a promoter for a refreshment company and supports his mom with the household costs, while Maria Ventura has her own business selling used articles. She has been doing this for two years.

Maria Ventura would lile a loan to buy merchandise and metallic frames to hang her merchandise on so that this way her business will be better stocked and she will be able to offer her clients a larger variety of products. In this way she will get more income and this will be necessary to support her kids.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise and metallic frames/Comprar mercancia y estructruras metalicas

loans.name: Simon's Group

texts.en:
Simon S. is a farmer with fields of bananas, beans, maize, cassava and potatos. He is even in a position to sell from his home where he has a stall selling cabbage, tomatoes, onions, carrots and spices, some from his lands while others he buys from fellow farmers especially those items that he does not grow.

This stall is mostly managed by his wife while he does most of the manual work with the help of hired manpower. He is our client. He is married with 5 children, all in school and he cares for 3 orphans thanks to loans that help to bring in an extra income. He has been able to buy a plot of land plus buying more household items for his family and now they are happy together. He needs a loan to buy more produce for sale.

loans.use: Buying more produce for sale

loans.name: Rosa Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Pertenece al Banco Comunal  “Juntas hasta el final” que se encuentra ubicado en el Jr. Iquitos 572 del distrito de Calleria departamento de Ucayali ,  tiene 75 años con 8 hijos, ya todos mayores de edad, es  viuda, con 8 años de socia en Manuela Ramos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, se puso a vender Juanes y tacachos, en el patio de su casa y también  incremento su  bodega.

Ahora con el ultimo préstamo de s/. 1700.00 Nuevos Soles compro gaseosas, cervezas, golosinas, 2 sacos de arroz, 2 de azúcar, 3 paquetes de aceite, 5 cajas de gaseosa.

Agradece enormemente a Dios y a Manuela Ramos por confiar en ella, y que todavía tiene fuerzas por seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Rosa , a 75-year-old widow who has eight grown children, has been a member of the Community Bank named “Together To The End” for eight years. With an earlier loan of approximately $100 USD, she enlarged her small shop and began selling “tachachos” and “juanes” (delicious regional dishes) on her home patio. With this current loan of approximately $550 USD, Rosa will buy soft drinks, beer, sweets, two sacks of rice, two sacks of sugar, three jugs of oil and five flats of soda. Rosa is extremely grateful to God and to the Manuela Ramos organization for having the confidence in her to have the strength to keep working.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Molloy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beer, sweets, two sacks of rice, two sacks of sugar, three jugs of oil and five flats of soda.

loans.name: Milena

texts.es: Milena tiene 34 años de edad, vive con su pareja y su hijo, la casa donde vive es de su abuela. En la actualidad, se dedica a la venta de bebidas gaseosas al por menor desde hace 3 años, en un pequeño local construido dentro de su casa, negocio que le permite vivir tranquilamente, pero ella quiere ver en el futuro su negocio más grande, es por eso que trabaja muy duro. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es dar una buena atención a sus clientes y sobre todo conocer a muchas personas. Este negocio le es muy rentable porque cuenta con una clientela fija que degustan constantemente de sus bebidas heladas por el intenso calor de la zona, por ello tiene ingresos diarios y le va bien. Este es su 7mo préstamo con MFP, y con la cantidad que solicita comprará más bebidas gaseosas de diferentes variedades.
texts.en:
Milena is 34 years old and lives with her husband and their son in her grandmother's home. For the past 3 years she has worked selling soft drinks retail in a small shop they built inside their home. Her business helps her to live a more comfortable life but in the future, she would like to grow her business substantially--this desire motivates her to work hard. She enjoys offering good customer service and getting to know many people. Her business is very profitable since she has a very loyal customer base who constantly purchase her cold soft drinks since the region where they live is so hot. Due to her business, she is able to earn a daily income. This is her 7th loan from Prisma Microfinance and she will use the money to buy more soft drinks of various flavors.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the amount of products she offers

loans.name: María

texts.es: María tiene 48 años de edad, vive con 3 de sus cuatro hijos y su esposo, quienes le apoyan en todo, sobre todo en sus propósitos para su negocio. Desde muy joven sus aspiraciones han estado en el arte textil, es por eso que María es una excelente costurera, cuenta con máquinas de coser, que le son de mucha utilidad para la realización de su trabajo diario que es la confección de ropa para todos los gustos, implementado su pequeño taller en su casa, donde también vende sus prendas, las que deja al contado o al crédito. María es muy solicitada por su buen trabajo, incluso trabaja con varias instituciones educativas para la confección de los uniformes para los docentes y para los estudiantes. Esta actividad de la costura la viene realizando desde hace 20 años. Este es su 7mo préstamo con MFP, y con el dinero que solicita mandará a construir un local adecuado para su taller textil y donde podrá también exhibir sus prendas.
texts.en:
Maria is 48 years old and lives with 3 of her 4 children and her husband who support her in all she does, especially in her business. Since she was very young, she aspired to work in textile arts, which is why Maria is an excellent seamstress. She has sewing machines which help her immensely in her daily work which consists of making all types of clothing. She works out of a small shop in her home where she manufactures and sells her goods, which she sell on account or on credit. She is sought after for her high quality work, including being sought out by educational institutions to make uniforms for both teachers and students. She has worked in this business for 20 years. This is her 7th loan from Prisma Microfinance and she will use the money to build a more suitable shop for her textile business where she will also be able to exhibit her goods.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buildling a store for her workshop

loans.name: Zully

texts.es:
Pertenece al Banco Comunal  “Juntas hasta el final”, que se ubica en AV: bellavista 1247 del distrito de Calleria, tiene 26 años, 1 hijo, su esposo es chofer, como socia lleva 2 años en Manuela Ramos.

Con su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, compro algunos sacos de arroz y empezó a venderlo en el mercado, su esposo no tenía trabajo y estaba enfermo, al ver el progreso y esfuerzo  de su esposa el puso de su parte restablecer su  salud, y ahora la apoya con su negocio.

Con este préstamo que recibió fue de S/. 1500.00, compro una tonelada de arroz, y reparte en todos los mercados, su cobranza es al contado y diario.

Esta muy contenta , feliz porque su hogar está muy unido y su negocio crece cada día mas.
texts.en:
Zully is 26 years old and is married to a man who works as a driver. She has been a member of the Community Bank called “Together To The End” for two years. With her first loan of approximately $100 USD, Zully purchased several sacks of rice and began selling it in the market. At the time, her husband was ill and could not work. When he saw the effort Zully made in supporting them, he was better able to focus his efforts in getting well and now he also supports them as well through his business. With this current loan of approximately $475 USD, Zully will purchase a full ton of rice, which she will then sell in all the local markets. She keeps track of her earnings and sales on a daily basis. Zully is very happy these days because she and husband are working together towards their goals and her business grows every day.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Molloy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a full ton of rice to sell in all the local markets

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia tiene 46 años, es madre soltera, vive con sus tres hijos que son solteros y la apoyan mucho. La casa donde vive es propia. Se dedica a la venta de zapatos, zapatillas y sandalias para hombres y mujeres de todos los diversos modelos posibles, los cuales lleva a vender por los diferentes lugares de su zona, dejando sus prendas a sus clientes al crédito o al contado. Esta labor la viene haciendo desde hace 20 años, le gusta su trabajo porque conoce muchos lugares y a muchas personas. Esta actividad le es rentable porque ya cuenta con sus clientes que le hacen constantes pedidos. Este es su crédito número 11 con MFP, y con el dinero solicitado comprará más zapatos y posteriormente alquilará un local para su tienda.
texts.en:
Sonia is 46 years old, she is a single mother and lives with three sons. They are single and help her out a lot. They own the house they currently live in. She makes her living selling shoes and sandals for women and men. They are sold all around the area for which they live in. She has been doing this for 20 years and she loves her job because she loves to meet people and visit new places. This business is profitable because she already has her customers which ask her constantly for orders. Her credit score is 11 with MFP, with the money you give her she will buy more shoes and then she will rent a space for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Dorian of San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase her inventory and sales

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Marco Antonio V. D. es casado, tiene 2 hijos, el y su familia tienen 2 años de vivir en su hogar, su esposa trabaja como empleada domestica es una casa habitación, mientras que el señor Marco Antonio trabaja como cajero, en el cual ya tiene 10 años de antigüedad. 
El señor Marco Antonio está solicitando un préstamo para construir un cuarto en la planta baja de su casa, el cuarto se construirá según el material mas económico ya sea madera o concreto. (En la fotografía no aparece el señor Marco Antonio, sino aparecen su esposa y sus 2 hijos).
Esta construcción ayudará a que el señor Marco Antonio y su familia tengan un hogar más amplio para vivir.
texts.en:
Marco Antonio V. D. is married and has two children. His wife, who appears in this photograph with their two children, works as a maid in another house. Marco Antonio has worked for 10 years as a cashier. He and his family have lived in their home for two years. Marco Antonio is requesting this loan so that that he can add a room on the ground floor of his house. The room will be constructed using the most economical materials, either wood or concrete. It will be a great benefit to the family to have extra room in their small home to accommodate their children.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Molloy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a room on the ground floor of his home.

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es: Wilmer tiene 36 años de edad, es padre de 2 hijos, vive con su pareja quien lo apoya mucho en su negocio y felizmente cuentan con una casa propia. Desde hace 14, diariamente se viene dedicando al transporte de pasajeros, para él lo más importante es trabajar duro, ya que de antemano quiere brindarle todo lo necesario a sus hijos que están estudiando y son su razón de ser, es propietario de un motocarro con el que trabaja. A Wilmer le gusta su trabajo porque conoce muchos lugares y trata con varias personas, además le es muy rentable. Este es su 8vo préstamo con MFP, y con el dinero que solicita mandará a reparar su motocarro que tiene algunos desperfectos.
texts.en:
Wilmer is 36 years old, is the father of 2 children, lives with his partner who supports him in his business and they are the happy owners of a home. For the last 14 years he has worked on passenger transport. The most important thing for him is to work hard because he wants to provide everything necessary for his children in school, and they are his reason for being. He is the owner of a motorcycle which he operates. Wilmer likes his job because he knows many places and he deals with a variety of people, and the business is very profitable.
