This is his eighth loan with MFP, with the loan request he will repair his motorcycle which has some damages.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Motorcycle Repair

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Mercedes es socia del banco comunal “Las Fronterizas” en el distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; de  31 años de edad, tiene dos hijos y posee estudios de secundaria incompleta (segundo de secundaria).
Trabaja hace tres años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos e inicio su negocio de preparación de jugos con 300 soles y se siente contenta porque le permitió ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
Con el préstamo de S/.3000 nuevos soles desea ampliar su negocio, en cuanto a la compra de nuevos equipos y accesorios; así como insumos necesarios para poder ampliar su negocio; de esta manera contribuirá a mejorar la calidad educativa de sus hijos; asimismo se compromete a pagar puntualmente las respectivas cuotas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mercedes is a partner of the community bank “Las Fronterizas”, located in the Desaguadero district, province of Chucuito, department of Puno. She is 31 years old, mother of two sons and she did not graduate from high school -- she dropped out on the 11th grade. For the last three years, she has been involved with the Manuela Ramos Movement and started a juice selling business with only 300 soles. She is very glad with the results because it has enable her to help cover living expenses. With this 3000 new soles loan she will expand her business -- due to the purchase new equipment and accessories, as well as the material needed for such expansion. This will help her provide a better education for her children. She is committed to making the payments punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expasion by purchasing new equipment, accessories and materials.

loans.name: Mirza

texts.es: Mirza vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijas que ya son mayores de edad, trabajan y la apoyan mucho. La casa donde viven es propia. Tiene una pequeña peluquería dentro de su domicilio, donde hace cortes de cabello para damas y caballeros. Este  servicio lo viene brindando desde hace 10 años atrás y trabaja durante todo el día. Lo que le gusta de esta labor es que se relaciona con muchas personas con quienes también tiene muy amenas conversaciones. Este negocio le es muy rentable porque se encuentra ubicada en una buena zona y lo bueno es que sus hijas la ayudan trayendo clientes y recomendando su buen trabajo. Este es su 7mo préstamo con MFP, y con el dinero que ahora solicita mandará a construir un local al costado de su casa, para tener ahí su peluquería, también comprará instrumentos para su labor.
texts.en:
Mirza lives with her husband and two daughters. Both of her daughters are older and both work and help support the family. Mirza has a small hair salon inside of her home, where she provides hair cuts for women and men. She has had this business for 10 years and works every day. What she likes about this business is that she works with people and has good conversations with her customers. Her small salon does well because she is located in a very busy zone. Her daughters also bring clients to her and recommend her good work. This is her 7th loan with MFP and with the money she is requesting, she would like to construct an area outside her house for her salon, as well as buy materials needed for her business.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a new location for her small hair salon, and purchase materials needed to run her business

loans.name: Nalda Estrella

texts.es:
La Señora Nalda es socia del banco comunal “Las Fronterizas” en el distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 37 años de edad y es de la ciudad de Huacho, madre de dos hijos estudio hasta el 4to nivel universitario.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace dos años, e inicio su préstamo con 300 soles, que le sirvió de capital en su negocio de elaboración de jugos.
Debido a la necesidad de ampliar su negocio por la demanda conseguida, ahora desea prestarse la suma de 2300 soles para adquirir mas insumos variados y contar con un local para brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes;    ello le permitirá incrementar sus utilidades y ayudar al bienestar de sus hijos, por lo  mismo agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por la confianza  y su apoyo a las mujeres.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nalda is a partner from the community bank “Las Fronterizas”, located in the district of Desaguadero of the Chucuito province in the Puno Department. Originally from the city of Huacho, she is 37 years old and mother of two sons. She attended college until the 4th level. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the past two years and she has launched her juice business with a loan in the amount of 300 soles. Thanks to increasing demands, she now wishes to obtain a loan in the amount of 2300 soles that will be used to purchase additional assorted producer goods and a better suited place of business to improve customer service. This will allow her to optimize her business potential and benefit her children's upbringing. She is very appreciative of the trust and support given to women that belong to the Manuela Ramos Movement.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase additional assorted producer goods and a better suited place of business to improve customer service.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Madame A. Afi est une femme qui achète des tissues et des pagnes et les revend à Tokoin, un quartier de Lomé, la capitale de Togo.  Elle sollicite ce prêt pour acheter les tissues et les pagnes afin de mieux servir ses clients.  Elle est mariée avec 3 personne à charge qui elle soutient avec cette activité.
texts.en:
Ms. Afi A. is a woman who buys fabrics and "pagnes" (colorful West African cloth) and resells them in Tokoin, a district of Lomé, the capital of Togo. She is requesting this loan to buy fabrics and pagnes in order to serve her customers better. She is married and has three people to support with her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics and pagnes

loans.name: María

texts.es: La señora María tiene 42 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos que la ayudan en lo posible. La casa que habitan es propia. Se dedica a la venta de diversos artículos de plástico como tapers, buyones, sillas, entre otras variedades, los que vende en un puesto del mercado desde hace 3 años. María le pone mucho empeño a su trabajo por brindarle lo justo y necesario a sus hijos, los mismos que desde ya se sienten agradecidos con ella. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es el trato directo que tiene con sus clientes con quienes comparte muchas ideas, además le es muy rentable porque no sólo tiene su puesto en el mercado, sino que también su esposo se encarga de vender los mismos artículos pero por los caseríos de su zona. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y con dinero que solicita se implementará con más productos de plástico y también ampliará su pequeño local de venta.
texts.en:
Maria is 42 years old and lives with her husband in a house they own. They have three children who help their parents as much as possible. Maria has been selling plastic goods from a stand in the market for 3 years. She works hard at her business to provide for her children, and they appreciate her efforts. What she likes about her work is that she interfaces directly with her customers, sharing ideas and conversation. Her business does well because she not only sells from her stand in the market, but her husband is in charge of selling their plastic goods around the city as well. This is the first loan with MFP, and with the money requested they will invest in more plastic goods to sell as well as expand their small stand in the market.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more plastic goods to sell, and expand her small stand in the market

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr: Monsieur D. Kokou est un homme marié qui habite dans le quartier de Lomé qui s’appelle Adidogome.  Il a 6 personnes à charge qu’il soutient avec son activité de couture.  Il a commencé cette activité depuis 2002.  Il sollicite ce crédit pour acheter une machine à coudre et une machine à surfilage pour mieux faire les habits et servir les clients.  Avec ces machines, il va mieux vendre et gagner de l’argent pour soutenir sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Kokou D. is a married man who lives in the district of Lomé called Adidogome. He has six people to support with his tailoring business. He started doing this work in 2002. He is requesting this loan to buy a new sewing machine and an overcasting machine to improve on the clothing he makes and to serve his customers. With these machines, he is going to do better in his sales and to earn some money to support his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and an overcasting machine

loans.name: Akai Olivia

texts.fr: Madame D. Akai Olivia a pour l’activité la coiffure, et elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter un séchoir pour rentabiliser son travail et des mèches pour vendre aux clients.  Elle a commencé cette activité depuis 2004, et jusqu'à aujourd’hui l’activité marche bien.   Madame D. est célibataire et elle habite dans Adidogome, un quartier de Lomé, la capitale de Togo.
texts.en:
Ms. Akai Olivia D. is a hairdresser. She is requesting this loan to buy a hair dryer to make her work profitable and also some hair extensions to sell to customers. She started doing this work in 2004, and today, her business is doing well. Ms. D. is unmarried and lives in Adidogome, a district of Lomé, the capital of Togo.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a hair dryer and hair extensions

loans.name: Nolberta

texts.es:
La señora Nolberta es Socia del banco comunal “Las Fronterizas” en el distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; de 54 años de edad, madre de 4 hijos y con estudios de secundaria completa.
Trabaja desde hace 8 años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos y se presto 300 soles, monto que le sirvió para adquirir más mercadería en su tienda de abarrotes.
Con este prestamo de S/.1200 soles quiere adquirir una variedad de productos (mercadería) según la demanda creciente de sus clientes, ello le permitirá tener mejores ingresos; y ayudará con los ingresos en su economía familiar.
texts.en:
Nolberta is a partner in the Las Fronterizas community bank in the Desaguadero district of the Chucuito province, in the Puno department. She is 54 years old, and she has a high school education and 4 children. For the last 8 years she has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement, beginning with a 300 sol loan which she used to purchase merchandise for her grocery store. With this 1200 sol loan she plans on purchasing a variety of merchandise in high demand by her customers. This will allow her to increase her income, which will help her family economically.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase additional stock for convenience store

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es:
La señora Basilia, pertenece al banco comunal “Las Fronterizas” distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; de 39 años de edad, de estado civil casada, con 5 hijos, y estudios de primaria completa. 
Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 8 años, su negocio es la panadería (elaboración y comercialización de panes) y frutas, para lo cual inicio con un préstamo de 300 soles. 
A fin de generar mayores ingresos, ella requiere un préstamo de 2000 soles, con lo cual adquirirá insumos y materia prima (harina, manteca, levadura, sal, leña, etc) para mejorar la elaboración de panes en volumen y calidad; de esta manera obtener mejores ganancias y ampliar su mercado; los ingresos generados servirán para ayudar a los estudios de sus hijos, ampliar su negocio y para pagar inicialmente y puntualmente sus respectivas cuotas.
texts.en:
Basilia belongs to the Las Fronterizas community bank on the Desaguadero district of the Chucuito province, in the department of Puno. She is a married woman who is 39 years old with 5 children and a high school education. She has been working with Manuela Ramos for the last 8 years, and runs a commercial baking and fruit business which she started with an initial loan of 300 soles. In order to increase sales, Basilia is requesting a 2000 sol loan which she will use to purchase supplies and basic ingredients (flour, lard, yeast, salt, firewood, etc) to improve the volume and quality of the bread she bakes. This will allow her to increase her income and broaden her market. The additional income will allow her to assist with the schooling of her children, expand her business, and to pay her bills early and on time.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies and basic ingredients, (Flour, lard, salt, yeast, firewood)

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
La señora Paula pertenece al banco comunal “Las Fronterizas”,  del distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, de 36 años de edad, con tres hijos, con estudios de secundaria incompleta (tercer grado de secundaria). 
Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 8 años de los cuales e inicio su negocio de venta de golosinas con 300 soles como capital inicial.
En la actualidad su negocio viene superando la demanda proyectada, por ello requiere un capital adicional de 1500 soles para aumentar su mercadería (golosinas, gaseosas, galletas, enlatados frescos, etc), con la mira de convertirse en distribuidora al por mayor y con ello obtener mejores ingresos para ayudar a su familia, asimismo ella se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas y esta de acuerdo con los acuerdos tomados por su grupo.
texts.en:
Ms. Paula belongs to the community bank "Las Fronterizas", from the Desaguadero district. She is 36 years old and has 3 kids, and never finished high school. She has been working with Manuela Ramos for the last 8 years when she started her candy shop business with 300 soles as initial capital. Currently her business is going very well and demand for her products have exceeded her projections, therefore she needs additional capital for 1500 soles to increase her merchandise (candy, sodas, cookies, fresh cans, etc) she is looking to turn into a large distributor so she can get better income for her family. She will pay her quotes on time and agrees with the contracts accepted by her group.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise (candy, sodas, cookies, fresh cans, etc.) to improve her business

loans.name: Miguel Guillermo

texts.es:
El señor Miguel Guillermo T. R. vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos, ellos tienen 16 años de vivir en si hogar. El señor Miguel Guillermo labora en una agencia aduanal en el puesto de despachador, el ya tiene un poco mas de 8 años trabajando ahí y percibe muy buenos ingresos los cuales son necesarios para mantener a su familia.
El señor Miguel Guillermo está solicitando un préstamo para impermeabilizar un cuarto y terminar un baño. 
Estas mejoras a su vivienda permitirán que el señor Miguel Guillermo y su familia puedan vivir más cómodamente.
texts.en:
Mr. Miguel Gullermo T. R. lives with her wife and two sons, they have been living for the past 16 years in their old house. Mr. Miguel works at a customs agency as a dispatcher for the past 8 years and his salary helps him support his family. Mr. Miguel is requesting the loan in order to waterproof a bedroom and finish a bathroom. These improvements will allow him and his family to live more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To waterproof a bedroom and finish a bathroom

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian K. sells soft drinks at Liverpool Street in Elmina. Vivian has received junior high education. She is married and has 6 dependents. Her husband works with a printing press.

Vivian has been selling soft drinks since 1998. She is responsible for helping her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family. Her loan will be used as additional capital to enable her to increase the sale of soft drinks to meet the increase in demand by her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to invest in her children's education.

loans.use: additional capital to increase the sale of soft drinks

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther A. is married. She has received schooling through senior high. Esther sells groceries such as biscuits, canned products, and others at a place popularly known as the Dutch Cemetery in Elmina, which she has done since 1995. Her husband is a policeman.

Esther uses her income to help her husband pay rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family. Esther will use the loan to purchase more groceries to meet the increase in demand by her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esther plans to add to her husband's savings to acquire a piece of land to build their family house.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to meet the increase in demand

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence T. sells basins and fabric at Mpoben in Elmina. Florence has received senior high education.  She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a land evaluator. Florence has been selling basins and fabric since 2006. She is responsible for helping her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family. Her loan will be used as additional capital to enable her to increase the sale of basins and fabric to meet the increase in demand by her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest into the business to improve her capital base.

loans.use: additional capital to enable her to increase sales

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame F. is divorced and has 5 dependents. She has received schooling through junior high. Maame sells clothing at Mpoben in Elmina, which she has done since 1996. Maame uses her income for paying rent, utility bills and other financial expenses.

Maame will use the loan as additional capital to enable her to increase the sale of clothing and fabric to meet the increase in demand by her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Maame plans to reinvest back into the business to increase her profit margin so as to meet the financial needs of her large family.

loans.use: additional capital to enable her to increase sales

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es:
Candida Rosa C. Vílchez tiene 67 años de edad, su estado civil es casada, doña Candida tiene 2 hijos sus edades son las siguientes su hijo mayor de 20 años de edad cursa el 5 año de secundaria y su hijo menor de 15 años cursa el 4 año de secundaria, su compañero de vida labora guarda de seguridad, sus propósitos son de proporcionarle mejoras a su negocio ya que con la medida del tiempo es que ha cambiado ciertas cosas como por ejemplo la cocina es industrial ya que esto contribuye al medio ambiente sus deseos son tener mas recursos económicos para surtir la materia ya que el mantener este tipo de negocio ya que ha sido el trabajo de toda su vida y no quiere perderlo ya que este medio de vida le proporciona los ingresos necesarios para mantenerse a ella y su familia sus sueños son que sus tortillas sigan obteniendo la misma calidad y tener una variedad de clientes ya que ellos son los encargados de difundir la fama de la excelente calidad de sus tortillas y dentro de sus sueños esta el poder visitar algún país ya que solo los conoce por medio de fotos.

La actividad económica de Doña Candida es la venta y elaboración de tortillas, la ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 40 años, Doña Candida inicio este negocio por cuenta propia ya que su Mama le había enseñado este oficio por lo que decide establecer su propio negocio en su casa de habitación  ya que tenia que satisfacer las necesidades de sus hijos y así da comienzo a su venta Doña Candida ofrecía sus tortillas de manera mas favorable para el cliente y así obtiene su fama con los vecinos y sus clientes pero además de vender las tortillas en su casa de habitación decide ofrecerlas por algunas calles y así obtendría mas ingresos para ella y su familia ya que el precio era un poco mas alto por lo que ahora necesita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será para capital de trabajo ya que necesita aprovechar que el precio del maíz se encuentra bajo y así podrá mantener la materia prima necesaria para la elaboración de sus tortillas.
texts.en:
Candida Rosa C. V. is 67 years old, married, and has 2 children. Her 20 year old son is in his 5th year of secondary education and her youngest son is 15 years old and is in his 4th year of high school. Her husband is a security guard. Candida's goals are to better supply her business since certain changes have occurred over time, for example she now has an industrial kitchen which contributes to the atmosphere of her business. Her desires are to have more economic resources to supply the materials needed to maintain this type of business. She has been doing this work for her entire life and does not want to lose her business. This way of life provides the necessary income to provide for her and her family. Her dreams are that her tortillas continue to have the same quality and that she will have a variety of clients, since they are the reason her fame has spread for the excellent quality of her tortillas. Among her dreams she wishes to be able to visit another country, which she only knows from pictures. Mrs. Candida's economic activity is the production and sale of tortillas. Her business is located in her home. She has 40 years experience in her business, which she started on her own. She decided to establish her own business in her home after her mother taught her the trade in order to satisfy the need of her children. Candida offers her tortillas to her clients in the most favorable method, and as such has obtained fame with her neighbors and her clients. In addition to selling tortillas from her home, she decided to offer them on certain streets and improve her income for her and her family, since the price was a little higher. Now she needs financing for business capital that she needs to take advantage of the lower price of corn and maintain the raw materials needed to make tortillas.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Fati

texts.en:
Fati I. is married and has 3 children. She has received no formal education. Fati makes and sells a variety of cooking oil at Mpoben in Elmina, which she has done since 1990. Her husband is a carpenter.

Fati uses her income to help her husband in paying rent, utility bills, and other basic expenses of the family. Fati will use the loan to increase her capital to buy more ingredients for the making of the cooking oil she sells. With the new profits from her expanded business, Fati plans to invest in her children's education.

loans.use: to increase her capital to buy more ingredients for making oil

loans.name: Pabla

texts.es:
La señora Pabla R. T. es viuda, ella vive con su hijo, ellos tienen viviendo 24 años en su hogar. La señora Pabla tiene un negocio de venta de artículos escolares llamado “Papelería Paola” el cual lleva en funcionamiento 5 años y es su principal fuente de ingresos.
La señora Pabla R. está solicitando un préstamo para comprar mercancías para que de esta manera su negocio esté más surtido porque ella tiene muchos clientes. Esto le ayudará a que sus ventas se incrementen y pueda obtener más ingresos los cuales serán necesarios para poder mantener a su hijo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Pabla R. T. is a widow, she lives with her son, and they have 24 years living at their home. Mrs. Pabla has a business selling school supplies called "Papeleria Paola" which has been working for the past 5 years and is her main source of income. Mrs. Pabla R. is requesting a loan in order to buy merchandise to increase her inventory because she has high demand from her clients. This loan will help her increase her sales and obtain more profit to support her son.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Maria Auxiladora

texts.es:
La Señora María Auxiliadora Rodríguez S. tiene la edad de 51 años, su estado civil es casada, Doña María tiene 1 hijo de 15 años de edad y recientemente cursa el 4 año de secundaria, su compañero de vida labora por cuenta propia, sus propósitos son de  mantener su negocio activo por la situación actual ya que en el país se encuentra en una situación muy inestable sus sueños son de incrementar su inventario para ofertar una variedad de productos y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes sus deseos son obtener los suficientes ingresos para descansar de su trabajo ya que desde muy temprana edad ha luchado para conseguir una vida mejor para ella misma y su familia y así pueda descansar para su vejes ya que su hijo actualmente solo estudia y no trabaja por lo que quiere que sea un profesional que sea útil para la sociedad.

Su actividad económica es la venta de productos de mercadería en general y ofrece lo siguiente: juguetes, golosinas, ropa, zapatos, sandalias y productos del hogar, la ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 38 años, la historia del inicio de su negocio nace con el objetivo de apoyar en los gastos de su familia y ayudar a su hijo a salir adelante con sus estudios por lo que al principio inicio de forma ambulante ofreciendo la mercadería de casa en casa de las personas que eran sus vecinos y amigos debido a que esta idea era la mas factible por que así su mercadería estaría expuesta a los diferentes gustos de sus clientes pero debido a la edad y al paso del tiempo Doña María no podía seguir caminando a como empezó desde un principio por lo que decide establecerse en un lugar fijo a como lo fue su casa de habitación y siempre apoyada por su familia deciden establecer su negocio al inicio no podía acostumbrarse a la idea de mantener su mercadería en un solo lugar por lo que siempre estuvo en movimiento pero al paso del tiempo se fue acostumbrando y obtiene lo que actualmente posee de su negocio por lo que ahora pide un financiamiento  propuesto para capital de trabajo ya que necesita invertir en la comprar de útiles escolares ya que se acerca la entrada a clases y así podrá ofrecer lo que sus clientes necesitan.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Auxiliadora Rodríguez S. is 51 years old and married. Doña María has 1 son, who is 15 years old and recently started his 4th year of high school. Her husband has his own business. Her goals are to keep her business active given the actual economic climate, since her country is in a very unstable condition. Her dreams are to increase her inventory in order to offer a variety of products and satisfy client demand. She hopes to obtain sufficient income to retire, because she has been working since she was very young to have a provide a better life for herself and her family. She needs enough income to retire since her son is still only a student and does not work so that he can become a professional and be useful in society. María sells general merchandise and offers the following: toys, snacks, clothing, shoes, sandals, and housewares. She runs her business from her home, which she has done for 38 years. Her business was born with the goal of helping with the costs of living and to help her son get ahead in his studies. At first her business was an ambulatory format, offering merchandise door-to-door to her neighbors and friends. She thought this was the easiest way to do business becuase her merchandise was exposed to the different tastes of her clients. But, because of her age and the time it required, María could not continue walking. So she decided to establish a fixed location in her home. Her family has always been supportive of her decision. At first she could not get used to the ides of maintaining her store in a single location, since she had always been moving. Over time she became accustomed to the idea and benefits from the business she owns. Now she asks for a loan for business capital which she needs to invest in the purchase of school supplies since classes begin soon and she wants to offer what her clients need.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business Capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth C. is a widow and has 3 children. She has received schooling through junior high. Elizabeth makes and sells variety of cooking oils at Mpoben in Elmina, which she has done since 1996. Elizabeth uses her income to pay for rent, utility bills, and other financial expenses.

Elizabeth will use the loan to increase her capital to buy more ingredients for the making of the cooking oil for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Elizabeth plans to reinvest back into the business to increase her profit margin so as to meet the financial needs of her family.

loans.use: to increase her capital to buy more ingredients for the making of the cooking oil

loans.name: Claudia Esperanza

texts.es:
Claudia Esperanza S. Martínez tiene la edad de 39 años, su estado civil es casada, Doña Claudia no tiene hijos, su compañero de vida labora como carpintero y trabaja en un taller familiar, sus propósitos son mejorar sus condiciones económicas ya que este es el único medio de trabajo que le ha proporcionado lo necesario sus deseos son de establecer un salón de belleza con todas las condiciones adecuadas para que sus clientes estén satisfechos por el servicio brindado sus sueños son impartir clases de estética a personas con escasos recursos que no pueden optar por una carrera profesional y también en sus sueños esta concebir una hija para trasmitirles sus conocimientos como Madre y como una profesional en la materia de la estética.

Su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos y los servicios de estilista a domicilio, la ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 12 años, Doña Claudia inicia esta actividad después de obtener los conocimientos de estilismo en el salón de una amiga, sintiendo la necesidad de echar a la practica los conocimientos adquiridos y surge la idea de realizar este tipo de actividad a domicilio en las casas de sus amigas que requerían del servicio, posteriormente una amiga da la familia que posee un local aledaño al mercado La Estación le brinda la oportunidad de trabajar con ella en este salón y esto da la muestra para  darse a conocer con otro tipo de clientes dedicándose en lleno a llevar a cabo las metas propuestas es así que Doña Claudia no es solo una microempresaria mas, si no una profesional que contribuye en la satisfacción y el buen gusto de muchas personas que gustan de conservar un porte agradable y siendo además un contribuyente mas del sustento diario de su hogar, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que su uso será para la compra de productos de bellezas para aprovechar la temporada escolar y de verano ya que necesita realizar las compras de diferentes pinturas para ofrecer una amplia variedad de servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Claudia Esperanza S. Martínez is 39 years old and married without children. Her husband works as a carpenter in his own workshop-- his goals are to improve the family's financial situation through his work, as it is the only way he has been able to provide for his wife. Claudia would like to open a beauty salon with all of the necessary amenities to satisfy her clients. She additionally dreams of offering beauty-technician classes to those with limited resources who would otherwise not be able to pursue the career professionally. Also, Claudia would like to have a child with whom to share her life and professional experiences. Claudia sells cosmetic products and her services as a beauty technician. Her business is a traveling one, as she sells her products door-to-door and visits her clients at their homes. Claudia began this business 12 years ago after learning the trade of beauty technician. She began by visiting her clients at their homes, and later when offered the opportunity to work in a salon owned by a family friend she worked there as well. Working at the salon exposed Claudia to a greater flow of clients. Claudia is not only a micoentrepreneur, but also a professional who contributes to the satisfaction and happiness of others. She also contributes to supporting her family. The loan that she is requesting is to finance an investment in her inventory of beauty products so that she can have a wider variety of colors to offer to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products to sell

loans.name: Raymundo

texts.es:
El señor Raymundo R. H. vive con su esposa y su hijo, ellos tienen 30 años de vivir en su hogar, su hijo trabaja y apoya en los gastos de su casa, el señor Raymundo recibe ingresos por concepto de pensión los cuales son necesarios para mantener a su familia.
El señor Raymundo está solicitando un préstamo para reparar el techo de madera de su casa el cual ya no esta en buenas condiciones y esto podría provocar algún accidente.
Esta mejora a la vivienda del señor Raymundo permitirá que él y su familia puedan vivir más seguros en su hogar.
texts.en:
Mr. Raymundo R. H. lives with his wife and his son in a home they have had for for 30 years. His son works and contributes to the household expenses. Raymundo receives income from his pension, which he needs to support his family. Raymundo is seeking a loan to repair the wood roof of his home, which is not in good condition and could cause an accident. This improvement to Raymundo's home will allow him and his family to live more securely.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Reparar techo de madera

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Aproximadamente quince años es el tiempo que Julia ha dedicado a su negocio de comida. Anteriormente, trabajaba vendiendo ropa en un puesto alquilado. Sin embargo, no le era un negocio rentable ya que toda la ganancia solo le alcanzaba para la reinversión.

Ahora, junto a una de sus hijas prepara diferentes platos y los reparte a clientes fijos. No le va mal en su negocio, pero la subida de precios ha disminuido las ganancias y no permite que las ventas suban.

Junto a su esposo Julia siempre se ha dedicado a cuidar del bienestar de su familia y también a que la construcción de su casa se haga realidad. Hoy, a sus sesenta años le gustaría poner en un futuro otro negocio, tal vez un restaurante en su casa.
texts.en:
Julia has owned and operated her food business for the past 15 years. Before this, she sold clothes in a rented booth. Nevertheless, the clothing business was not profitable as she had to reinvest all of her profits into the business to maintain it. Now, along with her two daughters, Julia prepares food and delivers it to a fixed set of clients. The business is going fairly well, but the increase in food prices has diminished her earnings as she has not been able to increase her prices. Together with her husband Julia has always been dedicated to looking out for her family and striving to make the rebuilding of their house a reality. Today, at the age of 60, Julia would like to begin another business, possibly a restaurant in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for food business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
El papá de Irene, quien es comerciante, la animó hace muchos años a incursionar en este rubro. Hoy en día Irene se encarga de vender pabilos al por mayor y al por menor. Ala vez que ella ofrece a diferentes personas sus productos también recibe pedidos de clientes anteriores y frecuentes.

Siempre ha aprovechado las oportunidades que se le han presentado respecto a las ventas. Es por eso que ella afirma haber vendido de todo. En diciembre aprovecha las fiestas navideñas para vender arreglos navideños y lo mismo en época escolar, como un ejemplo de su empeño por trabajar.

Por ahora dice que le va bien sin tener un puesto propio para sus ventas porque dice que le va mejor así, pero en un futuro le gustaría comprar un local para manejar su negocio establemente. Es por eso que una parte de sus ganancias las ahorra.
texts.en:
Irene's father, a merchant, encouraged her to enter this field for many years. Today, Irene is in the wholesale and retail sale of candle wicks. At the same time as she offers different people her products, she also frequently receives orders from her previous clients.

She has always taken advantage of opportunities that have presented themselves with respect to her sales. It is for this reason that she has able to sell everything. In December she took advantage of the Christmas holidays to make Christmas arrangements and did the same in the school year. These are examples of her determination to work.

For now she says that everything is going well even though she does not have her own place for her sales because she says that it is better that way. But, in the future, she would like to buy a store to maintain her own stable business. It is for this that she saves a part of her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar mercadería

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es: Javier acaba de cumplir 30 años, lleva conviviendo con su pareja aproximadamente 12 años, su esposa y sus 3 hijos viven en la casa de su madre, vivienda que cuidan porque su madre vive en otra ciudad. Desde que migraron sus padres a otra ciudad se quedó ha cargo de todas las chacras, pero por falta de capital no puede sembrar como la hacia su padre, en grandes cantidades, pero tiene la ilusión de ir incrementando cada vez más sus cultivos de papa y arvejas.  Cultivar papa en esta temporada es muy bueno, pero como se ha elevado el precio de los fertilizantes ha sembrado solo 10 sacos de semilla, en esta próxima siembra sembrará 20 sacos, paralelo a acaba de sembrar una bolsa y media de arvejas, y ha guardado semilla para su otra chacra que va preparar, porque estos granos guardados mucho tiempo no producen bien. A Javier le agrada su actividad, la cual depende de las fechas en que siembran y cultivan para cosechar buenos frutos y sobre todo para que puedan tener buen precio. Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP, y ha juramentado en el cargo de secretario del banco comunal al que pertenece, comprometiendo a cumplir fielmente con todas las actividades, asimismo a incentivar que los demás socios efectúen los pagos en las fechas exactas. Con el dinero solicitado comprará 2 bolsas de semilla de arvejas y abono para la chacra de papa que tiene sembrada.
texts.en:
Javier just turned 30 years of age and has lived with his partner for about 12 years. His wife and his three children live in his mother's home, a home that they care for because his mother lives in another city. Since his parents moved to another city, he has been in charge of all of the farms, but, because of a lack of capital, he is not able to sow it like his father did, in large quantities. But, he has the hopes of increasing his potato and pea crops each time. It is very good to grow potatoes during this season, but, as the prices of fertilizers have increased, he has only sowed 10 sacks of seed. In this next season, he will sow 20 sacks. Aside from this, he just finished sowing one and a half bags of peas and he has kept seeds for his other farm that he is going to prepare because these grains do not produce well when kept for a long time. Javier enjoys his work which depends on the times when he sows and grows to harvest good products and, above all, to be able to have a good price. This is his fourth loan with MFP and he as been sworn in as the secretary of the community bank to which he belongs, committing to faithfully complete all of his activities and, at the same time, to motivate the other members to make their payments on time. With the money he is requesting, he will buy 2 bags of pea seeds and fertilizer for his father's farm that he has sown.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de semillas y abono

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Desde muy joven a Julia siempre le ha gustado trabajar, empezó trabajando como obrera en una empresa. Tiempo después ingreso a trabajar en un salón de belleza como cajera. Sin embargo, en este lugar no duro más de cinco años ya que no le alcanzaba tiempo para nada más. 

Luego de dejar este trabajo empezó a estudiar computación, a la par se dio cuenta que su madre necesitaba ayuda en su negocio de comidas, es por ello que decidió organizarme y aprovechar su tiempo al máximo.

Actualmente, por las mañanas trabaja preparando comida junto a su mamá y luego de repartir los pedidos a la hora de almuerzo se alista para seguir estudiando. Como una hija ejemplar ella destina casi todas las ganancias del negocio en sus estudios.

Más adelante le gustaría contar con un espacio en su casa para atender a los clientes
texts.en:
Since she was very young, Julia always has enjoyed working. She started working as an employee in a company.

Some time later, she started working in a beauty salon as a cashier. However, she did not last more than 5 years because this place did not leave her time to do anything else.

After living this job, she started studying computing, in part because she realized that her mother needed help in her food business and it was for this that she decided to organize herself and to best take advantage of her time.

Currently, in the mornings she works preparing food with her mother and later, after delivering the lunch hour orders, she prepares to continue studying. As an exemplary daughter, she puts almost all of her earnings from her work into her studies.

Later on, she would like to have a space in her house to serve clients.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tools for her business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Palm-Kernel Group

texts.en:
This group is composed of Isatu K., Alimany B. and John K.. They named their group Palm Kernel (the former leader of the group, James, used to sell palm kernels).  They are local entrepreneurs in the town of Magburaka, about fifteen miles from Makeni City. This is not the first loan they are receiving from Kiva through SMT. They have received previous loans which created meaningful impact in the lives of these borrowers. They were able to use the proceeds to pay for their children’s school fees.  They are also able to feed and clothe themselves and their children with the income generated from the loans.  Today, they are requesting a loan of Le 800,000 each to buy more goods to add to their businesses.

Isatu (middle) is the leader of the group. She is thirty-seven years of age. She was born in Kambia (155 miles or 249 km from Makeni and 179 miles or 288 km from Magburaka). Marriage brought her to Magburaka. Her husband, who was a businessman, too, had passed away. Isatu has five children, all of whom are going to school. The youngest is six and the oldest is fifteen. She sells pans, bowls, dishes, knifes, cups and spoons. She has been in this business for ten years now. 

With this new loan, Isatu will expand on his business. She reckons buying at least two dozen of bowls and two dozen of dishes. She will also buy additional number of spoons, cups and knifes. In Freetown (390 miles r/t), where she travels to buy these items, a dozen of bowls cost something between Le 50,000 to Le 70,000. Dishes cost something between Le 50,000 to Le 60,000. The fare to and from Freetown is Le 30,000, luggage inclusive. 

So far, Isatu is facing no noteworthy challenges in her business. She is doing fine in her business and likes doing it very much. With this loan and the income it will generate for her, Isatu will reinvest it into the business and uses the balance of profit in feeding and looking after her children.

loans.use: Buy at least two dozen of bowls and two dozen of dishes

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es:
A sus sesenta y un años, Olinda ha trabajado mucho en toda su vida y aun dice que tiene mucho por hacer a pesar de no encontrarse bien físicamente. Como madre soltera ella se ha dedicado desde joven a la crianza y manutención de sus cinco hijos.

En un inicio ella trabajo para el estado como cocinera y por las noches vendía lo que podía preparar en la puerta de su casa. Así fue como pudo darles educación a sus hijos. Después de muchos años, con el paso del tiempo y con sus hijos mas grandes se animó a ser comerciante en un mercado, donde se dedico mas de dos años a vender abarrotes. Con la ayuda de su hijo pudo administrar bien este negocio y creció rápidamente. No obstante, sus hijos crecieron y formaron también sus familias por lo que ya no pudo encargarse de este trabajo.

Por el contrario, una de sus hijas que vive en Italia la animo a tejer chompas para poder venderlas en el país donde ella se encuentra. Es así que por ahora se dedica a tejer chompas en invierno y polos en verano para venderlos en el extranjero con la ayuda de su hija.

Como no le va nada mal, dentro de poco quisiera abrir un taller de tejido en su casa para poder vender al por mayor.
texts.en:
At 71 years of age, Olinda has worked hard throughout her life and still says that she has much to accomplish, despite her declining health. As a single mother, Olinda raised and cared for her 5 children. At one time she worked for the government as a cook during the day, and at night sold what food she could cook from her doorstep. With such hard work Olinda was able to send her children to school. After many years, with the passing of time and now that her children are grown, Olinda would like to be a businesswoman in a market, where she sold groceries for over two years. With the held of her son she was able to manage her business well and it grew rapidly. Nevertheless, her children grew up and and formed her own families and could no longer help their mother with the business. On the other hand, one of Olinda's daughters who lives in Italy has sold her mother's sweaters for her in Italian markets. Because of this, for now Olinda will continue to knit sweaters to sell in Italy as it is winter time, and knit polos to sell during the summer. As things are going well, soon Olinda would like to open a knitting work shop in her house so that she can produce clothing in larger quantities.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies to make sweaters

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Al inicio ella trabajaba en un puesto de abarrotes, verduras y carnes. Hasta hace tres años que su esposo sufrió de un derrame cerebral, por lo que tuvo que abandonar su trabajo para dedicarse a su cuidado.

Luego de estar al cuidado de su esposo ella también cayo enferma, sin embargo esto no fue un problema para ella quien luego de reincorporarse a sus actividades diarias pensó que seria una mejor idea abrir un negocio en su propia casa.

Fue así que luego de un año se encarga de alquilar cabinas de Internet  y  también maneja un locutorio. Felizmente le va muy bien en su negocio, ha podido crecer lo suficiente para continuar con las mismas ganas de seguir trabajando.

Las ganancias ella lo invierte en el mantenimiento de sus equipos y también para su casa, mas adelante esta pensado comprar una maquina fotocopiadora.
texts.en:
At first she was working in a stand that sold general items, vegetables, and meat. 3 years ago her husband suffered a brain hemorrhage and she had to leave her work to take care of him full time. After being the caretaker and nurse for her husband, which was not a problem for her, she reincorporated herself to her daily activities and thought it would be a good idea to open a business in her own home. After a year she began renting internet booths and managing a telephone booth. Happily, her business is going well. It has grown sufficiently for her to continue with the same income that she would have upon returning to work. The earnings she invests in equipment maintenance and also for her home. She is thinking about purchasing a photocopier in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a photocopier

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Orbelina

texts.es:
La Emprendedora Orbelinda R. S. tiene la edad de 50 años su estado civil es casada, Doña Orbelinda tiene 4 hijos de los cuales todos son mayores de edad y trabajan por cuenta propia su edades son las siguientes un varón de 31 años casado, una mujer de 27 años actualmente trabaja un varón de 28 años trabaja y un su hijo menor de 22 años que también trabaja, su compañero de vida labora en un taller de vulcanización, sus propósitos son de mantener la actividad económica ya que este es el único medio  de trabajo que ella posee y no le gustaría perderlo ya que por medio de este pudo satisfacer las necesidades de sus hijos sus sueños son de que sus hijos siempre se mantengan unidos debido a las difíciles situaciones que cada uno de ellos se ayuden mutuamente ya que ella les enseño a ser humildes y generosos sus deseos son que sus productos sean exportados al exterior para comprobar que la calidad de su trabajo es la mejor y pueda de esta forma obtener mas ingresos para su familia.

Su actividad económica es un taller de costura, la ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 37 años, Doña Orbelinda inicia este negocio por la necesidad de obtener un ingreso par su familia ya que tenia la responsabilidad de proporcionarles a sus hijos educación, vestimenta y techo y fue así como empezó a dedicarse a este oficio como lo fue la venta de algunas prendas de vestir como fueron: faldas, camisas y shorts y así empezó a ofrecer sus prendas que ella misma elaboraba y fue así como fue adquiriendo experiencia y clientela y mas tarde decide incrementar su negocio y lo logra por medio de mano ayuda de la Fundación León 2000 y las organizaciones amigas así obtuvo su préstamo para lograr sus propósitos mas tarde decide realizar la compra de maquinas de coser para aumentar su producción pero necesitaba mas apoyo y esto la conlleva a realizar otro financiamiento propuesto para capital de trabajo que será utilizado para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de faldas de vestir, vestidos y tras prendas ya que tiene que viajar hasta Managua por lo que aquí le resulta mas favorable la compra y agradece a las organizaciones amigas y a la fundación León 2000 ya que fue el vínculo de la unión para que sus propósitos se realicen.
texts.en:
The business woman Orbelinda R. S. is 50 years old and married. Orbelinda has four adult children who work to support themselves. They include: a 31 year old married man, a 27 year old woman, a 28 year old man, and a 22 year old man. Her husband works at an industrial workshop. Her goal is to maintain this source of income because it is his only means of work and she would not like to lose it until they have fulfilled all of the needs of their children. Her dream is for her children to always stay united and that each of them will help each other in difficult situations. She has taught them to be humble and generous. Her desire is for her products to be exported, which will prove the high quality of her products and earn more income for her family. Orbelinda's job is at a sewing shop in which the nature of the business is traveling. She has had the business for 37 years. Orbelinda started this business to earn income for her family because she had the responsibility to provide her children with education, shelter, and clothes; she began to work in this trade by selling various items of clothing: skirts, shirts, and shorts. Accordingly, she began to gain experience and a clientele. Later, she decided to increase her business by receiving help from Fundacion Leon 2000 and other friendly organizations. She obtained a loan to carry out her proposals and later decided to buy sewing machines to increase the production. However, she needed more help and with this, she realized she needed more financial aid. She will use the loan to purchase basic materials to make skirts, dresses, and other clothes so that she can travel to Managua where she can find more sales. She appreciates these friendly organizations and la fundacion Leon 2000 for helping her family achieve their goals.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment capital

loans.name: Kreiver

texts.es: Kreiver tiene 47 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos. La casa donde viven es propia. Se dedica al transporte de pasajeros desde hace 10 años con su motocarro, gracias a su buena administración del dinero ahora es propietario de dos motocarros, los cuales favorecen a fortalecer la economía de su hogar. Con el ingreso que tiene de ambos motocarros apoya a su cónyuge, quién se dedica al a la venta de granos en un puesto del mercado. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es conocer muchos lugares y muchas personas. Este es su 6to préstamo con MFP, y con el dinero que solicita reparará uno de sus motocarros ya que se encuentra en mal estado, para ello requiere comprar repuestos y algunas piezas necesarias para en buen funcionamiento de su herramienta de trabajo.
texts.en:
Kreiver is 47 and lives with his wife and 3 children. They live in their own home. He has transported passengers for 10 years in his motorcycle rickshaw. Thanks to his good money management, he now owns two motorcycle rickshaws, which helps his family's financial situation. With the income from these, he supports his wife, who sells grains at a stand in the market. What he likes about his job is that he gets to meet a lot of people and see a lot of places. This is his sixth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money he is requesting, he will repair one of his motorcycles since it is in bad shape. For this he needs to buy parts and some necessary pieces so his work tool will work well.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair his motorcycle rickshaw

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
Hace doce años aproximadamente que Fortunata dedica gran parte de su tiempo a prepara y vender frituras por las noches en la puerta de su casa. Su rutina empieza a partir de las cinco de la tarde. Por las mañanas ella se dedica a su casa y en parte a descansar.

Anteriormente ella vendía embutidos en un mercado, pero a su edad ella siente que ya no puede hacer tanto esfuerzo físico, y solo se dedica a vender por las noches. Ahora que sus  hijos son independientes solo se preocupa por mantener los gastos de la casa y de ella.

Aunque en su actual trabajo le vaya bien, ella quisiera abrir una tienda en su casa, pues de todos modos el cocinar sigue requiriendo mucho esfuerzo de su parte.
texts.en:
For nearly twelve years, Fortunata has prepared and sold fried foods at night in front of her home. Her routine begins after five o’clock in the afternoon. In the mornings, she is devoted to her home and partly to rest. Previously, she sold sausages in a market; however, at her age she feels that she can no longer exert as much physical effort and only sells at night. Now that her children are independent, she is only concerned about the cost of maintaining housing costs and her own personal costs. Although her current work is doing well, she would like to open a store in her home because cooking still requires much effort on her part.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase the basics that she needs for her business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jiovanni

texts.es: Jiovanni tiene 35 años, vive con su pareja y sus 3 hijos en la casa de su padre. Ella tiene un negocio de venta de pan en las instalaciones de su vivienda, inició esta actividad hace 3 años y le va muy bien, se encuentra ubicada en un sitio muy acogedor y bastante concurrido. Jiovanni quiere surgir y salir adelante, le pone mucho entusiasmo a sus actividades, le gusta tratar directamente con sus clientes. Lo bueno de este negocio es que ingresos diarios. Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP, con el dinero que solicita quiere mandar a construir un kiosco, y desde luego adquirir más panes.
texts.en:
Jiovanni is 35 years old, lives with her partner and their three children in her father’s house. She has a business selling bread on the premises of her house. She started this activity three years ago and is doing very well. They are located in a site that is very friendly and quite busy. Jiovanni wants to emerge and move forward. She brings much enthusiasm to her activities, and she likes to work directly with customers. The good thing about this business is the daily income. This is her third loan with MFP. With the money, she wants to build a kiosk and then buy more bread.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To construct a kiosk for her business

loans.name: Clementina

texts.es:
Clementina se encarga de atender un puesto en el mercado donde, además de vender frutas, también vende jugos y bebidas. El negocio hoy en días ya tiene diez años. Empezó solamente vendiendo frutas pero como se dio cuenta de que no había nadie que vendiera jugos, ella se animo a hacerlo dos años después.

La idea de tener un trabajo propio nació a raíz de que tuvo problemas en sus estudios universitarios. Cursando la carrera de Nutrición se dio cuenta que no podía continuar estudiando, ya que tenia problemas económicos. 

Con un puesto alquilado y trabajando de seis de la mañana a ocho de la noche es como Clementina se gana la vida, con el fin de mantener a sus dos menores hijos. Dentro de poco piensa mudar su local a otro lugar con mayor tránsito.
texts.en:
Clementina is in charge of managing a market stall where, in addition to selling fruits, she carries juices and beverages. The business has now existed for ten years. She only started out selling fruit but realized that there was no one selling juices and was encouraged to do so two years later. The idea of having her own job was thought up of when she was having problems with her university studies. She was pursuing a career in Nutrition when she realized that she could not continue studying because she had financial problems. With a rented stall and working from six in the morning to eight at night, Clementina makes a living in order to maintain her two younger children. Soon she is thinking of moving her location to another area with greater traffic.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase kitchen utensils for her juice stand

loans.name: Lleny

texts.es: Lleny tiene 40 años, es madre de 4 hijos, vive con su pareja en su casa propia. Tiene un negocio de venta de bebidas (cervezas y gaseosas), inició esta actividad hace 2 años y le va muy bien, porque se encuentra en un sitio muy concurrido. Ella quiere surgir y salir adelante, espera que en el futuro su negocio se convierta en lugar conocido y de mucha concurrencia. Le gusta su trabajo porque conoce a muchas personas y ya cuenta con clientes fieles. Este es su 5to préstamo con MFP, con el dinero que ha solicitado comprará más gaseosas y cervezas para la venta.
texts.en:
Lleny is 40, is the mother of 4 children, and lives with her husband in their own home. She has a business of selling beverages (beer and soft drinks). She started it 2 years ago, and it's going very well because it is located in a very busy area. She wants to rise up and get ahead. She hopes that in the future her business will become a well-known place that is very busy. She likes her job because she meets a lot of people, and she already has loyal customers. This is her fifth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money that she is requesting, she will buy more soft drinks and beer to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the amount of products she sells

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel tiene 34 años, vive con sus 2 hijos en edad escolar y con su pareja quien la apoya en todo. La vivienda que habitan es propia. Se dedica a la venta de zapatos y ropa desde hace 4 años, su esposo es trabajador independiente (chofer) y la apoya mucho en su negocio movilizándola de un lugar a otro para llevar a vender sus prendas. Isabel se levanta muy temprano para preparar toda su mercadería y llevarla por los diferentes lugares de su zona. Generalmente vende todo lo que tiene, y sus clientes espera su llegada para comprarle lo que necesitan y hacerle más pedidos. Este es su 4to préstamo con MFP, con la cantidad que solicita comprará más zapatos y ropa, posteriormente le gustaría mandar a construir un local para su negocio.
texts.en:
Isabel is 34 and lives with her 2 school-aged children and her husband, who supports her in everything. They own their own home. She has sold shoes and clothing for 4 years. Her husband works independently as a driver and supports her a lot with her business by driving her from place to place to take her to sell her products. Isabel gets up very early to prepare all of her merchandise and to take it to different places in her area. Usually she sells everything she has, and her customers wait for her arrival to buy what they need from her and to place more orders. This is her fourth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With it, she will purchase more shoes and clothing. Later she would like to have a location constructed for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Desde que tenia diecisiete años, luego de haber estudiado corte y confección Rosa empezó a trabajar en una galería para otra persona. Una vez que se comprometió con su esposo y tuvo su primer hijo a la edad de veintiún años, empezó a ofrecer el servicio de confección y compostura de ropa.

Poco a poco ha ido adquiriendo mas clientes. No necesita ofrecer sus servicios de puerta en puerta pues ya la mayoría de personas por su casa la conoce. Ahora, el pequeño estudio donde atiende a sus clientes se ha convertido también en una tienda donde vende juguetes y también gaseosas y cerveza.

Gracias a su trabajo y al trabajo de su esposo, quien trabaja como obrero en una imprenta, han podido comprar un terreno y construir su casa.
texts.en:
When she was 17 years old and learning to be a seamstress, Rosa started working in someone's shop. Then she got engaged to her husband and had her first child at the age of 21, when she started to offer tailoring services and clothing repair. Little by little, she started gaining more clients. She did not have to go door to door to solicit her services because she already knew most of the people. Now, her son studies where she does her business, where she also sells little toys, sodas, and beer. Thanks to her job and the work of her husband, who works at a printing press, they have been able to buy land and build their own house.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric for her job

loans.name: Hellen Teresa

texts.es:
Hellen es una joven madre de dos hijos. Uno de once años y el segundo, de cinco. Su profesión es la docencia para niños en educación inicial. Hace seis años que trabaja en un nido cerca de su casa. 

No obstante, a raíz de que una amiga le comentó que vendiendo cosméticos se puede contar con un ingreso extra para la economía del hogar, ella se anima a inscribirse en una empresa de cosméticos para poder venderlos ella también por medio de la muestra de catálogos. Es así que desde hace tres años vende y también es profesora de inicial.
Su pareja es vendedor en una empresa hidráulica. Más adelante ambos piensan abrir una tienda.
texts.en:
Hellen is a young mother of two children: the first is 11 years old and the second is 5 years old. She works as a teacher for pre-school kids. She has worked at a nursery close to her house for the past 6 years. However, on the recommendation of a friend who told her that selling cosmetics can make her some extra income to pay household bills, she was encouraged to join a cosmetics business that sells through showing catalogs. She has done this for three years while being a pre-school teacher at the same time. Her husband is a salesman at a hydro-electric business. In the future, they both think of opening their own shop.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of merchandise she sells

loans.name: Yungueñitas Group

texts.es: El grupo “Yungueñitas” se encuentran cursando su primer ciclo y esta representada por la señora Mercedes Angélica. Todas las socias residen en el mismo barrio y se dedican a actividades comerciales como la venta D. dulces, ropa, masitas, tienda D. abarrotes, zapatos y celulares, la competencia es muy fuerte en este  rubro ya que venden ropa D. importación china, colombiana y brasilera situación que afecta D. gran manera a la producción nacional. El destino del crédito es para el incremento del capital D. trabajo para incrementar su mercadería y permitir el crecimiento D. sus fuentes D. ingreso.  Las Socias tienen experiencia en grupos solidarios ya que trabajaron con otras instituciones parecidas a la Fundación Agrocapital por lo que conocen del manejo y administración D. los recursos otorgados, así como la responsabilidad que se requiere para cumplir con los pagos a tiempo.
texts.en:
The group "Yungueñita" is represented by Ms Mercedes Angélica. All of the members live in the same neighborhood and work as vendors of sweets, clothing, pastries, groceries, shoes and cellular phones. Competition is very strong in this business sector, especially with the sale of clothing imported from China, Columbia and Brazil, which highly affects national production. The loan money is intended for the growth of capital so as to increase merchandise and allow for the growth of income. The members have experience in solidarity work with other similar institutions, like Fundación Agrocapital, who manage and administer donated resources. They believe their experience has given them the responsibility required to meet payment deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating Capital

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 40 años, vive con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos quienes la animan  a seguir adelante. Ella vende postres (piononos, chifón, y otras variedades de dulces) y panes integrales de una marca muy reconocida en su región que le deja los productos a consignación. Se dedica a esta actividad hace 2 años, repartiendo por los distintos lugares de su zona a sus diferentes clientes. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que muchas personas degustan de estos dulces, además conoce muchos lugares y socializa, ya tiene una buena gama de clientes y solo trabaja a pedido. Este es su 6to préstamo con MFP, y con el dinero solicitado comprará más dulces, también adquirirá una vitrina para exhibirlos de manera segura.
texts.en:
Rosa is 40 years old, and lives with her husband and their four children who inspire her to get ahead. She sells pastries such as piononos (bite-sized cream-filled pastries), chiffon cakes and other types of sweets, and whole grain breads of a well-known brand name in her region that are left on consignment. She has been dedicated to this work for two years, delivering to her different clients throughout the various areas of her community. What she likes about her work is that many people enjoy these sweets, and furthermore she gets to know many places and socializes, since she has a wide range of clients and only works by the order. This is the sixth loan with MFP, and with the funds she is requesting she will buy more sweets, and will also acquire a showcase to better display her products.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in the range of products that she sells

loans.name: Demesia

texts.es:
Demesia es un apersona muy trabajadora, con el fin de poder mantener y educar a sus seis hijos ella siempre ha visto el modo de generar ingresos trabajando en lo que estaba a su alcance. Antes de dedicarse al negocio que actualmente maneja, ella vendió abarrotes por una temporada y luego verduras.  

Como vio que el negocio de las verduras no era rentable, se le ocurrió poner un pequeño restaurante en su casa. Desde hace dos años que ella ofrece, con la ayuda de su menor hija, caldo de gallina a partir de las seis de la tarde. Poco a poco ha ido creciendo hasta poder comprar los muebles necesarios para atender bien a sus clientes.

Gracias a su trabajo ella vela por los alimentos en su casa, el esposo por su lado, mantiene los gastos propios del hogar. Dentro de unos meses ella quisiera abrir un local para inaugurar un restaurante más. Por ahora esta viendo como puede costearlo.
texts.en:
Demesia is a very hard-working person, and her aim is to be able to support and educate her six children. She has always found a way to earn a living working from whatever means have been available. Before working at the business she now runs, she sold groceries for one season and later vegetables. Seeing that the vegetable business was not profitable, it occurred to her to put a small restaurant in her house. For two years and with the help of her younger daughter, she has been offering 'caldo de gallina' (chicken soup) starting at 6 p.m. Little by little the business has been growing so that it's been possible to buy the necessary furniture to serve the customers well. Thanks to her work she takes care of the household food, her husband by her side, and keeps up with the home expenses. Within a few months she would like to open and inaugurate one more restaurant at another locale. Right now she is looking into how much this may cost.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wholesale supplies for her business

loans.name: Nueva Tilata Group

texts.es: El grupo “ Nueva Tilata “ se encuentra cursando su tercer ciclo y representado por el señor Edgar quien es el único varón del grupo, el al igual que sus compañeras D. grupo es un hombre trabajador y honesto como lo han demostrado en sus anteriores ciclos. Los socios (as) se dedican a actividades como el transporte público urbano, a la venta D. ropa, celulares, una mayoría tienen puestos D. venta D. material escolar en las calles y en las ferias D. la ciudad. La competencia en este rubro es muy fuerte por lo que necesitan el crédito para incrementar su mercadería y hacer crecer sus negocios para mejorar la calidad D. vida D. sus familias como ya lo han ido haciendo con anterioridad con los financiamientos otorgados por la fundación Agrocapital.
texts.en:
The group "Nueva Tilata" is completing its third loan cycle and is represented by Edgar, who is the only man in the group. He along with his colleagues in the group are hard-working and honest as demonstrated by their previous loan cycles. The group members work at activities such as urban public transport, clothing sales, cellular phones, and a majority have jobs selling school supplies in the streets and in city markets. The abilities of this group are very strong and so they require the loan to increase their merchandise. This will grow their businesses and in this way will improve the quality of life for their families, which has already been happening with the financing previously granted by the Agrocapital foundation.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating Capital

loans.name: Primitivo

texts.es: Primitivo tiene 63 años de edad, vive con su esposa y uno de sus 4 hijos. La casa donde viven es propia. Él se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad en su propio domicilio desde hace 31 años, gracias a este negocio se compró un motocarro, con el que trabaja uno de sus hijos durante las tardes haciendo taxi, asimismo cuenta con un pequeño local de venta de bebidas. Primitivo mantiene abierto su negocio casi todo el día y lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dar una buena atención a sus clientes  y que ve producir de una forma ascendente su negocio. Este es su 6to crédito en MFP, y con el dinero que solicita comprará mercadería para su negocio de abarrotes y ambientará con mesas y sillas para la venta de sus bebidas.
texts.en:
Primitivo is 63 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and one of his four children. He has worked for 31 years selling groceries and related products from his home. Thanks to this business he was able to buy a car, which one of his sons drives as a taxi in the afternoons. He also owns a small stall selling drinks. Primitivo keeps his business open almost the entire day, and he enjoys providing good service to his customers and seeing his business grow. This is his sixth loan with MFP, and he will use the money to buy merchandise for his grocery store, and to install tables and chairs for selling his drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Loreta

texts.es:
Durante muchos años, Loreta se ha dedicado a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo. Aunque ha ido variando la marca ella se mantuvo en su negocio y a sus clientes también. Gracias a su empeño y a su astucia ha sabido aprovechar de las promociones que las empresas de cosméticos le brindaban para poder generar mayores ganancias. 

Cuando su hijo menor creció le dio la idea de alquilar cabinas de Internet en su casa, y así lo hizo. Y es así, con la ayuda de el, que puede manejar sus dos negocios.

Loreta siempre a sido muy trabajadora, cuando era joven gracias a su trabajo como obrera en una empresa particular pudo construir su casa junto con la ayuda de su esposo. Con el paso del tiempo ese empeño no ha disminuido y aun continúa planeando como puede crecer en sus dos negocios actuales.
texts.en:
Loreta has worked for many years selling beauty products by catalogue. Although she has changed the brands that she sells, she has maintained her business and her customers. Thanks to her determination and astuteness she has taken advantage of the promotions offered by cosmetic companies to generate greater earnings. When her youngest son grew up he suggested that she open an internet cafe in her home, and so she did. With her son's help she is able to manage her two businesses. Loreta has always been a very hard-worker. When she was young, thanks to her job in a private company, she was able to build her own home together with support from her husband. Over the years this determination has not diminished, and she still continues to plan how she can grow her two current businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her cosmetics business

loans.name: Jerry

texts.es: Jerry tiene 32 años de edad, vive con sus 2 hijos y su pareja quienes lo incentivan a seguir adelante. La casa donde vive es propia. Se dedica al transporte de pasajeros, es chofer desde hace 10 años atrás, y gracias a su buena administración del dinero ahora es propietario de un motocarro, ganancias que le ayudan al sostenimiento de su hogar, con estos ingresos también apoya a su esposa quién se dedica a la venta de comida por las noches, (salchichas con papas fritas). Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es conocer a mucha gente con quienes comparte amenas conversaciones y además no tiene un horario de trabajo establecido. Este es su 6to préstamo con MFP, y con el dinero que solicita mandará a reparar su motocarro para que pueda trabajar tranquilo, posteriormente  quiere comprarse otro motocarro.
texts.en:
Jerry is 32 years old and lives with his two children and his wife, all of whom encourage him to advance. He lives in his own house. He has transported passengers as a chauffer for the past 10 tears, and thanks to his good financial management skills he now owns a motorcycle taxi. The earnings from the mototaxi help him support his household and also support his wife, who sells meals during the evenings (sausages with fried potatoes). What he likes about his job is getting to know many people with whom he can share pleasant conversations and not having a set work schedule. This is his sixth loan with MFP. With the money he is requesting, he will send his mototaxi out for repair so that he can work in peace. Later, he hopes to buy another mototaxi.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Jardin De Rosas Group

texts.es: El grupo “Jardin de Rosas” se encuentra cursando su primer ciclo representado por la señora Nelcy ella al igual que sus compañeras residen en el mimo barrio de la ciudad de El Alto y se dedican a actividades comerciales de venta de ropa, zapatos, mantas artesanales en ferias de la ciudad. La competencia en el rubro comercial de prendas de vestir es muy fuerte por las importaciones de ropa de otros países, por lo que las socias requieren de materiales de primera calidad para poder competir en el mercado, es por esta situación que requieren el financiamiento de la Fundación Agrocapital para poder elabora con su apoyo productos de mas alta calidad y mejorar de esa forma sus ingresos para poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Los socios (as) tienen experiencia en grupos solidarios ya que participaron en otros grupos con anterioridad dentro de la misma Fundación, por lo que conocen la forma de trabajo y la puntualidad que se requiere para estar en un grupo bien conformado.
texts.en:
The "Rose Garden" group is in its first cycle represented by Nelcy, who lives in the same neighborhood in the city of El Alto as her fellow group members. They sell clothes, shoes, and handcrafted blankets at fairs around the city. Competition in the garment business is very strong because of the importing of clothing from other countries, therefore the members require high quality materials to compete in the marketplace. They need financing from Foundation Agrocapital to make high quality products and thus improve their incomes and give their families a better quality of life. The members have prior experience in supportive groups, as they have participated in other groups within the Foundation; they know the type of work and the time it takes to be a well-formed group.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to produce high quality clothing products.

loans.name: Maura Estela

texts.es:
En el Mercado la Estación de la ciudad de León, la señora Maura Estela P. se dedica a su negocio de elaboración de alimentos preparados por ella misma y ofertados en el mercado.

Es importante destacar que  ella se ha caracterizado por elaborar deliciosos alimentos y por este motive las personas le visitan diariamente para comprarle.
